Ytq1HaAK4Dc84UnShCnI6g.review_text: I love this place.  It's small and cute.  The food is good and the Bloody Mary's are awesome!

YnyguOkiSAeF4EwKJ4TAVA.review_text: My friend and I were in SF for a weekend staying at my brothers house in North Beach - we ended up walking to union square for shopping and on our way back we were ready for some beer and food...  They have a huge beer selection! This is a major plus for me. The bartenders are really nice. The outdoor seating was way to crowded so we ended up sitting at the bar.   It has a good mix of people for the financial district. Walking down the alley to get to the restaurant kind of threw us off - we were not sure what to expect - but it is worth the trip down the alley..

siHT0p1PAGFtrbbZHTMhyg.review_text: I love coming here to hang out with friends or my love. It's a nice place to relax and be casual. The fish and chips is still one of my favoriates. I still remember the first time I came here and had a shepards pie. From that moment, I just fell in love. Yes, this place can get rudy and sometimes dirty, but I will come here night or day.

qVKPE3u1AKFsAg40I9HXZw.review_text: Natatandaan ko nung bata pa ako, lagi kaming pumupunta dito. Nag-iinuman, nagsasayawan. Pero sandali, hindi pala nung bata ako kasi illegal un diba? Tama nung bente-uno na ako! Pero ang natatandaan ko sa lugar na ito, ay lagi silang puno ng mga tao. Ok lang naman. Popular na lugar pero sakin 3 stars lang sila. Walang masyadong espesyal sa lugar na ito. Okay lang.

W72ku9jKHDLi4PJ4Wj9KdA.review_text: This was the Second stop for me on my Drinking Thursdays.  This place really wasnt my cup of tea, but my friend chose this place cause it was close to her work.    We had the nachos and I had an Anchor Steam.  Cant go wrong with that combo.  At least it was a really nice day to be hanging out outside.  When everyone else showed up, we ended up leaving and headed to Thirsty Bear.  All in all, this place isnt bad.  I would just prefer a different atmosphere.  = )

Dx12eeCMRpEMCuiFOLTYwg.review_text: Hit the spot! So maybe I had one or three too many beers the night before. But San Francisco seem particularly bright and noisy on Sunday morning. So head pounding and stomach doing its own thing I headed to find some starchy comfort food to take the edge off.   I know, maybe I am shallow, but I also have a thing about women with an Irish accent. So I just about forgot about the blinding lights and fuzzy teeth when the gal behind the bar soothed away my cares just by speaking. Sigh! Marry me? Keep talking, I don't care what you say, it just sounds so good!   That aside, the food was good. Reasonable portions, hot and well prepared for simple pub food.   A great place to hang your head and contemplate the night before even better taking another hit of the hair of the dog and the world looks a lot more of a rosy place!

EdRtuOYx3_2kHGl6Y42EOQ.review_text: The last time I was here was a year ago and I've been craving it ever since. I'd drive the hour and a half just for the shepards pie. The beers are good, guiness perfect poured. I really like the alley way and also the old fashion sewing machine turned into a table, Hella bad ass

hOMD76CaTqctcwNWax2qnA.review_text: Been there a few times, but never when its packed. Good beers, GREAT food from what I've seen. Shepherd's Pie usually comes quickly - its always piping hot and filled with savory, meaty, potatoey goodness that I shovel in my mouth as quickly as I can.   My friend has had the Irish breakfast and it seems like a lot of good food, perfect for a cold afternoon. The only thing I don't recommend is the Ploughman's platter or something like that - its some random salad, slices of cheese, and bread.   People working there seem friendly, service speed is normal. Food comes pretty quickly in general, which makes this a great spot for a quick lunch and beer.

1COrnp000xLM8B2CkOFu6w.review_text: I'll be honest, I was at Beer 39 and Rogue Ale Public House for many hours before arriving at the Irish Bank Bar.  I recall very attentive bar tenders, a couple good ales and way too many Jameson Irish Whisky's.   I was a wreck leaving here and vaguely remember the walk back to the Intercontinental Hotel.  I had a great time (I think) but paid dearly for it the next day.

XQ3-hFIVeVazv1af0E8Dqg.review_text: Went there for a couple of drinks. Nothing special

cz76cbJvk-ZLVTofNff0XA.review_text: Cool pub with tons of good brews on tap and centrally located. Gets pretty packed around happy hour, which leads to standing around outside, because it's to hot inside, but they won't let you stand around outside with your drink, you actually  have to sit, even if there are no actual seats---so problem ensues. But if you snag a seat in the alley, it has a very brew-ha-ha feel and is tons of fun.

fSmXUGC6OUawKb1O_trKjQ.review_text: It's an Irish pub without Killian's.  I went as part of a big group, and the wait staff stopped by once in a blue moon. I had to stand and gesticulate like a palsied mime to attract a server's attention and get a drink. A lot of us paid on our own, and we all contributed to the group tab, but ultimately their bill was way, way above our calculations.   Overall not a very pleasant experience - I expect we'll be taking the group elsewhere next time.

B7ecAeAIrXg7sgmabS38pg.review_text: "Wait, were you there?"  This was the answer I got when I turned around just now to ask my now one year older birthday co-worker what the name of this place was. Yes, Drunky Magoo, I was there and happy birthday.  A gang of drunkees came here last night after throwing quite a few back at Azul's happy hour. It was my first time here and on the whole, I liked it. It was a charming little joint with fun photos on the wall. My fave was of Queen Elizabeth in a McDonald's outfit. It's nice to see she is a woman of the peoples.   I also liked that we came in and totally took over the place (including said bday girl noshing off of someones plate who wasn't even in our party) and nobody seemed to mind. The service was prompt and had a sense of humor about the drunken state of affairs and that is always nice when you are ripped by 9pm on a Thursday night. Ahhh, the life of yelpers.  As for the food, i have to deduct a hefty few points for the mac n cheese. Yuck! This thing tasted like what I imagine glue or paste might taste like. Bland, boring and just kinda there, which was disappointing since it looked promising. I also ordered the Reuben and it was okay, but i think the thing to order here is something like fish n chips or a banger or more traditional pub fare. Those dishes looked tasty.  Over all, it was a cool little place down an alley and usually that's where the best times are found. Just ask Hugh Grant.

KeGuLjr8x_VDsHspDfrnZw.review_text: Cool patio. Might give it another try because this time was a total fail. I think only one server for the entire (large) patio. Maybe someone called in sick, I like to give the benefit of the doubt. Never did get the drink I ordered. Then took 20 minutes for the check.

jWuVMOXMElko1pt-051CNQ.review_text: This bar is definitely a hidden gem in SF.  Walking in, you feel like you're in an authentic Irish pub in Dublin.  Can't say anything about the food (we didn't order any) but the abundance of whiskey and beer choices alone make this place fantastic. Shout-out to Mark the bartender-  really knows how to make a drink and make you feel welcome (Hey Mark - go HB!) :) Can't wait to go back !

iVMg8r0oQIMhG3azjJ5RDQ.review_text: Good beer, awesome food, and great staff; what else do ya want from them?  the interior is quite charming  and love the patio! I'm a smoker, so outside seating area is perfect!  their fish and chips is yummmm

49aCB1D8ga70-57ZR7KhjA.review_text: This place is awesome. The perfect spot for dinner and drinks after a long day at work.  The outdoor seating is amazing, and it has the perfect combo of casual and classy. True pub atmosphere, and the fish and chips are amazing!

tI0BPPF_AhOkXJJ9KQOA2Q.review_text: Unimpressive in every way.   Fish and chips...fish nice sized but breading was soggy and seperated from fish, cold flavorless fries.  Reuben had alomst no flavor. Kraut was not even noticeable. 1000 island was not homemade. Cole slaw was wet and bland.   Wait staff looked as depressed and uninteresting as the food tasted. We were waiting to leave...  :(

KugEd7KcorZ0xLR1l3zFFg.review_text: Created an account just to share this.. Left this place earlier after making the bartender aware of the short, curly hair I found in my Shepard's Pie midway through.. Sent it back. No apologizes, no replacement, no comp, simply, "Oh. That's disgusting." Will probably never go back.

4e8OFbG7Miza_XT3C2DzDQ.review_text: Boddington's on tap and Curry Fries... I was sold within 5 minutes of sitting down. They also had a decent sized menu, and the service was great. Our food and drinks were brought out quickly, and our drinks were refilled promptly. Greatly enjoyed sitting outside in their patio area, although the inside is quite nice as well. I'll definitely come back next time I'm in the city...

Bfy3F4sf8G4eXpG64EuijA.review_text: I hosted a private party in the dining room last night and it was perfect!  Stephanie was an absolute joy to work with, the service was excellent, and I heard great compliments about the food (though I was running around and too busy to try anything).  If you're looking for a cozy/fun space for around 50 people and an establishment who is amazing to work with, look no further!

ZQByTm8o0nVEmyvJuHB1bw.review_text: I wish I would have found this place earlier in the night AND in my life!  I've been to a few pubs out in the states, but this is so far on my top list.  Ever since I went to Ireland, I have fallen in love with Irish pubs.  Something about the atmosphere is extremely relaxing yet lively at the same time.   At there late in the evening but there was quite a bit of people in and out of the bar.  The patio area is nice, not sure if they have heaters in the winter but the summer, drinks there must be amazing. Their menu looked delicious but I didn't get a chance to try much.  I wanted to try them all even though I do not eat meat.  The Fish n Chips looked really appetizing.    The downside to sitting on the patio is that it is hard to get service.  It's perfect for large groups and parties. For a more intimate experience, sitting at the bar or inside is probably best.  All in all, I recommend this place.  Kind of hard to find but worth it.  Hopefully I will be able to make it there for St. Patty's Day and have a Guinness!!

3S53VaMDPy8Lywk2TuPb4A.review_text: A nice place to have a couple of beers. Overall, the staff is friendly. At time, they appear to be a little hurried as if there might not be quite enough staff on. But it is still one of San Francisco's better pubs. The patio is great. and there potato skins are very good. Decent pub food all around.

BP_8Wpee-Wyu4dgFs8pqYQ.review_text: I went here for dinner with a friend.  It has a cool location in an alleyway. The food is mediocre bar food. The fries weren't very flavorful, the burger was standard fare.  People smoke in the outdoor alleyway which sucks.

tGgTIueZy1JNTzQD9rkZLQ.review_text: 02.04.10  Did you know that the Irish Bank used to be named the Bank of Ireland, until they got sued by the actual Bank of Ireland for trademark rights?  Things you learn drinking on a Thursday night.  Do you know that this place serves the most Guinness out of all of SF?  Imported beer on draft: $5.50-$6 Domestic beer on draft: $4.50-$5.50 Bottled imports: $4.50-$7 Bottled domestics: $4-$5  A few rounds kind of breaks the bank.

7ZnKjKbJPgcLD7uQvM2Wow.review_text: My iPhone directed us to the back alley entrance, which was a bit terrifying (scenes from Batman Begins came to mind) so be sure to enter from the front if you don't like wondering what's or who's behind the next dumpster.  The food was absolutely fantastic. The best shepherds pie that I've ever had. The caesar salad was great. The fish in the fish-n-chips was extremely scrumptious -- although the fries were a little disappointing.  Very good beer list w/ irish and belgium beers (among others) on tap. Wish they had more local microbrews though.

NUQig_c8fxmgCvZ_tpvcrA.review_text: Went here with a large group of friends during a 'Sunday Funday' - we're from Sacramento but we had a local guy with us who walked us here from our hotel. The alleyway patio seating was charming and fun and our sever was very patient and nice to us. (A younger girl so she joined in on a lot of our laughing and joking). We all ordered a variety of different items from the menu so I was able to try and see a lot of the dishes. I ordered the BLT and it was horrible - only a few over cooked painfully crunchy pieces of bacon on some stale barely toasted dry bread. However I ended up eating from a few friends' plates and the calamari was good, blue cheese fries, chicken strips, fish and chips, all alright and I heard the kielbasa and sour kraut was delicious. The server did forget one of the club sandwiches we ordered but made up for it with two free beers. Boyfriend ordered the Cesar salad and it was pretty small, chicken was a little overcooked but he probably didn't make the wisest choice ordering a salad at a place like that.  It's definitely food from an Irish kitchen, I've never been impressed by such so it was on par with my low expectations at least.

RylA6VZUTRuMGBu4nHKbCw.review_text: The Palace Hotel concierge recommend this place when we asked her for a bar that had good food. She described it as a pub feel and I agree. I like spots like this and could totally see it transferred directly to the streets of London. It's down a little alley. There is a sign on the main road with an arrow to indicate the alley. There are outdoor tables, obviously a bar, some tables inside, and then some stools around barrels. I ordered the shepherd's pie and really enjoyed it. It was served in a bowl having been baked lightly. The meat and veg mix was sweeter than I've had other places, but was good. It was stopped with mashers, lightly toasted from being baked. There was no waiter service that we got though I saw other tables being served. I ordered at the bar, though a bus boy did frequently come around. Fun night out; the place was pretty busy, but not uncomfortably packed.

KfyKFYNL3QpVKC2G7EeoRQ.review_text: It's ALL about the company you keep.  I'm certain of this.  NO matter where the venue --- how much you enjoy yourself has a lot to do with those you choose to surround yourself with.   That said, my best bud and I took the advice of Mike the bartender @ Gitane --- to head over to the Irish Bank for two choice whisk(e)ys.    Gotta love the "neighborhood" feel of the place, even at a smidgen before last call.  I have to admit, most of the appeal for this place was their extensive selection of scotches.  I'm duly impressed.    What impressed me more was the staff.  Especially Mark --- who not only got dragged into a heated debate between my best bud and I, but ended up reminding me why I love pubs so much.  It's the company you keep, people.  It really is.  I've gotta try their fish n' chips.  I've been so traumatized by the demise of the Cat & the Fiddle's lackluster fare --- I haven't mustered up the courage to go foraging for another option.  Hmmmm....

HyRTYRppkec1TWYOXAl1WA.review_text: First timer it was awesome the beer was fresh right of the tap the fries were delish and the service was out of this world

V08wPLUQMRVPv6g0wF0-1w.review_text: Great atmosphere and decent pub grub, but if you're looking for a place to look for some footie, this isn't it: none of the TVs have HD service, and, even worse, are set to take an SD image and distort it by stretching it.  Quite disappointing, actually.

mLNFKajc56CqeZA6WkgREQ.review_text: Overall, maybe a good soccer bar??? it definitely has the ambiance for it. But other than that, I'll probably not be back again... The cocktails just didn't cut it for me. Ladies, this is definitely not the place for a girls night out.   1. Service was meh. The server looked impatient because we had a big group and he was annoyed that I put in another order at the last minute. Despite me taking the effort to get out of my seat to find him and give him my order. Come on! More drinks = more tips... why so sad buddy???   2. My cocktail underwhelmed me. I had the pomegranate margarita that tasted way too sweet!!! You would think they were making a cocktail for a 6-year old!   3. Food (bar food)   - Fish tacos - meh. No idea why they decided to serve steamed fish instead of fried ones??? come on, it's bar food. It's meant to be greasy, unhealthy and tasty!!!   - Fried Chicken wings - ok. The buffalo sauce was good :)   - Thick potato wedges - ok. Not as good as the fries in Mc'D though.

bozvcy7kl2kJ2mBdKVxyUg.review_text: A Yelper took me here after our shoot. To be honest, I really can't eat before, during and after a shoot. Too wired and my mine is usually still in a trance.  But it was cold outside and the place felt like it had a nice fireplace going type feel to it.   I got the reuban and should have gotten the Irish Beef Stew or Shepherd's Pie. Next time.  The beer was good, but beer is always good before, during and after a shoot and helps the trance. ;)

gCY5DYWSr0OlujGQTkyyYw.review_text: Probably my most frequented Pub in the city due to it's extremely welcoming and friendly staff, comfort food and arguably the best pint of Guinness in the city.  A medium sized bar with plenty of seating in the main room, a more quiet function room and alleyway seating with canopies and heaters for less welcoming weather.  The menu is traditional pub fare; Bangers and Mash, Fish & Chips, Corned Beef and Cabbage, Cheesy-Chips and Curry Sauce.. a veritable feast of heart warming - although probably not good for your heart food.  I do recommend the smoked salmon and trout platter for a lighter/healthier but none the less filling option.. the Wasabi creme fresh is yum and the Zucchini soup is a win.  The bar is chock full of great beer, (both bottles and draft) and a hefty supply of whisky. My birthday treat is a 30yr Laphroaig Single.. tho it's a very high priced scotch.  On Friday nights and weekends this is a very popular hang out with financial district workers.. so expect a crush.  Saturday mornings they serve a traditional breakfast.. which when I can drag myself out of bed for is well worth it.  The Bank is renown for big parties .. ask about St.Patrick's or Bastille day for example. They also sometime will show the Football, (Soccer for the Americans).  Have to end by saying everyone who works at the bank is fantastically welcoming and friendly even at the most hectic of times. I wish more places could have such level headed and good-natured service staff.

-34NV3A5a5gcL-s8UH4KbA.review_text: Great spot... top ten in the city for happy hour and top ten for an outdoor drinking area downtown. For bar food, the grub is actually pretty good! We had dinner there last week and food was served quickly. I had the open faced sandwich and it was a winner. The location is also fantastic as you're just around the corner from Belden where you can grab a fantastic meal / experience I'm here practically every St. Patty's (get there by 4 or else you won't stand a chance in hell at the bar).

LH-kfXmkDtT6fkT9MQBWEg.review_text: ****4 1/2 Stars*****  Love that we stumbled on this place right across from our hotel!   Tucked into a side street with seating outside...SCORE!  The Shepherds Pie is The BOMB!!  Flavorful and filling and perfect with a pint of Boddingtons.  4 pints, Shepherd's Pie and a quesadilla: $58...a little on the high side for lunch on a week day (minus 1/2 star) but the Pie alone was worth it!!!!  Also can get breezy in this tucked in alley so bring a jacket!

FY0xR5Q5JCUJO7Wk8Icvyg.review_text: Came here on March 16, day before St. Paddy's -- the place was NUTS! It was pouring out, but this place was jam-packed with drunkards and lushes. Probably why I felt right at home! JK :)  Loved that there were hooks everywhere to hang coats/purses/jackets/umbrellas. Drinks were surprisingly easy to get -- the bar was hoppin and the bartenders were generous with the tequila and Jameson (separate, of course). Easier to slam the shots at the bar than to try and carry them precariously over to the table through the sea of green drunks, all sopping wet from the downpour outside, to boot.  Thanks for a fun night, Irish Bank!

R4NMtHsGMb6XbKICypDfmw.review_text: I'd like to say Irish Bank is a good place to go after work if you're around the Financial District.  Forgive me if I'm being bias, but I enjoy Irish bars for reason that they serve Guinness on tap. I love Guinness and if they serve this delicious beverage, it's an automatic 5 stars on my list. I usually order the Black and Tan. Oh and how can I forget the BBQ wings! The service is good. There were a few times when a few friends and I arrived right when their kitchen was about to close. They were still happy to take our order. That's something to really appreciate! I've been in their shoes, and whenever customers walk right before you close shop...It's not cool. The way the server kept his composure was something I needed to take note of.  Did I already mention they have Guinness on tap?

rTJbtItu4KKkXWGmvASJew.review_text: I will tell ya the only saving grace about my Saturday eve visit last night....was the location, plenty of indoor & covered outdoor seating!!  A good selection of brews on tap.!!  I had something amber from Deschuttes OR...not Irish by a long shot but "bloody" excellent!   The mixed drinks really weak & ripoff. I almost called them cocktails because of the eye candy bartenders (authentic accents almost make the ripoff worthwhile).  But we got overit amd moved on to greener & better Irish pub on west portal.

h1JEjco-E5uJyoK32nKH8w.review_text: Awesome bar with great food.  Just remember that it's a pub, so get pub food and drink--they do both exceptionally well.  Great place to go to hang out with friends after work.  They have great outdoor and indoor seating, the staff is friendly, and the music is good.  People will make friends with you if you look like you are alone for two seconds.  I heartily recommend the shepherd's pie.  The St. Patty's day party is off the hook.  Get there early or late if you want to avoid being crushed by a mob trying to get to the bar.  Literally, 5 people deep all around at 7 pm.  The party is also frequented by real Irish people (complete with thick accents), who say it greatly resembles Ireland, except everyone is slightly more sober.  However, the base is so loud that it's hard to have any sort of conversation outside in the alley, and American pop princesses are favored over Irish music of any sort, though apparently this is true of parties in Ireland as well.

GBpTNM-ckvQ1mePY_ExAsQ.review_text: Rude, not a great pint of Guinness, food dull........It had so much potential. What  went wrong,  Firstly we were asked to move, then we were told a liar as to why we had to move....but whatever, I thought not to worry, a great pint of Guinness and Shepherds pie would make up for it....how disappointed was I. My Guinness was not creamy like at my local, oh no this was bitter and some horrible after taste. I changed drinks. The food, nice selection but the shepherd pie was terrible it was sweet as though sugar had been added. My friends had the curry, same again and it was more Chinese not the korma style I had expected. The burgers were okay- frozen sort but acceptable, wings were good but nothing to write home about. However the service was the worst I had in some time and to add insult upon insult they told me how much to tip.....this is a cardinal sin, never ever tell me what to tip and certainly done make it 19% when there was no service. I wont be going back.  The only good thing was the snug.

dWD5j7Dg7dZUb29QbJeo4Q.review_text: It's fairly cheap for the area. But honestly the bartenders suck. I was standing at the bar for five minutes on a really slow night and the guy walked past me a couple times and ignored me. I would get it if it was busy, but I am offering you my money and you walk right by me. My gf got her drinks really fast though... maybe she'll give a better review.

oD0vh6KTXHUFgkPtIF7GOA.review_text: I loved it. The only place for the Saint Patrick's Day Festival.

A-Lp7cYuc0fxq9c4hhnmEA.review_text: Fantastic food, great service and they are ever so warm and welcoming.

ofZzcj1oiHS64f7jbGCXxQ.review_text: More like 3.5 stars. I've only been here once for lunch, and while I enjoyed that lunch, I haven't sampled enough here or come for happy hour to give it a solid 4 stars.  The restaurant/bar is tucked in one of those alleys in FiDi with outdoor seating, though it isn't as cute or nice as most of the other alley restaurants in the area. The inside smelled like a typical bar, pretty strong of alcohol, which is unpleasant for a normal lunch, but there's plenty of seating outside.  I came with a large group of coworkers and sat  outside. My coworkers recommended a lot of items on the menu, including the fish and chips and shepherds pie, but I didn't want anything hearty or heavy so I went with the GRILLED CHICKEN SALAD, no bleu cheese because I don't like cheese and dressing on the side.   I know you're thinking..who comes to an Irish restaurant and gets salad..?? I was pleasantly surprised though. Chicken was lightly seasoned and everything was fresh. I always love salads that have some fruit in it for a little something sweet and this one had pear! Also candied walnuts. Good size and a healthy alternative if you don't want the typical Irish food. A little pricey though at $11 compared to other items on the menu.  I also had some of the fries that came with my coworker's fish and chips. They were just okay. Thick cut so they were soft fries, but not crisp/crunchy on the outside the way I like my thick fries.  The only thing I found inconvenient was that they only take 2 credit cards per table. We had 15-20 people and not everyone had cash, but the waitress was nice and let us put in 3 cards since we were such a big group :)

E574PaWjsRZIp-PThbcDFg.review_text: Great bar on Saint Patty's Day to hit up early with friends and bail on before it gets too crowded... they serve food, live talented music, and a big alley that is both cool and functional enough to stuff in a hundred of your friends.  Unfortunately my only exposure to The Irish Bank is on Patty's Day, but inside the bar they were on it.  Outside the waitresses seemed to be working the crowd pretty well, however it was still pretty early.  The service here is spot on when the place is not crowded, otherwise, plan on double fisting it out of necessity rather than want.  The inside of the bar is cool, but the outside spills out into an alley where you and a hundred of your friends could be in and totally comfortable if you get there before noon and thats a hard quality to duplicate by any other Irish Bar in The City on Patty's Day! lol ..  which is the main reason for the rating and I look forward to eating and actual meal here and seeing if the four stars is warranted.

IDhcaHM7KG4EDmWf9b3c0A.review_text: I entered famished and thirsty and found what I needed here.  Had a couple of pints of cider and one amazing shepherd pie.  I will definitely be back.  The space provides so many options - sit down dining, stand up ba space and a spacious patio/alley.

jfyBHSgBWKDa51nO5js5pg.review_text: Started off here for a pubcrawl on St. Paddy's day weekend. It was jam packed inside the bar, but luckily both sides of the alleyway it's in was closed off, which made for a nice drinking area. There was a band playing and the merry crowd was singing along with the songs. The only qualm I had was that beers were $7 apiece for that day.

vlYbuIXxmOxPTruIyB2cgA.review_text: I came. I burped. I danced! I conquered.  Allow me to explain...  I'm usually a very polite person. I hold open doors for old (sometimes even middle-aged) people, I give up my seat on the bus when old (sometimes even middle-aged) people get on, and I smile at babies and old (but not middle-aged, cause they're still young enough to be pervy) people on the street.  I always say "please" and "thank you," and my mom seems to be (somewhat) pleased by the way I've turned out. Polite, right?  Well, something about the Irish Bank throws all that right out the window. I don't know if it's the alley, or the way the Guinness tastes there, or the sort-of-secret location, but I begin to feel like I can do whatever I want and not only not be judged, but be better liked! A loud burp after quaffing a Guinness once earned me applause, and I swear that the time I knocked over a man's beer as I was showing off my jigging ability (which is admittedly negligible), he actually tipped his hat. Come to think of it, maybe people are ENCOURAGED to leave their societal manners at the door along with their inhibitions. Whether they are or not, I know I always do. Fair warning to all the old people, middle-aged people and babies at the Bank: I'll be back soon, and I won't be Mr. Nice Guy when I am.

HyEV3rlvF7m_29Y6ksIOyw.review_text: You walk by a mural of a beautiful fish, proceed to the cute alleyway patio and a lovely lady welcomes you and takes your order. $6 Lagunitas with a ciggy in between and when you leave a large but gentle bouncer will express his regret regarding your departure. I always have a wonderful time here, especially when I order snacks on the side.. (calamari, anyone?) Also, you should check out their bathroom! They have really old beer menus and adverts that are historically intriguing + a cute faucet.

dBrSL_PJzwTs0OE_V13CXw.review_text: Probably the safest Bank around during these difficult times. Love the faucet in the bathroom...

W-MZxMjgtjpr2VLodyktAQ.review_text: A real pub. We stopped in for a pint and ended up staying for dinner. The Banger with mash was delicious and done to perfection. The prices are down to earth and the lengthy food and drink selection is great.

BdcNkjxcse8y48YISk6low.review_text: Irish Bank is a place for groups, by this I mean if you're looking for a pensive pub experience, you've messed up.  Downtown SF is notorious for bars that just feel cramped if your group is more than 5, but the inside/outside seating split works masterfully here.  Though the $10 minimum for credit cards doesn't thrill me (What is this, the stone age?), Irish Bank fits the bill if  you're searching for somewhere to be outrageous with a lot of outrageous people.

Z7rKy3T5HETMznaZwk9zSQ.review_text: Way Way back in the mid 90's, this was "The Bank of Ireland."  They got threatened with some legal action, and changed the name.  I was worried other things would change about the bank as well.  They have not.  The sheperd's pie still dominates, the Irish bartendresses still rule, and the confessional is still a great place to make out late night.  I could do without the smell of piss in the grant alley enterance.

FSDj4JOrZxd5Z-ax15Klgg.review_text: Only in San Francisco would you find a Japanese conversation group meeting at an Irish pub, having Bass (UK) over curry chicken (Malay style). O'Shieh or is it oishiideshita? Kind of a mixed up cultural night...but it doesn't matter. It was nice to hang out at the outdoor patio or inside and Nihongo o hanishimashita-ing away. A nice choice of beeru...Guiness (of course), imports on tap like Harp or Smithwick or bottled imports like Red Stripe or Becks. There's pub grub like Irish stew, shepard's pie, Bratwurst and Sauerkraut or burgers. The  pub food wasn't too bad...but theoperative word is *pub* food.  To add to the cultural mixed up night...in between my Magners Cider or was it Boddingtons, this hot looking Korean-American girl, a new member of the group, walks in late. Asked if she wanted to practice Japanese. She says no, she didn't speak Japanese...huh? You signed up for a "Japanese converstion group", right?  Yes, but only to meet Asian guys. How refreshing. Hey Filipino-Canadians, count, right? I really must have been in a cultural vortex because isn't it a given that the cock-asian bro's always win the Asian girls in the city? Not that night...for once the Asian guy won...*does endzone crazy Shillelagh dance*... probably only happens in an Irish pub, when the  leprechauns are dancing under a new moon, or something.  I like this pub....I think I'll have more Stout....  Top of the morning to ya! (O' ha you go za i ma s')

A0jt8dFusg__JgVprDmNZA.review_text: The bartenders never seem to be too happy but I love the abundance of outdoor seating under a canopy of lights. One of my go-to after work spots.

VwTzyj0FtAJMLB52vt_OGA.review_text: I never write negative reviews, but this place deserves one.  Went there on March 31 after an event per suggestion from a friend.  Got there and was initially quite impressed.  Good location, neat decor, great patio outside, had great potential.  That was the highlight of the evening.  Sat down with my group and ordered a round of Guiness.  Half the group had already arrived a bit earlier, and were finishing their meal.  Paid for the first round, and stepped outside to use the patio.  Had been out there all of 15 minutes, and ordered our 2nd round.  Upon delivering the 2nd round, the waiter informs us that the patio is closing at 11pm.  It was 10:55.  So he tells us we have to down our just delivered Guiness.  Um, no, you don't pound a Guiness...  We asked if the bar was closing, and they said no, the bar is not closing until 2:00am, they just don't want to have to deal with the patio.  On a Saturday night?  Seriously?  Sure enough, 5 minutes later, they are pulling the tables and chairs out from underneath us, and then taking away half unfinished beers from part of the group that couldn't finish a pint of Guiness in 3-5 minutes.  The best part was when one of the group went to get a drink of water from his glass, and the waiter even took that away mid-drink, saying they didn't even want the appearance of alcohol outside.  OK, fine, goodbye then.  Talk about a massive disappointment.  I'm sure this place is fun at times, but given my experience, on a Saturday night no less, I am never coming back.  Crappy staff means crappy management, and I don't give my business to places like this.

HkfFnxDbyRtnyBinkRlzAA.review_text: Wondered in here on a vacation with my girlfriend. It's tucked away in an alley and has a pretty good sized patio.  We went in on a Thursday night around 9:00 or so. Most restaurants in this area seem to close around 9:00 or 9:30, so it was great to find somewhere that was still open and had a decent menu.  They were pretty busy and we had to order food at the bar and then seat ourselves. This, in and of itself, really wasn't a big deal. The main reason I'm only giving three stars is because of the service we received from one of the bartenders. He was very short with both of us and seemed annoyed with everything. The food was overall really good and reasonably priced. They had some decent beers on tap as well. I'd recommend this place to my friends that are visiting San Fran or to locals who haven't discovered it yet.

a4r7b9qJI_1HwfVul-ns5A.review_text: My friend started her birthday shin-dig here and by the time I arrived, they were already a few drinks in, so I ordered up a wine along with the birthday girl. They ordered some food, but from what I saw, they had a sandwich that looked like someone could make from the stuff in their kitchen. Nothing special, nothing even particularly appetizing about it. My friends confirmed this fact.  The service, however, was good, and our waitress was attentive and friendly. Go for the drinks and service, not the food. They have a cool little alleyway :)

Ab93ubwmY63MR8WOLy9Pcg.review_text: The food was decent enough (chicken curry) to warrant this place 3, maybe 4 stars. However, the customer service is severally lacking. I have been here about 5 times in the last 6 months and have always had an issue with the people who work here. The last straw was when I attempted to take some visitors/ clients from Ireland here for a nice meal and a pint. However, they thought this time that I was too young to serve, despite having my state issued drivers license with saying I'm 28 years old.. "We can't risk it" is what I was told. There are better and more genuine places to get a proper pint in this city. Cheers.

6wMrH46ZTu_YLWJHrUDLsQ.review_text: Outside is where it's at! This was a great place to meet up with old friends and drink some beers. Their food was mighty tasty- normal pub food. Service was spectacular- our server was so attentive and helpful.

lu31yKwkzPmO_MgCKhGBNA.review_text: My girlfriends and I were lucky to accidentally spend a few hours catching up in the "confessional booth."  We had martinis and margaritas, and after a couple of those, I don't think we really cared or remembered much about the quality of the drinks. In terms of food, the only thing we ordered were some fries that came with a curry dipping sauce. I guess it was good-we ate it all!  The waitress didn't make us feel rushed and checked on us regularly. The place was packed when we went in, but the crowd was dwindling by the time it was midnight, which is when I think we left.  I'd definitely come back here when I'm in SF again.

H1r3aBjnpDk9ujmIX-eQUw.review_text: This place is great. The owner is a fantastic bloke and the pace is spot on. I had the fish and chips, expecting them to be good from an Irish bar, and they were. Only thing better would be if they served them in newspaper. Dig the outdoor seating too.

fZxazDhgaQMHeV4Xsb-h_w.review_text: So, I came here on a Tuesday afternoon after attending a workshop on the recommendation of my friend Xis.  I really wanted to catch the Sharks game because they were playing the Bruins, which was one of the biggest games of the year.  I strolled down Bush trying to find this place, totally not paying attention to the signage that clearly marked it's location.    I parked myself at the bar and asked the sweet bartender, Mary, if she could flip one of two TVs to the Sharks game.  "I suppose I could," she responded in her delicate Irish accented voice.  She served me up a Manger's, even though I ordered a Boddington's, and I patiently waited through the replay of the previous night's match between the Devils and the Rangers and watching Liverpool come back from a 2 goal deficit, and downed the Manger's and ordered a Boddington's.  The Sharks and the Bruins faced off in what turned out to be a fast-paced, yet bruising game.  Several pints later, the Sharks came out victorious 5 to 2.  I was the only one really following the Sharks game, but as I view it, everyone else missed out.    I actually saw an acquaintance there and had a beer and a chat with him before I had to scurry off to dinner with the family.  Good bar.  If i'm ever in the area again, I'll be sure to have a pint or two here.

U3sCAJc4_E3MGC1jGi19gQ.review_text: Always good times at the Irish Bank! One of the most notable watering holes in the financial district of San Francisco. Any given day around 5pm you'll find bankers, asset managers, advisors, and the like loosening their ties and double fisting two glasses of Stella chased with a shot of Jager.

GjLdMPbUr02P4bBqFo7uRw.review_text: For pub grub it's pretty good, for beer selection and the lilt of the Irish servers and bartenders it's outstanding!  Gotta love sitting in the confessional to the right of the bar with friends and many beers and the outdoor seating (while neither fancy nor a beautiful setting) adds to the experience.

bRG2rmKDff2tn4p1L84hGg.review_text: Today, as I was leaving my last client for a lunch bite, I had a vision and it included, Grilled Cheese with Crispy Bacon on White Bread. When I have a vision, I have to have it!   I was meeting my friend for lunch at the Irish Bank and I was late, so I ordered my dream dish, as it was not on the menu. As it was not on the menu, I was not as specific as I should have been. I did not tell them to fry the bacon, so it was crispy as I wanted. I am not faulting them, but this is a lesson that if you have a vision, be sure to clearly explain what you want.  Don't go to the Irish Bank if you are on a diet! This is a place for fish and chips, BLT's, Macaroni and Cheese, and french fries! The food is good and fried, just how I crave sometimes.  The atmosphere is very homey! Where a sweater, comfortable shoes, and relax at the Irish Bank. You don't need a reservation and there usually isn't a wait, unless it is an Irish Holiday or a Street Festival.

y2wOMWtzCg7evSympcPfsg.review_text: I wish I could offer a review of the food/service but unfortunately my visit never got that far due to the reprehensible "welcome" of the female hostess who turned away a party of 9 hungry people because a child in the group brought in a subway sandwich purchased next door. The child has life-threatening food allergies and his diet is limited.  It was particularly shocking  that the hostess made her comments directly to the child, rudely stating, "This is a bar...you don't bring your own beer to a bar." After we explained the situation and that the rest of our large party would be partaking of food and drink, we were told it was "policy" and if they made one exception, everyone would expect to be able to do it.  I highly doubt that the zero people present in the restaurant would have noticed or cared or brought their own future sandwiches. Several of us in the group have family in the restaurant business and they would never treat potential customers in this manner, not only is it just downright mean to speak that way to a child, it is poor business. So much for holiday goodwill! I wouldn't go here again if it was the last place in San Francisco. I am still shaking my head in disbelief that you would turn away a couple hundred dollars in revenue over a stinking subway sandwich.  P.S. The one star is only because I had to enter a star rating.

2zmZafI29a-2aIgcgppi-A.review_text: You must go now!  (trust me on this) Went to the Irish Bank for a lite dinner and drinks and was sooooo happy to find this LEGIT Irish gem waiting for me down a dark alley.  True story.  The food is casual and good.  I had the chicken strips and the order was HUGE.  It's def enough to split...FYI.  Seating is great inside AND fantastic outside.  Who new that a bunch of tables and chairs would look so inviting in an alleyway once white lights were strung above?  Unexpected and very cool.  The service was crazy fast and the overall experience was amazing.  I will definitely be going back.  Two snaps up for The Irish Bank.

0r6S6UZ5sIbJwlLj1qp35A.review_text: Late night stop for some beers and vegetarian Shepards pie.  The first small dining area is served only from the bar, so don't sit at the table a wait for a server.  The staff was quite friendly and quick with service once we figured out what was going on.  The Shepards pie was the resin that we went looking for this place.  It was pretty enjoyable.  Decent beer selection And "Irish" atmosphere...read as dark and dingy!  :)

hE34xpG35WugHznWf79HfQ.review_text: Anything with Irish in the name should encourage heavy drinking and raucous behavior. I know this because this is what I encounter at MOST of the Irish pubs I enter. Not this one.   This place has more of a German beer garden feel than Irish pub feel as a good majority of their seating is at large tables outside. This should be encouraging since my experience in German beer gardens is, also, centered around heavy drinking and raucous behavior. Nope, not here.  Here you can only heavily drink if you can afford to because a Guinness will run you $6 (there are no happy hour specials), and the raucous behavior consists of, wait for it......... standing on the sidewalk that lines the backside of the tables. They have a team out back who will yell at you should you stand on the sidewalk, so don't get too wild and crazy!!   The food is pretty bland and on the pricey side for pub grub. I guess they have to recoup the cost of hiring all of the gatekeepers out back, though I think they ought to reallocate some of the funds to a few more servers because finding one to order food or a drink is near impossible.   In short, this is your typical FiDi watering hole. Overpriced and unforgiving to people who actually want to drink and don't have six figure incomes.

M4NAfcbNPGmf1T3o8VUZtw.review_text: Handed the chap a 20 bill, and got back 15. Walked in to a noisy bar and got the bartender's attention. Ordered a glass of wine. Here's where the stars get lost: a glass of wine is 6 ounces and made of blown glass, lead crystal, or hock glass. The glass this was poured in was 3 ounces AT MOST, and disposable. Also, they charged an exorbitant amount for it ($6) and the wine wasn't very good either, but I suppose that's normal for this sort of pub.   The crowd's where this joint holds its own. People are EXTREMELY friendly. I chatted up almost everyone, which is normal, but getting everyone to respond in a friendly manner is not. No one was in a bad mood, everyone I talked to was a great conversationalist.   They don't serve food, drinks are overpriced and underserved, but the crowd is grand.

JZbmZ48L4UJao91JbhLlpg.review_text: Went here with a larger group and when I called LONG BEFORE making reservations they said seperate checks were fine and wouldn't pose a problem. The waitress "did us a favor" splitting our checks and holding our credit cards hostage while we ate. She also made it seem like we should be lucky to eat there. The food was great drinks fine though mine missed the mark. The waitress to be spiteful gave lots of pennies back to one person as change. She needs an attitude adjustment. If it weren't for her and the owner being not so friendly this place would've received a 4.

mkxCw6GsMZDu-44_aCQTHw.review_text: I mostly liked this place. When our large group came, they were polite and to the point. Loud drunk people are annoying when you are sober.  They were nice when they asked us to keep it quiet and to not sing. They got our orders in quickly and efficiently.  You don't really go here for the food -- while very filling -- it's just bar food.  Big portions, great with beer!  I did like the place though, sitting outside, drinks came out quickly -- and while I only tasted one mixed drink (a white russian) it was made well, so no complaints there either.  So I say good job to the wait staff there on dealing with the obnoxious drunkards, tip them well.

vsR0U94KKofYof7YdETkhg.review_text: Did I find my Irish soul mate tonight? Possibly.  Was his name Steven?...it was.  Did I have both Guiness and Tequila? Don't judge me!  I can see you judging, but it really was a fantastic time.    The outdoor area is very nice, as well as the bartending/door crew.  I've only been to the Irish Bank during the week surrounding St. Patty's day, but 'tis always been a real treat.  As my Irish soul mate told me upon leaving, "now, get on with ya."

qLZnWeAlykOzTF__vvrbbQ.review_text: Came here for St Patricks Day! Two words to describe it FREAKIN AWESOME! I have come here for lunch and its been okay. But the event they threw for St patricks day with the block party and live band for lunch until late night was awesome! I will definately come back here next year for St Patricks Day!

vguybeVhVDGETEm68XzggQ.review_text: I have this thing for Irish pubs - they are one of the best when it comes to inviting, warm atmospheres and real comfort food.  Anddd, you can always depend on the Irish to have quality beer and liquor.   Pros of the Irish Bank:  * Outdoor seating. You have to walk down an alley to get to the entrance of the pub. And they have filled the alley with benches and heat lamps. It's the perfect way to drink and enjoy the outside even as it gets late into the night.  *  Indoor seating means you get exposed to the old, rustic dark wood that makes up the tables, the chairs, the walls, and the counter at the bar. * They carry Guinness and Harp - two staples.  No Murphys unfortunately.  * This might not mean something to all of you - but the space reminds me of Becketts (a Berkeley Irish pub that sadly closed a year ago).  With a Guinness in hand, the beer memorabilia, and old wood paneling, I feel at home just like I did at Becketts.   So-Sos: * Fish chips were good - not amazing, but still satisfying.  * Also, ordered the vegetarian quesadilla, which was okay (I probably wouldn't order it again). Though this one could be entirely my fault...who said the Irish were known for their veggie quesadillas?   I would be down to go back for a couple drinks.  It's an Irish Pub after all...that is to say, it had me at Irish.  In the terms of the food, I wasn't in love, but would definitely give the menu another shot.

yi9eAPNgnqBGaRQ_Eyz2Aw.review_text: Why did you not tell me about this secret Irish pub?! You know I have a list of Irish pubs I like to venture to. As soon as I set foot inside, I closed my eyes and stepped back into The Ball Alley in Lucan. The only thing missing was some Dubliners, Thin Lizzy and the Cranberries. This pub is as close as I have been to being in an authentic Irish pub in San Francisco. Dark wood, brick walls, leather chairs, wood chairs and history all over the walls. The fellas pouring me Guinness were Irish too! Love....  I have sampled Guinness all over the world, the best place to have it of course is in Dublin. If you can't swing a flight on Aer Lingus, head to the Irish Bank for a delectable pint. This is the best head I have seen in SF. Sorry Napper, the Irish Bank has taken your place. You are my local so I still have love for ya. If stout ain't your thing, try one of the MANY choices of whisky, scotch or other spirits showcased behind the bar. They are in abundance.   Though it was only a Monday night, I've been told that on occasion the pub blocks Marks Alley so bands can play for the crowd. Tonight there were tables set up outside for people to enjoy the still warm fall weather. Service was friendly and prompt, pints were $7.00 a glass.   I wish this pub was in the Mission, I would totally go after work every night!

bUZgfIr-hLAv230worYH6Q.review_text: Nice beer selection and pretty good food. I wish I could give 2.5 stars.  Slow, fairly inattentive service. The outdoor seating is nice in the alleyway, and is a pleasant respite during the day from the generally touristy area surrounding it.   Would recommend going to grab a few pints with friends. Try the mac and cheese and the blue cheese fries!

s1kcPeZm4tueIoC0mnafCg.review_text: Came here on a Saturday Night with a group to enjoy some guiness.   The crowd, the booze was good. But the place was not.   There is a steaming water pipe right next to one of the tables that burned my hand. Its like totally out in the public and next to the chair that I was sitting at. At first I thought I was sitting next to a heater and I didnt think much of it. Turns out it was HEAT emitting from the freakin pipe. Freaking A.   I told the bouncer Zack as we walked out what happened since I knew him from high school.  He said he would tell someone but I think I will stay away until they mortar it--I felt like I was in the 1800's, in a building with no safety code or something. terrible.

nn0m9iO1eRC-r3YW1Xxk4w.review_text: Great stew drinks very reasonable. Great place to watch the Giants beat the tiger's. It's a bar with a lovely and tall Irish lass behind the bar. She works hard is attentive oh and attractive. Drinks are good place is close quarters when packed but a nice neighborhood feel to it. The cheers of San Francisco.

dbY7yvS29wmZ7X8smoD6eg.review_text: If you're near the financial district and craving some tasty pub grub or beer, head to the Irish Bank Bar & Restaurant.  Just be warned: it can get a little chilly sitting in that windy, shaded alley!  I had a juicy bacon cheese burger and fries.  Yeah, boring!  It was hella good, so step off!  The fries were nice and hot, and fortunately thick-cut--the big ones hold in their heat better.  Others seemed pretty pleased with the fish and chips.  They of course had a great selection of beer on tap and did up a nice black & tan for one of my buddies.  Definitely head over after a day at the office (or conference).

cmUmgol1Xsw9U9BmnIMFxQ.review_text: I live close by and  I think this is a great after-work place to go. They have a very good variety of beers and the staff will help  you choose if you are undecided -my favorite beer there is the IPA.   If you find yourself after a long day of work and looking to get a pint close to the financial district, swing by the bank. Thur and Fridays are the best days to go between 6 and 8. Good crowd, great ambiance.

LpRlZ58I3TGK71A7Urvf4A.review_text: Me and some campaign people (presidential campaign, i cant say who) came here after dinner with a political figure (also cant say who) for some drinks a few months ago (it took me that long to get yelp).  I remember the this figure needed to use the restroom after already starting the night of drinking at the restaurant.  The first words out of his mouth when he turned the corner to the restroom was:  "Holy crap!  There's Bobby Kennedy on the wall!"  Once I got over the fact that everything that night was on this guy's tab; I truly enjoy places where i can find Boddingtons on tap.  It makes me happy.

b8LU7YnTt4bzdn2EPsp_Vg.review_text: This is a great pub - especially during Bastille Day or St Patrick's! When I'm hungry I usually order either the curry chips (so good!) or the bangers and mash (SO good!).

GuMkSUhINdQlOvZy0MmSTw.review_text: I hadn't planned on doing any St. Patty's celebrations until the actual St. Patty's Day but after a morning of bottomless mimosas at Lime, I was primed for more partying.  (Thank you, inebriated Karen.)    Irish Bank was having a St. Patty's Day celebration after the parade so the lane was closed off and a stage was set up for live music.  Waitresses were carrying various beers around to hydrate the party-goers and everyone was in a pretty jovial mood.  The outside party section was pretty clean and so was the inside of the bar.  Actually, the inside of the bar was pretty romantic.  It had that classic Irish bar setting with the dark wood, gold metal bars, and photos of Irish people.  JFK portraits hung by the ladies room.      Overall, I had a great time enjoying the company and the ambiance of the Irish Bank.  Looking forward to going here again.

9X6WppCfF5Lxi3gJj5oibg.review_text: Well, came by this afternoon for a burger and maybe a drink or two. The burger was great, but waiting 20 mins before the bartender bothered asking if I wanted a refill on my water was kinda disappointing. Sigh.  This isn't the type of experience I'm used to getting here.  I guess the lunch bartender didn't really want to wait on a new face.  I think I'll stick with nights - the night time staff is much more attentive.

Ppm_nqivtMfP4eFIvOm19A.review_text: The drinks are strong, the macaroni & cheese is absolutely delicious (I've been on a mac & cheese kick lately), the bleu cheese fries are decent and the service is okay, but...the sandwiches and everything else here leave me somewhat underwhelmed.  I've been going here on and off over the past few years and now that I live nearby, I go a bit more often out of convenience.  Weekend afternoons are typically chill (unless there's some sort of sporting event on) and it's my preferred time to go when I do.  Evenings are typically a combo of the FiDi work crowd and striped-shirt wearing men who will eventually yell "woo!" outside my window at 2am or so.  The indoor area is small and poorly laid out, though the outside is nice on a sunny day, and I haven't tried their brunch yet so maybe I'm missing something there.   I know I'll be back because it's in the neighborhood, but not for the personality or sandwiches.

tcqi5sCJdmD-fVVuqUkJtQ.review_text: A great little spot in the city to enjoy a beer and some pub food outdoors. We stumbled upon this place for the first time on one of those rare warm summer nights  while we were walking around Union Square. A pub with a little outdoor alleyway patio in the middle of San Francisco? We had to check it out. The food is pretty standard...it's not overly great, but it's not bad either. It's goes with beer just fine. Their service if you sit outside can be spotty...the two times that we've been, there was only one person covering the whole patio area so it took a while to flag them down if we wanted something...but we understood that they had a lot of area to cover and they were friendly. Their patio area is basically in an alley, but they've made it cozy and comfortable with plenty of decorative signs and lights. We've never been inside, so I can't account for the ambiance indoors. But, overall, it's a cool casual space to enjoy some beers with some friends.

NRrNQ5xHn_7Fu4ctlpKLbQ.review_text: I think potatoes come with admission.   Lots of decent food but it is bar food after all. I've been here a bunch at all times of the day and night and can honestly say this is a great spot although getting help can be hit or miss. I'd love to give it four stars but I'm not made to feel important.

6_VkzelWeSHzjTVDlGl-Ug.review_text: DRINKS: Regular full bar drinks  SERVICE: Regular  ATMOSPHERE: Ah, casual little Irish Pub tucked away in an alleyway - chose this place because it had open seating outside in the alleyway thought it'd be good for group of friends to chill - - but they didn't have them out that night I forget why, because forecast looked like rain?

MDe03D6sJSBqlgUhKsRUmQ.review_text: A large group of us went here on St. Patrick's Day. It was a lot of fun. Good drinks, great music, quick service. The only downside  is that  they did last call five minutes before they closed and we had to throw away all of the drinks that we had just bought.  They close at 12:00 A.M....weird.

JPHfSfab6VTYlOd7VhcK0g.review_text: I've got a biased opinion of this place because I came on such an interesting night.  There was a group of French Basque musician/dancers entertaining the place.  They were here on tour and just happened to be here partying all night.  One of them grabbed me to dance the second my friends and I came in (what a better way to start off the night?)    We ate in the back and the food was sooo good (especially the fries), but the server suuuucckked!  I forget her name but she was this really pretty chick with brown hair and some black and green tattoo going down one arm.  I don't know if they have the same servers helping outside as they do inside, if that is the case then I blame the manager for setting up the floor that way.  Otherwise this chick was just extreeeeeemely slow or forgot about us every time she left.    Anyway, we left after eating to go check out some other places and wound up at Vessel for a bit (which was rather lame) so we came back to the Irish Bank and partied with the French Basque dudes until they closed.  It was by far one of the best nights I had going out in the city.  I love the set up of this place though and the fact that it is in an alley way is very cool.

gsYx_9MZjmxK4xTvpwHVMA.review_text: Stopped there for an appetizer. What we got were amazing chicken nachos and amazing fresh brewed iced tea. With the cute outside seating in the alleyway they have taken over I highly recommend it.  Kind of tucked away so you do have to hunt for it.

n-llq13RHyMuEwjdvGZHhg.review_text: I've had better Irish/British pub food. I got the Irish Beef Stew, and it was nothing to rave about. The meat was too dry and there wasn't too much flavor.   I will say that the service is fast and they have a good selection of pub foods--but definitely not the best.

cvUu0IIWij7W-0_9MMG7EA.review_text: Irish Bank! Its magically delicious! This is our go-to whenever we're in Union Square, its a bit hidden - you have to go through an obstacle course just to get in - through an alley, dodge the homeless and the dumpsters, but once you're past all that - you're in! It's quite charming here. The staff is nice and friendly - the bartenders are very nice, quick, and personable. If you're unsure about a particular beer or a drink, they will allow you to sample.  I've never had a bad experience here, and the service has always been absolutely amazing.

CBXURavkezsIZFxB9NyvYw.review_text: If I could pick a bar that I could inherrit after someone died, it would be this bar. It's very chill, and the food is good. Somehow the Guniess is better here than anywhere else.   If you go, you gotta try the chicken strips with a side of curry. It's something, that's for sure!

VCROW1kVZhf1XYzBwQ8B-w.review_text: I come here often just because it's in my neighborhood and in the summer time there is nothing really better than sitting outside and drinking beer with friends at nighttime.   I really do come here for the blueberry cosmos, though, my favorite time being happy hour because it's therapeutic. I easily drink about 5 or 6 of these. Unfortunately $9 bucks a pop, they're not wallet-friendly and I don't know how drunk I am until I walk home and all of a sudden it hits me.  Good beer selection, although could be better for a pub/Irish bar thing... decent pub fare; my favorites is the Shepherd Pie (really good, trust me on this). Fish & chips = ok, greasy and heavy; not my fav, and not very good service. I come here for an excuse to drink outside year-round.

xBcNPTcCigOS4We-4ZIHqw.review_text: I have a lot of good memories at Irish Bank. Its perfect to go with a lot of friends, late at night and hang out at the outdoor seating they have. I came here after work many times. They have a surprising menu with a lot of different kinds of food; perfect for drunk munchies. I wouldn't say the food is amazing, but it does the trick. I am definitely a supporter of Irish Bank. Good times.

xDqGPRY2nTRGWvuDH85mgA.review_text: I wandered down there for the St. Patrick's day party. I don't normally come here, it's usually too crowded and the food is really mediocre, but I thought I'd get there before 4 when everyone said is when they would start charging a cover.  Somewhere in the 5 minutes it took me to walk, the bar owners got greedy and decided start charging cover an hour and a half early. Want a St. Patrick's Day party? Go to Royal Exchange, they do it better with no cover.

4ayHp_rg2FVKpcl5FuTSWw.review_text: First stop for my St. Patty's day fun-day and i did not have a good experience!  The bartender was snobby and somewhat a bitch!  I guess that's what happens when Asians tried to have fun on St. Patty's day lol

7Ek4da_Btvznc4Q4S0_Bag.review_text: The staff here are always without fail really nice.   Reasonable prices and decent (not fantastic) food for lunch. Personally I don't like sitting outside in that alley. I find it damp and distasteful. But the Irish Bank is super cute and the interior feels like a cozy pleasant place.  They have great chicken wings, but when I asked where they came from he told me Del Monte. So they are great wings from chicken hell. But delish.

nsCrsxiGTYO6G0OZKC-n_w.review_text: Another 5 years has come and gone as have many trendy restaurants in the City by the Bay. And yet.............the Bank is still here. Not only still here, but, thriving as well. How can that be?  Maybe its because I can come here on a Friday, obey the holy rules by having fish & chips instead of beef and a pint. Maybe its because I can eat here for 20 bucks and feel so full I can skip dinner. Maybe its because I went back to work with a buzz on and irritating people became almost human. Or maybe its the excellent Irish Bank Rugby Shirt I am proudly wearing as I write this while avoiding all pretense of working. Ah, it's all that and I am still as Irish as ever was and as ever will be. Long live the Bank!

xch9OBVieCjwb-6duP_RZg.review_text: I've only ever eaten outside, because the inside is for 21+ only, but I love this place.  The menu isn't huge (and if you aren't drinking beer there isn't much else- but I don't see why you could come to the Irish Bank and not have beer) but the food is great. Comfort food to a tee- Shepard's pie, Irish Beef stew, Rueben sandwiches.... their food is delicious, and it's always what you're in the mood for.  Not to mention that this place is in an awning-covered alley- not what you'd expect at all, but really cool. (there are outdoor heaters but it can still get a little cold- but hey, that's just san francisco)  Try the Irish Bank!

eLRQbtaAV9GwnYCwrxhFyw.review_text: I really enjoyed this bar, though I think I'd like it even better when it's not packed with people.  Maybe it's always this way -- the place is definitely popular on Friday nights.  To get there, we walked down a grubby alley  that was filled with dumpsters, only to find another (nicer looking) alley with tables full of people.  It was a rare warm evening in SF and it was a real treat to sit outside at 6pm and not freeze your ass off.  The Irish Bank has an interesting variety of beers on tap.  I chose Czechvar.  It may not be the greatest beer in the world, but I'm part Czech, so I had to represent!  We didn't try any of the food here, but our group enjoyed our beers very much.  The service was good, too, in spite of the fact that it was very busy.  The bathroom situation is the one downside to this place.  There are only two stalls in the Ladies' room, so the line often extends out into the bar, right in the way of everybody.  The wait can be long, so be sure to get in line before it's too late!

RzPCaJftLDNaO0qRvcCY_A.review_text: Fun little pub. Not a lot of wine to choose from but it is a pub so didn't expect much. My boyfriend loved his Bloody Mary. We didn't eat here so can't comment on the good. In an alley of the street but loved the feel of the place.

sjHK6lqbun4OCRgINypNtA.review_text: I've been to this place twice now.  Every time I come it's always a fun crowd and very lively and upbeat!    Now, I don't know if they do this all the time but, yesterday when I came they had a little Irish band with bagpipes and all playing inside and outside the place!! How cool was that!!    Anyway...I usually come here with big groups so it's always nice.  We usually get apps like chicken fingers, shepherd's pie, chips and things!  Apps are really good!    It's a really cool place to visit!!

b6Ursd5EUMjPNg9M3wpXLg.review_text: Outside seating area is great for an afternoon pint on a nice day when in the city. Definitely gong to make my way back there.

zO9Z4y6JbyiMYDplbmUc8Q.review_text: This was my first time here and since they're right around the corner from my work might not be my last, but all I can see getting here is a beer.  Can't fuck that up.  I ordered a manhattan which expected to be good since this is a place that should know whisky but it when it came out, I already knew it was wrong, the color was clear almost like a martini and the maraschino cherry in it was just wrong!!!     I asked for a beer instead al though the waitress seemed surprised that I didn't like my drink.    Then we ordered the salsa and guacamole which she said was fresh.  What she failed to say was that it was just some mashed avocado and some tomatoes in a bowl, no seasoning of any kind.  And to top it off the pit was in there, when we asked about it she took it back and removed the pit, no apology, no extra guacamole.  Enough said.

K-NT_xHy7q779oSPLCyvNQ.review_text: I've been spending a lot of time here recently. Why? I don't know why. It's not terribly suited for me... 1. Their veggie burger is just so-so. And they have nothing else I can eat because Irish people like their meat (see: yelp.com/biz/the-liberti…). 2. I've recently learned that Guinness may not be vegan. As insane as that sounds, I googled it and found out that a LOT of beers may not actually be vegan. Panicked, I decided to ignore this fact and just stop drinking Guinness. LEAVE ME ALONE! It's hard enough being me! So I have to drink whiskey here instead (because it's an Irish bar -- DUH!), which is expensive. Argh. 3. The great appeal of the Irish Bank's ambiance is sitting outside in the alley. Which is not a good idea for me times TWO because, 3a.) I've been struggling with quitting smoking for months now and, 3b.) it's downtown in the middle of lots of tall buildings and I have a death-by-earthquake/being-buried-alive fixation (see: yelp.com/biz/mr-smiths-s…). Something continuously brings me back to the Irish Bank, however. Perhaps it's my lovable Irish guy friend and drinking buddy, who once told me that the Irish Bank was the place to meet one of those few-and-far-between "good" Irish men. My buddy who is from Dublin, and has an illustrious past with drugs and alcohol, and the IRA, and such things of legend. Hmm... Don't ask me. Don't ask me how, or why, HE would know. I've been trying to figure that statement out for a while now. Just like don't ask me if my beer is vegan. Seriously.

fX8NrOxtnaozSGsS_HMWZQ.review_text: Can't get much worse and still be in business! Epically horrid!  Shocking in the terrible techno 'music' so outrageously loud that shakes the walls. No conversation possible, even if shouting.  Horrid, awful, terrible. Do not understand why they exist. This is not fun, this is not enjoyable, steer clear of this horrendous place! Spend your money elsewhere, you'll thank me!

pKbM1n-RPfQxo6zQDmnxkw.review_text: It's a little weird having to walk down Raper's Alley to get to this place... but when you do, it's like finding that pot of gold.  A traditional Irish pub with great beers, great whiskey, great atmosphere, and great people.  Two separate rooms, one up close to the bar and a second room with low tables good for putting together groups and having great conversations about the world.  Also lots of outdoor seating when it's really crackin'.  Good location for me.  About 3 blocks away from Bart, so a good last stop before heading back to the East Bay.

iIn_sZxyyg5yv6jcAzcYFA.review_text: It's a decent enough Irish pub.  If you're not sitting at the bar, the service is abysmal.    The crowd, as far as bar crowds go, is pretty good...a tame group, no BS.  Heck, I even saw some folks bring their little kids in there, which may or may not indicate a particularly questionable parenting style but then hey, who am I to say?  At least they're not sending the little tykes up in homemade weather balloons, am I right?  At any rate, I didn't have any food, so I can't comment on that, but as far as a bar goes, it's a "standard Irish pub".  If you love the "standard Irish pub" then you will love the Irish Bank.

i8L_pnkXcJQ8VyApK_3_mw.review_text: I have nothing else to add except, The Bank pours the best pint of Guinness ive ever had.  Hands down.  And i love when Mary is working, she's so sweet and funny.   I use to only hit up The Bank on St. Paddy's Day (which really is a great celebration so i suggest if you havent been, you should go), but lately ive been getting dragged here a lot.  Comfortable as hell to drink in, great service, and yeah, great Guinness.  I especially like that this place is tucked away in a dark alley.  If you ever run out of space in your freezer to stash bodies, there are plenty o' dumpsters lined up.  *wink*

gvuYrfh50YSQtN8MJoqe5A.review_text: This place is so welcoming and "homey"... You'll find great drinks, great people, and WONDERFUL food here! My favorite is the chicken strips. This is a hidden treasure in the city. LITERALLY hidden ^_^

3BwUaiEZoCWBsZy1tYLL3Q.review_text: Best chicken strips I've found in SF.  Best with honey mustard to die for, and fries not so bad either.  But really, these chicken strips rock!

dCtUaGA78DRxftUUad_l7Q.review_text: My second visit here and decided I should finally write something.  An ideal place for dinner, I dont think so. There are many other options around the area. Now if you want some bar food, this may be okay. I had the fish and chips which were not that great, the fish had no flavor. The service was just bad. No water upon arrival, had to ask for it twice. The server was just in a pissy mood (it seemed).  Granted I should have never done this, but I did. I ordered coffee! Yeah yeah yeah, you might say who orders coffee at a bar! I do! The coffee was cold!

J0G7SAItOT4opuLSK2-tmw.review_text: It's located at the end of a kind of sketchy looking alleyway, and there weren't that many seats inside. They do have outside seating though (I think...or at least a lot of tables directly outside). It seems to just be your standard bar, though it was pretty clean when we went.

60iCXLkb9xqhe5cvEun0kg.review_text: This place is usually very crowded to the point where you have to wait in Disneyland-type lines to get to the bar or bathroom. This place feels a little too popular for its own good at prime times, often stretching the capacity of the hard working wait staff to keep up.  Popular? Yes. Relaxing? No. Food? Authentic. Urinals? Three in remarkably close proximity to one another.

oj9lAx1aoOnkXhTmO3sGZg.review_text: This place is old school and awesome! Everything you could want in a big city bar!  I found this place waiting for a show near by. Not only does it have a old cool brick interior, but it has wonderful alley way seating. I image many foreign bars to have this cool urban look with the tables outside under the awning. I have been abroad, and I haven't been to this bar more than once, but for a single experience I was very pleased.  Great atmosphere!

8pONVRF4HDD9ynt5lCynTQ.review_text: Wow. It's a completely different experience here when it's NOT St. Patrick's Day and I AM wearing clothing. That's what I said to Capital R and (newly elite) Jason K this evening when we happened into The Irish Bank on our quest for meat and beer.   We got there around 6 and were able to grab a table in the cute back room. Matt and I had fabulous big burgers, cooked good and rare, just like I like my dead animals on buns ($9). The green salad ($2 additional w/burger) was a lovely organic spring mix, lightly dressed to perfection. Matt and (newly elite) Jason's fries were so good I ate all of them and then, in the middle of my screaming foodgasm, spilled a whole bottle of ketchup all over myself. Yes, it was that good! I suggest a full-body napkin if you intend to get as excited about the food as I did. Because if you do get that excited, and you do spill ketchup all over yourself, from your knees to your neck, you will be shit out of luck when you get to the restroom and find out they don't have paper towels and you are forced to clean your expensive clothes off with toilet paper, which leaves white paper pills all over your black cashmere sweater and gray suit pants.   Lots of beer but only a handful of wines mean you should probably come with a hankering for ale or a flexible attitude in terms of the wine menu. For three of us, the bill was about $60 with tip. That was for two burgers, a turkey club (which I also ate a lot of- thank you, newly elite Jason K), a glass of wine, and two beers. Not ridiculously cheap but a hot deal in the fidi. I'll be back. In fact, I may go back later tonight for another burger. It was really that good.

KKaPUs_vh37E7g4g3zKyNw.review_text: One of the better San Franciscan Irish bars. As a Brit, I'm often offended as what gets called a pub or how disgracefully unauthentic a lot of so called pubs are. Walking into the bank was actually like a breath of fresh air.   Grub was nice, wasn't overly preppy, presentation was average but you get what you pay for. Tasted good, tasted like pub food and it was worth every cent.

m2euSuyHMHvNWMApB8awDw.review_text: Great atmosphere! Very cool bar with delicious food and vegetarian/vegan options. Try the blue cheese fries. Omg!

mJwQn-GirsfrAQlxvYWqyg.review_text: Such a cute place hidden in a weird alley. The cheesesteak isn't a real cheesesteak. It's literally cheese and hunka steak. Did the Irish get it wrong?

WUnFBLe62cFazdAWVJRxeg.review_text: Just ate there about 2 hours ago and I feel sick as a dog  Firstly, and keep this in mind because every restaurant goer should know this.. If they give you a menu with food stains you know there's something wrong.  That's such a huge glaring error that you know their practices are poor.  Never accept a dirty menu and if you can avoid eating at the restaurant you wold be well advised to fill your tummy elsewhere.  Such was the menu I was given, a crusty red stain on the plastic of the ragged old menu screamed to me "get out!"    But my girlfriend, knowing my rule, was enamored by the cheap ambiance so we remained.   The Reuben I ordered was absolutely inedible, the corned beef was cut not only  too thick, but also sliced with the grain.  Then it was either steamed or poached. It was rubbery and impossible to bite without the contents of the sandwich pulling out..  Such preparation is absolute culinary incompetence.  I want Gordon Ramsey to yell at them for me.   My girlfriend got a fish and chips.  The fish was bland,  The fries were fine.  The slaw was little more than damp cabbage.  Nothing was seasoned.   They were quick and complient when I sent back my Kosher shoeleather.  I just said "give me what she's having" just to be done with it.    But my fish and chips weren't just mediocre like my girlfriend's.  The dish was greasy, over-browned and had a slightly burned flavor.    I've been a cook for decades.  I know exactly what it looks and tastes like when you take a cold plate of fries and fish and reheat it in the fryer.  Even tried it for myself to make a quick meal out of an extra plate that never went out.  What I believe is that they had this extra fish and chips lying around, flashed it in the fryer and put it on a plate for me, probably thinking that I would be happy it came out so fast.   I spoke to my sweet and helpful waitress.  At my behest she rushed the plate away so it would no longer offend me with its odious presence upon my table of dining.   I gave up on eating and had a nice cigarette on the way to the car.  Since I started to write this review I've been to the restroom twice.  The churning in my gut is telling me that reheated fish and chips is a lot frelling older than I thought.   How repulsive and dishonest, it's shameful that they were going to try and charge me 12 bucks for the shitty mess they brought to the table.   It's two hours later and I am still quite unwell.  I'll probably never eat again.  I think it's mostly the sheer amount of oil I consumed.  When you let fried breaded foods get cold they turn into sponges for more oil.    Avoid this overpriced, disgusting little rat-hole.  Real talk from the pit of my aching gut.

jezOoSb7-O-ssf_Qjoh_Hw.review_text: This place is fantastic. The kitchen is great and the crowd is typically cool, laid back people.

6EHbIv5w2I4XbXs3dG_D1Q.review_text: Still an excellent pub!  I was feeling predisposed to warm feelings because this is where yesterday's drunk set in.  It was one of those good, long, soaking, all-day sort of drunks that started in the first-class cabin of American Airlines flight 451 at 11am central time, continued through early happy hour at Harry's Bar, and peaked here at the Irish Bank before cruising through AT&T Park and finding its denouement at 21st Amendment.  Good day.
