Friendly folks here, with some attitude to make it interesting.  Not "attitude" like your principal always chastised you for, but more like "personality."  Like the waitress who gave me a sad, exasperated look and head-shake because I haven't seen Gone With the Wind, or the bartendress who gave us a good-natured hard time for ordering our second round from someone else.  She switched the TV to Wimbledon for us though.  Pints are $6, but they have Leffe Blonde and pour a pretty fair Guinness, so it's okay.    There is outdoor seating too for nice weather like yesterday, but there's more fun to be had inside.  Light crowd for a Friday after-work period, but it was a holiday weekend after all.

eaj3jI9-8NO3RGoYMOr2ig.review_text: FISH N CHIPS! YUMMMMMM! (Don't forget the side of curry sauce for dipping!)  Now go get yours!

5jLkKtE4HPlrbjw-0w9lvg.review_text: If you're around Union Square and want a pint, this is the place to go. Unlike nearly every other bar in the area, it's not over-priced or touristy. This probably has to do with its discreet location down a little alley off Bush. The interior is pretty much your typical Irish pub aesthetic (and that, of course, is a good thing.) They also have a bunch of seating outside, which is great to enjoy your beer on a nice day.  On a final note, check out the fries!! Soo good.

OiWKO3G6usmv_OFw33ZPHw.review_text: Good food and drinks. The fish and chips was a bit bland. But the fish was cooked and battered really well. The fish was like falling off. Really nice. The place is really fun and busy. Our service wasn't great but anytime we asked for anything, we got it. He just wasn't waiting on us hand and foot. Which wasn't bad. He didn't hover or rush us. Good place overall.

OVrHLtgbNlRgRbwWFNtZiQ.review_text: Darn darn darn... I was at this wonderful place about 6 years ago and thought I'd found a true little hide-away spot that I could claim as my own and figured I'd come back more often. But of course, reality brings a different life. So yesterday I came into the city to enjoy one of those great Walking Tours and afterwords worked my way over to relax outside with a beer and dinner. I had checked out Yelp before I came, though, and saw Autumn W's review and thought maybe she was just ticked at them for some other reason.  The atmosphere is still wonderful and the help pleasant. But I ordered the "World Famous Reuben"  and well, I can safely say that I had the worst Reuben sandwich I've ever had. The "meat" was as tough as a bad steak and I had to chew and chew to get through the damned thing. I should have returned it but I was hungry and figured I just wouldn't come back. The fries were good but that wasn't redeeming enough. And then wouldn't you know, about 1 hour later I felt that old familiar feeling and need to find a restroom. Go for the beer folks, avoid the food

tWK7GTlzPzvxfy6E7TLHMA.review_text: Cute little Irish pub with alley way seating. This place is perfect for hanging out with friends due to the large amount of seating and large selection of beers, food, and cocktails. I highly recommend coming here if you don't want to deal with the crowds at other bars! Cheddar fries and fried calamari were delicious and service was excellent!

rlW-nkpaEKWv8V4yYWC5nw.review_text: If this place had apartments above it I would move in. It is the best happy hour bar in the Financial Dist and maybe in all of SF.   I take all my out of town friends here and used to go a couple times of week when I worked nearby. Not just because Jesse, my fav waiter is hot. He is also super nice  and knows my drink (Harp, thank you) when I walk in.   Stop in, grab a seat on the patio, order a Harp and the blue cheese fries....

D224RQ9WRnWmndZJiQ-kAA.review_text: Went last night after we left Barrett hall. Well after about  an hour here.... We went back to hall, we went inside and got drinks but then realiZed inside was stuffy air so we asked if we could start a tab and go outside. He said sure no problem and waitress will be able to add this all together and we left a credit card with him. It ok 22 mins to get her attention and order, I literally was waving my hands in the air. And she yelled out " I see you be ther shortly. We order nachos and chickens strips. Both were decent and good size portions, neither were great but they were good. She advised they she was only server for inside and outside, seriously that was not smart. UGH! When we asked to pay including drinks she advised she was food and we would have to go back in to get card and pay for drinks, we were so done here, we did that and went back to other bar. They weren't kind. The Cosmo I had was good and beer the men had they liked.   BIGGEST ISSUE they had people lighting up cigarettes on patio. 15 feet from open doorways and windows and others eating, right next me man smoking, she asked him to stop when I said something but it wasn't allowed in the first place. FOLLOW THE LAW PLEASE! Other better and friendlier places. Choose one of those.

QzTOwL4Ndb273um2Bc40aw.review_text: Great atmosphere, outdoor seating in the alley.  Good beer selection.  Didn't eat the food.  Friendly service.

2_cvh63d0CM33n1cP-3YZA.review_text: I've been here a couple times and everytime I come I want it to be better, and its not. For starters, they have weird rules about the outdoor patio, that include you can't be standing and drinking? Coming from New Orleans I get really confused when you can't just enjoy a drink outside. Second, its ALWAYS crowded when I go.   This place could be the most amazing, they should get some more outdoor tables and block it off or something so there are less stringent rules around drinking outside.

vj-71bWcddq5l-FEkThVbw.review_text: Came here with some coworkers for lunch since its Friday and we couldnt eat meat. Looked online and they have an extensive food menu! Who would have known! We all had the fish and chips, the fish pieces were huge and fried goodness and the fries were thick and salted just right. We sat outside because all the seating inside was taken!!! Good food will be back.

0s5uDMeHQrCUVKsnpqfdtA.review_text: Ahh, the Irish Bank!  The quintessential San Francisco Irish bar.  I love it!! It has all the elements of a great bar: Outside seating (which, can be hard to come by in SF for some odd reason that I could never explain), plenty of great tunes on the jukebox (the Irish greats like the Pogues, Flogging Molly, etc), standard pub food (burgers, fish n chips, etc.), a really nice extensive selection of scotch and whiskey and plenty of good beers on tap.

0mLfLrRr6jQ_Li4CAbH6Mg.review_text: Oh, internets, sometimes I need to trust you.  Whilst in SF, I was in search of a place to watch some World Cup Soccer. So many resources existed to give me options, but they were very poor about narrowing them down. I do not want every place that happens to have a television, I want a good soccer pub where I can enjoy a hearty beer and the company of many like minded fans. But no, I kept being overwhelmed with options.  I ended wandering the streets and asking the first person I bumped into wearing a soccer jersey where he was going. He pointed me to the jumbotron at the commons, which was pretty cool (even if I had to brown bag my beverage).  However, later in my wanderings I learned I made a mistake.  Odd options would come up in my search. For example, the German Cultural Institute. I understand they might show Germany games, but I don't think they would have a bar, so they were no good. Across from them was a place called "Irish Bank" which I assumed was actually a bank, and likewise ignored it.   That was my mistake. The Irish Bank is in fact a wonderful Irish pub, and had a good crowd for the Third Place Game. Wait service was a little slow, but overall I really dug the place and wish I could have spent more time there.  SIDE NOTE: I understand you have the habit of throwing a Bastile Party (which is already a little odd for an Irish pub), but given what France did to Ireland this year, I'm surprised they didn't cancel it.

QBXAIu1Vm-nKXUwBqZ5H7Q.review_text: UPDATE: 10/9/07 What was I thinking, as a novice yelper giving the Bank 5 stars? Was I blinded by whiskey? Probably. The food here is mediocre. The service, mediocre. I waited ten minutes at the bar, staring at the bartender for any service. My friend waited, having already ordered, for her credit card, for about 15 minutes. I actually sat down and joined my group back at the table bc I believed I wasn't getting my drink.  My bf came to meet us and he got service within two minutes...hmmmm, a little suspicious lady bartender, don't ya think?   I went back after everyone had their first drink, ready for their second. I figured, why the hell not. Apparently, it's better to go behind the bar and mix your own drink, bc the one on staff that Tuesday night didn't want anything to do with the bar, or tending to anyone's attention.   After getting a drink that was weak, she practically threw my money down on the bar with a sulk on her face. Now mind you, I walked away the first time bc I didn't want to end up giving any attitude ( discipline, folks) but she apparently was at the end of her whiskey slinging rope!!!  ***  My coworker took me here for my birthday lunch this year. God bless that man. Nothing finer for an Irish girl than whiskey, potatoes and some cake on her birthday.  I love the selection, the bartendars are great and friendly, it's tucked away so no one can see you stumble in or out to your office. The food isn't that great, but it's decent bar fare. The BLT was a little dry, but the fries were good.   The Confessional is a great place to sit too.  We tend to make a lot of deposits...at the bank.

CwjRqLjxTuj-4NyYqsZlZg.review_text: If you are stranded in this godforsaken neighborhood and need a beer, and maybe some deep fried fish, this is your safe haven.

1m4Hmm7IbgGjVupM7CQSMw.review_text: Thank you for indulging all of us who got laid off today. For the mac and cheese, and the beers, and offering us a kitchen job. Also for playing "another one bites the dust" right when you opened.  You have my heart.

m6p5knAyIS79s6WNbeIdGw.review_text: I have so many AMAZING memories from this spot. From St. Patrick's Day to Bastille Day to just a bad day after work, the Irish Bank has never let me down. You can come here after work and grab a beer and shepherd's pie or dance in the alley all night on major drinking holidays. Great balance of a kick back drinking spot and hardcore party time.

U5QNgmAteLYBevv04NVeOA.review_text: Went here for lunch.  Very cool Irish bar and restaurant, old and rustic looking.  I ordered a basic salad with grilled chicken, pears, walnuts and blue cheese with a honey mustard type of dressing.  It was very tasty, not too large for $11 though.  Everything was fine until a few hours later my stomach started bothering me.  Something I ate was not fresh.  I generally can eat anything and not get sick.  Don't know if it was the dressing or what.  Another thing that bothered me was that they had mayonnaise at each table.  That should definitely be refrigerated.  Maybe they take it out for lunch, but I would not even do that.

6gM705vpQbDMsXdwWLJ8kw.review_text: I went here for lunch on afternoon during he europcup 2008.  We basically had no service and had to go to the bar to get drinks and order food.  And based on the number of patrons going to the bar from the outside area...the service kinda sucks.  It was way understaffed.  So if your looking for service, this is not going to be your bag.  The food?  It was better than most standard bar fare.  The menu had the standard bar food to be expected.   I had a BLT and fries.  Mayo was on the side if I wanted it.  Generous portions and reasonably priced for the FiDi.  I will be back but maybe for drinks only and when I am not pressed for time.

vgamJOr4IvXcruia1Hcwfw.review_text: The drinks here have always been awesome and affordable, and you can't beat drinking inside a confessional!  On hot days it can get pretty stifling inside, but the "patio" area in the alley has plenty of tables and a server will come to you for drink orders.  However, on my most recent visit I wasn't impressed with the food... I ordered sheperd's pie and a sausage. A while later, I was presented with a small dish filled with Manwich, Potato Buds, and canned vegetables along with something that probably came out of a wrapper that said Johnsonville. Come on, this is pub food, not rocket science.

mROok9JZx19AwvOJlI8FHQ.review_text: I used to go here when I worked in the FiDi. Normally, it'd get 3 stars. Decent food and good but inconsistent service.  But a few weeks back, I witnessed a class act from the folks at the Irish Bank. Props to Miguel and crew for handling a trouble maker so professionally. Let's just say, that dude won't be coming back anytime soon. So I'm bumping it up another star.

MxmzBRAYHWrJSFhNulyjQw.review_text: Since I was on a vacation that was supposed to be about having fun and exploring somewhere new (ok, so that is all my vacations - and hopefully yours too), the husband and I decided to use our first day exploring the Financial District, the very neighborhood we were staying in. After wandering around for awhile, drinking sounded like a fantastic idea, so we scuttled back to the shaded alley/patio of the Irish Bank.  We opted to go inside, where I was instantly transported back to my travels through Ireland and its many pubs. One thing I learned about San Francisco, and part of what made me fall so hard for it, is the way a neighborhood or business can totally engulf you in its culture. A cozy bar with dark wood and dim, warm lights, walls coated in pictures and paraphernalia, Irish bartenders and a great selection of beer on tap, I pretty much never wanted to leave. The prices are average, they have TVs to watch sports (they were prepared to show all of the Euro tourney while we were there) and the menu looked great, we just happened to be drinking our dinner that night. I need to go back and get some bangers and mash and some Heniz beans - yum! FYI: that is how you know they are  legit - they have THE beans!  This was a perfect start to our trip and I know that if we lived around there, we would quickly become regulars. Must-do for anyone that loves everything I have been praising about this wonderful pub.

Ee-xP84OPk93SbkGuQd6fQ.review_text: We also came here during St Patrick's Day and it was so crazy busy that we went somewhere else, but we went back last night and I'm glad we did.  The Alaska Cod fish and chips were awesome, the Irish stew was very good with huge chucks of beef, and the bratwurst and sauerkraut was delicious.    Overall the food was very good and the Guinness was amazing and flowing.  A little stuffy inside with the temperature yesterday, but the alley was cool and prefect.

ZFowP_Mc-XgEmI8cOzFh2A.review_text: Decent beer list - forgettable steak sandwich, portion was tiny, fries were overcooked and the shock top wasn't as cold as it should have been.  Menus on outside sitting area had mold on them... Shoulda left right there but I was hungry and a bit jet lagged. Pass on this joint

0B3WbaM1hnn3Xut1bitSyw.review_text: Haven't been here in years and so glad we stopped by!   What a lively little house of ear-splitting Guinness and whiskey imbibery (new word for licking your lips after guzzling dark booze). The cavernous back room where groups of young professionals scream to each other across a void of weathered tables filled with fish and chips is not for sensitive ears.   Catherine and Meg serve the sober and drunk with sweet smiles and sass. The walls are filled with framed images of Ireland and Irish heritage. Lots of laughter and decent music flowing around the communal tables and crowded barstools.

jt9s40A1qJAReKetQpiMoQ.review_text: Fabulous atmosphere and delicious Shepherds Pie! Hard to get a table but well worth it once we did!

cZ7V8VPXi1HAnylgahCHOA.review_text: Tucked away in an alley in the middle of China Town sits The Irish Bank. As we walked up to the front of the restaurant I could not help but feel like I was stepping onto a street in England or Ireland.  The outdoor alley seating of this little restaurant was so unexpected.  We sat at the tables and chairs set up in the alley and I really felt like I was in Europe the entire visit.  This is one of those spots where I am tempted to give a 5 star review for the ambiance and charm alone but the food was just ok.  When in SF my brother in law brought us to this restaurant which is a favorite of his immediate family and somewhat of a tradition to visit on the day after Thanksgiving.  We ordered a variety of items for lunch, most people seemed to enjoy their food, I ordered a reuben sandwich and it was just average.  Cole slaw was not great, but overall experience was relaxing and fun.  5 stars if you want a unique place to hang out with some Irish Charm...3 stars for the food .  Service was great when we were there.

DDwuwjZHsTmN7-Fju7D1qw.review_text: I found The Irish Bank Bar & Restaurant while doing my monthly ~3 hour iPhone photo excursion through The City. I happened upon the alley and was drawn in by the red lights glowing and the lively crowd of after-workers hanging out.    The semi-communal tables set out on the alley provided a fun spot to grab a beer and enjoy the evening.  Large awnings produced a cool coziness and protection from the rain - unless you sit directly under the 6" gap between awnings (which I did) and it begins to drizzle.  The food?  I ordered a turkey club melt...and the cheese was not melted.  It was edible, but not amazing.  Actually, it was quite forgettable and had me wishing I had wandered to North Beach for some better grub.  However, the service was very fast, friendly and efficient, so I got over the food thing quickly.  The beer?  Cold and excellent.  Added bonus - I noticed the lovely ladies from Smithwick's Ale were working the tables and handing out cool bottle openers.  I asked the waiter if he could knab one for me and he returned in a flash with one.  Bro, you scored high marks for that move - thank you!  So, here's my rating: 5 stars for the alley vibe, 2 stars for the food, 5 stars for the attentive waiter (especially since he had several tables and it was BUSY) and 3.65 stars overall.  I'd go back again...for beers.

Z88N6qly3Dp5C06XbZ9IMQ.review_text: A casual place to catch up with friends, the Irish Bank serves up hearty Irish food, a reliable beer selection and a full bar.  Staropramen is undeniably a crisp, refreshing light beer. Nothing beats the real deal from Czech Republic (best on tap!) but the bottle version is still ok at $5.50. I prefer cocktails so I ordered the Moscow Mule. It was disappointingly acidic and very weak, what a waste of $9! I gave it to my friend to not waste alcohol and got a Hendrick's and Tonic instead.   Inside can get stuffy when the bar is packed, so if it's not too chilly, grab a seat outside where the ambiance is much better. The bartenders are always attentive so you don't wait long for a drink.

s6-kSU44dU3wSikEpwSf9w.review_text: Great place to grab a drink and there's plenty of seats outside to enjoy a nice cold beer!  Fries with curry sauce, Shepherd's pie, and a huge selection of drinks!  This is an awesome sports bar too...I came here to watch the World Cup and there was a great vibe!

T-a2Z-3sm_AtFoFY1qJknw.review_text: The lady and I retreated from a noisy-ass nightclub to something more up our alley.  A place with decent priced beer, good music that's not on too loud, and space to move our elbows.  The Irish Bank saved us that night, as we had a lovely time with the wonderful patrons that made lovely single-serving friends and a visit from our old friends, Jameson and Guinness.  The decor in the bathrooms are very interesting, the bartenders are friendly, and they played The Doors, The Clash, The Stones, and The Beatles while we were there.    Thank you Irish Bank.  You saved our evening!

7Mt-DvvF8nofWHSfZZcKSA.review_text: i had the corned beef and cabbage here and it was not very good. i expected a signature default irish dish to be decent at a place called irish bank. it comes with mashed potatoes and a section of cabbage uncut. the corned beef was dry and overcooked.

m5cBT7OYfn0HM0d-RCsdZQ.review_text: Where pints, elbows and boots come to rest.  I met up with a friend of mine here during one of those wet and gloomy SF days for an early lunch and with my new boots strapped on (second day of breaking them in) I stomped my way through puddles and around potholes to meet up with him.  Once in, it reminded me of what a true pub would be like:  dark, dark woods, benches, and mostly men were present.  I was right at home  ;o)  The Irish Bank has paid many a time homage to St. Pat's day and the special evening where places are packed to the gills with people making merry in addition to the flasks hidden in their pockets.  Ah, the days of celebrating.    Today was different, although my usual excuse of not being able to down a pint was made short when a 1/2 pint was brought around.  I normally can't drink more than 1/8 of a beer (really can't handle it) but this little thing was so cute and so good.  The perfect accompaniment to the Irish Bank Burger, at my bequest, medium rare.  This came topped with the best bread bun I've had in a while.  It was puffy, rounded and soft: the only thing ladylike about my meal.  The fries were stubby renditions of the usual steak fries, but the salty crunchiness was the perfect balance to my savory hamburger.  My friend had the stew which came with massive chunks of stewed beef and a hearty scoop of mashed potatoes.  I would have elected for that dish, if I had not already made my mind about the burger.  The fish and chips selection was volunteered, but if I ate that much fried stuff, I would have been taken out on a stretcher!  I like this place because there is nothing frilly : you come in, order your food, get your pint and carry on like a bunch of men.  Just leave your high hats at the door.  Not allowed.

xV0zwASagIV-5wqMZZF_XQ.review_text: I was definitely not expecting to get an Irish server at The Irish Bank.  I've been here twice, once for drinks only and again for lunch. Drink prices are reasonable, they have a good selection of beers and a modest but excellent scotch selection. Not too many places carry Macallan Cask Strength.   I didn't want one of the heavier options so I ordered chicken curry, which I felt a little apprehensive about getting at an Irish place, but it was awesome. Pretty cheap, and they made it really spicy like I asked. Also it was fast, I was able to get in and out during my lunch hour with no problem. Looking forward to trying their Irish fare!

t2jHhwu7XQVNUz2c6jo1HQ.review_text: Good beer and food, quick service, and interesting people. A good place for a pint!

sBQHJzPlQYVdwjEeqtvgrQ.review_text: Great after-work place to get a few drinks. I had a really pleasant experience at this bar. It wasn't too crowded and we came on a Friday after work. There is outside seating, as well as inside, but we sat inside and it has a really nice vibe. There are plenty of tables as well as bar seating. The bartenders were semi-attentive, but the drinks were definitely a good level of strong :)  They also have food - we ordered the calamari and the fries. The calamari was so yummy! Definitely a place I'd like to revisit.

iM65_UObxBvexo50FiSYhg.review_text: One nonalcoholic beer & some tasteless cheese fries + tax & tip = $15! All for the chance to walk down a dumpster-lined alley to find the place -- and be deafened by drunken braying and choked by American Spirit smoke?

dLaGvWLkOfThKMUIsVXo6w.review_text: Not a real Irish bar, and the service sucked big time.

olTOzsqdGEcyMXpf5eXuhQ.review_text: "Is that a leprechaun in your pocket or are you just happy to see me?" ;-)  This is my most favoritest bar in SF. It was a regular stop when I lived in SF, and I make a pilgrimmage whenever life takes me back to Northern CA. I actually like this Irish bar every bit as much as I like many of my fave Irish bars in Ireland. Without exception, something good happens every time I visit.  Things that make the Irish Bank cool IMO: 1. Barman Dave: quick, witty, adorable, from West Cork 2. The Confessional: if , like me, you were raised Catholic, drinking Magner's (aka Bulmer's) in a confessional feels a little naughty. Drinking Bulmer's in a confessional and making out with your date feels a lot naughty. 3. Clientele: Collars both white and blue, drinking together in perfect harmony. Consistently good looking and overwhelmingly straight. Note that I heart my gay men. But sometimes a girl likes the attention of straight boys, too. 4. A-OK on the jukebox. 5. Perfectly pulled pints. (See #1.) 6. Burgers. 7. Based upon past experience, friendly members of the SFFD will take you back to your hotel in a fire engine if you don't feel like grabbing a cab.  OK, maybe not you. Maybe just a couple of my friends and me. But then, how you get home isn't my problem.  Slainte'.

_Idlsaw2hXJN8NtNWamt2Q.review_text: Now I remember! As I walked out of the girls' bathroom, I had the timing spot on to catch the door of the guys' bathroom being opened simultaneously, so I could totally see some guy piss away his last few beers.  That's unfortunate. Even w quality Brogue.

QpbySlIOUOkrT9YeV7ugYA.review_text: fun lil spot for drinks on the "patio"-- i.e. the alley out back. chill crowd and cheaper than rickhouse.

zoahf1GKypVKEe1GxH0OUw.review_text: The food was okay, the place is a little cramped and fairly small. Waitresses were rude and were not very attentive. They took along a long time serving us and didn't check back on us as much as I'd hoped. My friends and I did not feel welcomed in the restaurant at all.

C469FeAyiATdaNmgXjZYWQ.review_text: I've only really stopped into this bar for one thing -- to accelerate the useful service life of my liver.  On a birthday it was a sneak attack -- a quick double shot of tequila to keep the alcie flowing.  But on other nights it's been to bond with coworkers over carbombs and ciders. I can always trust an Irish bar to carry magners.

_n-kr9A6r7F_Pr4hv9yXtQ.review_text: The scene: Saturday of Hardly Strictly.  The group: Me, boyfriend, brother and roomie The crowd:  bleh The music: bleh The bartender: MEGA BLEH!   Upon arrival I'm instantly ditched by those who have in their 24 years not learned to control their bladders, so I head to the bar to get drinks. I smile, order and wait for something resembling a nice, human response from the bartender. Nothing. Annoyed that he could resist my charm and good taste in booze, I say: "You're pretty personable, eh?" Response: death stare.   After a mild grimace and payment, we headed to the back room, which was loud and crowded, and the music ceased to exist. and it was hot hot hot! The four of us giants shared a mini table for four, finished our drinks as fast as we could, and took off for some horrible karaoke that was paramount to the experience we had here.   Not stoked on it, but I would give it a second chance just so I could sit on the terrace outside (I'm a sucker for drinking in alleyways...)

S5WQcThM04eH7Eu0YJ1a1Q.review_text: Situated in an alley, The Irish Bank has an authentic old world charm that is hard to find elsewhere.  I like to haunt it early on Fridays before the FiDi crowd arrives and the Euros run for cover.    They have Guinness, Boddington's and Leffe on tap, and unique imported ales for the connoisseur.     Beers and Fernet all around, please!

f0bmJgHLviztB3Ng91jobw.review_text: Fantastic pub bangers, mash & beans - subtle, satisfying flavors. Fish & chips were standard fare. The blue cheese chips were a delightful surprise - literally large pub chips covered in flavorful globs of real blue cheese...especially delicious after a few pints. Appropriate beer selection for the venue.  Feels like a 'secret' watering hole tucked away in a small alley. Interior was classic Irish pub style. Warm and friendly atmosphere to meet friends. A bit pricey and did find the hand written, multi-page check a bit confusing at the end of the evening...but who doesn't enjoy a little math puzzle when you're buzzed on Smithwicks? Would return for social gatherings.

MppPWYfLv7n5OoWDy22K4g.review_text: It's a fair place to sit down and have a drink. Not the top of my list, but not the bottom. Right around the corner from work.

wG9d5TxOKKgbd8O08-kntA.review_text: The fish and chips can run hot and cold.  The last time I tried it, it was a soggy mess.  I should have sent it back: yelp.com/biz_photos/the-…

T1kRNW8UyZkcs1K1O0Gb_A.review_text: 4 stars on having outdoor seating!!! in my mind this is the biggest draw of this spot. A whole alley that is open w/ tables, as in a sea of people awaits you around the corner from the dumpsters!! Enticing I know.  4 stars on the pouring a mighty stiff drink. Damn I was a bit tipsy after 2 and a basket of fries later.   I embrace the Irish, I am part Irish great, yet fricken hell turn down the music in the bar. You can not hear the person u are sitting w/ and or next to. And those serving could be a tad bit more pleasant in lieu of just slinging a cocktail at you. I'm just saying. I come here, I like this place, it is just nice when you have some one else making the bar run!!  Pls note too, the same people have been coming here since god was a boy and I love that you can bring in your dog.  classic!

V-t0NgcotRFlCiwfNHdWiQ.review_text: I came here for a beer, and definitely enjoyed the Leffe they had on tap!  The inside is very yellow-lit and a bit depressing, but the weather was good, and the outside tables were perfect!

ewBbJyL9d9uMI6T3bhjF9w.review_text: After a pretty rough (but fun) Halloween night, I was feeling pretty hung over and in desperate need of greasy bar food and a little hair of the dog. After wandering around Embarcadero for an hour trying to find a place that was open on Sunday for lunch. Luckily Yelp on my iPhone pointed me to The Irish Bank.   I'd heard about this place, and seen it packed with people for happy hour. I typically avoid places like this as they're usually overrated, boy was I wrong.  Sat down, and almost immediately a very cheerful server asked me what I wanted to drink. A  Langunitas IPA was delivered a few minutes later and definitely hit the spot. I placed my order of fish and chips hoping for the best, but expecting a soggy mess. Not too long afterwards I was totally shocked by what was delivered. A steaming plate piled high with 2 pieces of uber crispy fish, and a mound of perfectly cooked fries. With malt vinegar on the table, I was ready to dig in. The fish was fresh and thick...almost too thick for my taste...but it was delicious. I was a bit worried about my stomach handling all of the food, but I couldn't stop eating. By far the best fish and chips i've had outside of London (the Pheasant outside Heathrow is still my all time favorite).  The server was very attentive, and the atmosphere was great. I still think happy hour / dinner might be a bit overwhelming but I might have to brave it next time I have a craving for F&C.

CQ8OSQFPCCoo0ujxEyEVRA.review_text: Oh Irish Bank, I do love you. You are reliable with seating for the post-work drinks even on a Friday, but goodness, I lose my voice every time I come here. You can't control the volume of the place, I get that. But if it weren't for your proximity to the office, not sure if you'd get my business all too often.

OMoBzr4FhDkk7yV8zYtmiw.review_text: Decent fish and chips but don't sit around waiting for service in vain - order at the bar.

KDm50_t-htYOgnhI9s_nfg.review_text: Great Irish stew, and of course beer!

2gcFiDuxzOY2cMKlVLfi1w.review_text: Wow - I don't enjoy these reviews, but unfortunately this is it...  An out of town friend has been bugging me for some time to check out their mac n cheese; said it was fabulous. Well, after several months I finally made it today with a buddy of mine.  I must say, the ambiance does carry that appeal that comes with being located in an alley - not typically easy to get to - but thats as far as it goes. The beers were overpriced, service was so-so, but here is what ruined it for me....the food.  First, the mac n cheese was nothing special at all - tasted like it was massed produced for some elementary school. I honestly would rather have Kraft mnc at home - really much better.  Second, hoping the mnc was just a fluke, we ordered sandwiches...I had the reuben he had the cheesesteak. These were possibly the worst either of us have had...it's what I would have expected in a diner/cafe in the middle of nowhere. The corned beef was cheap, processed meat that looked like it was slid straight out of a prepackaged bag. I have never seen a cheese steak that used steak that was not thinly sliced meat, but rather cut up strips from a leftover steak that didn't get eaten the night before.   Also, the people next to us didn't seem to care too much for their meal from what we could over hear - one of them had the shepards pie and it was about the size of 2 pudding cups...very small.  The fries were ok -   So I called my friend and harped on her about her recommendation - she got a bit defensive and said 'well, it's been 10 years since I was there'  AH!!!!! thanks for that bit of information, something that might have been useful BEFORE we went there!  I must say if i was just going to have a beer, and I didn't care how much it cost, and I didn't care about having to try to find a parking space, and I wasn't planning on getting hungry, then I might go back.  Or not.

GCuDiPUKYxhgFHP5LqJa2Q.review_text: Found a space, had planned to eat at Oz but we were told they were closed after we sat down, got comfortable and started looking at the menu...looks interesting though so we'll give it another try.  Since we already parked, we walked around to see what else is available - what do we see but Irish Bank...we walked inside and came upon the confession booth.  It's empty and the perfect spot for a late lunch.  Like the ambiance, jukebox with interesting mix of CDs, back dining room can be "private" with curtains drawn.   Our waitress was friendly.    What we had:  smoked salmon and trout with creme frache (horseradish) over toast w/ mixed green in balsalmic vinagreitte $10.95? - the salmon is better but the trout was good too but a bit salty so much better w/ the toast.  the horseradish creme frache helps tone down the saltiness and adds a bit of freshness and a slight kick  The Bank Burger - choice of cheddar, swiss, or jack - $9.95 - we chose Swiss and asked for medium rare but it came out medium.  A bit small, ok, came with steak fries that were not bad   Hubby had the Kilkenny beer - $5.50 - not bad but flat  I had the Irish Coffee - Tullamore Dew whiskey, heavy cream, Cafe Trieste coffee -$7.00? - cream was super thick and sweet but generous on whiskey

BvF7XwZ5kCQ8qXE2gAtAIg.review_text: I just really like this bar. Cant explain why, but I enjoy coming in whenever I visit the City

kK996Gx3ZoR7Avd5WILFEg.review_text: I'm kicking myself for not checking to see if there's an ATM here, just for the sake of irony.  There are, however, all the trappings of a great Irish bar*. I think I even heard traces of a northern Irish accent in our first server's voice. And they make a good burger, about 1/4 lb, which as far as I'm concerned is about the right size for a burger, being that I'm really against the whole huge burger trend going on these days both from an epicurean and a public health standpoint. Ask me what I think of run on sentences some time.  The fries are crisp and delicious too.   The kitchen was uncommonly fast; This was pretty early on a Wednesday night though and I'd expect to wait longer when its busier. Our server was a little curt but brought everything quickly and correctly.   I'm trying to reserve 5 star reviews for places that completely floor me, and the Irish Bank seems just like any other pub, though it's one with fast attentive service and really good food. Actually, I am a little completely floored, now that I think about it.  *There were no drunken brawls. I'm willing to overlook this.

-40hChgdlI5clkagmyoh5g.review_text: Hmmm...this is tough.  This place has received good reviews so I feel guilty for giving it a 2 star rating, but I have a reason for my two stars...a good reason.    Came here for lunch and ordered a Shepard's Pie which arrived piping hot, but that was deceiving.  You see when I penetrated the mashed potato surface and entered into the juicy meat, well, the meat was cold.  But I gave the dish a few chances and took a few more bites and some parts were piping hot while other parts were cold...Cold meat is not really my thing, so hence, TWO Stars.  See told you I had a good reason.

CM1SVXJ1kiH5uztj_Vg7XA.review_text: Sorry to say I wasn't too impressed with this place.   BF and I came here on his birthday (we didn't let anyone know it was his b-day, and I doubt it would've mattered). It was around 6:45 on a Monday, but it was strangely full, especially in the bar and the front patio.   The bar was insanely loud. Like, rock concert loud or gaggle of tween girls at the mall to see Hannah Montana loud. I was grateful we got to move to the dining room area of the restaurant, because it was a bit quieter.   However, there was only one table available and it was used as the servers prep-work station, so we had to have a large bin of silverware removed otherwise there were no other options (the patio area was packed).  Our server was really uninterested in our table and towards the end flat out ignored us. My BF had to literally wave him down, but the crowd had thinned out and we weren't hard to miss, having to sit right next to the only entrance to the kitchen and all. I was told he had an offensive odor, but I didn't smell anything, so take that as you will.   My food was rather disappointing. I ordered fish and chips, which I assumed would be great coming from a pub. I've never had a bad order of fish and chips from a pub. Until now.   My fish was breaded and fried maybe hours beforehand. The batter was soft and gross, the fish bland but fresh at least. However, the nasty breading totally turned me off to eating it. I left most of my plate uneaten. I would've asked for something different or ordered dessert if my server had checked on us even once, but that wasn't the case. My fries were boring, and slightly soft/undercooked as well, although much more edible than said fish. BF ate his meal and said there wasn't a problem, but he didn't seem to be very enthusiastic over it, either (bangers and mash). When he tried my fish he agreed that it didn't taste right.  The restaurant itself is clean and well decorated. The food and service was lacking and I don't know if I would hurry back if they can't bother to get fish and chips right. Maybe this is just a place to come and a pint.

jaE3xXZfU03fpLvRg4RFtw.review_text: Burgers, wings and Guiness  You can't go wrong with that  TV's and music is good too.

T4E1PMvIF78PKVMXnYcuRw.review_text: Get the blue cheese fries...awesome.  Best place for lunch in union square.  I've been here at least 30 times and it never fails.  It's such a great place to take guests too because it is down a cool alley.  Very unique place.

w5wJHpt-96pvsDI5bDi6Uw.review_text: Fine place.  Sat directly at the bar based on other reviews about slow service.  Clearly they've had a few dine & dashers since they asked for my card relatively quickly. Had the fish & chips - so average, even a disappointment after all the other amazing places I've been this week. The owner was friendly enough, enjoyed his vernacular "thanks love" but his treatment of his coworker/bartendress/girlfriend whatever she was bothered me. Even if that's their joking, I didn't jive with it. All in all exactly what you'd expect from an Irish pub. Note: you do indeed walk into a sushi shop if you think the main door is on the street - you do need to go down the alley.

sjzpz7oCW0t7m7sI_3hHeg.review_text: Completely casual enviorment and a good place for boys to go and watch a game. I appreciate an ice cold stella when seated in the confessional style private booth between the bar & resturaunt area.  Food service is terribly slow but I keep going back for the home town appeal.

BnpRLcCQnA7tytWeQoUZVQ.review_text: Been here virtually every Friday after work this summer and I don't anticipate stopping anytime soon! (Not that I'm complaining about it!) It's definitely a great place to chill and unwind with friends and co-workers over a frosty Guinness, bloody mary (like drinking deliciously spiced salsa with vodka)  better yet a "poor-mans black-velvet. (My newly discovered favorite drink.) Their curry chips (french fries with curry dipping sauce) are amazing: hot, crispy and great to munch on while drinking. Atmosphere is what you'd expect for a pub, fairly loud, dark with lots of beer paraphernalia adorning the walls. What's really fun is if you and a small group go and sit in the "cloister"  next to the bar and chat, drink, and psychoanalyze each other while getting smashed. (Ok, so maybe you don't need to do the last part like we did.)

5bFypTn1I3ZixwYW2zEvAg.review_text: I had my 25th birthday *extravanganza* here. It's weird having to be thrown INTO a bar instead of being thrown OUT of a bar. Cute location. I love the outdoor seating, but HATE HATE HATE (-.5 star) the service that comes with the outdoor seating. It's slow and the waitress we ended up with was snooty and impatient (to drunk people) I MEAN COME ON! YOU WORK FOR A BAR!  The bartender (who makes AWFUL COSMOS -.5 star) was a nice guy but his friend who was hanging out there stole my boy's shot when we were toasting to me. He was peeved (the boy). The aforementioned bartender's friend (-1 star) also ho-ed out with my friend and now there's drama attached to that (i blame the Irish Bank for that). *shakes fists*   The BLT was FANTASTIC! The stew was good too. The mac and cheese ended up on my sidewalk ... after a few (lots) of drinks ... DON'T YOU JUDGE ME!  the moral of the story (there isn't one): Don't eat mac and cheese when you KNOW you're going to ingest ungodly amounts of alcohol

fpqG9401V3CKFEyEGNDiaw.review_text: Please Note: This review is for Guinness and bar area only  My friend suggested we go here to taste the best Guinness in town. Apparently it takes great care to pour a Guinness correctly and it needs to be poured often in order to reach its full potential.  The Guinness was GREAT. PERFECT HEAD and super smooth. The bar area was PRETTY SMALL but looked like a fun place to go to WARM UP before hitting the clubs or other bars. I noticed they had on outdoor patio that seemed like a fun place to sit during warm days. It sounded like the bartender had an Irish accent which always add to the experience.

qqEylma1idTh0mCcsgxvtQ.review_text: I will write more later.  Only quick anti-reccomendation: DON'T order a Margarita!  We asked for salt and very little stayed on the rim.  It ended up being saltier than salt water.  BLECH!!!  The food is pretty good.  I really like the atmosphere.  I don't really want to complain about the place but that drink was worse than it being watered down.  Sloppy, sloppy, sloppy.  I get that it's an Irish pub.  But if you can't pour the drink, get the fuck of the bar.  BLECH, I can still taste it.  Months later!!!

k6tto0w1DMPeuAvEPvHnkA.review_text: What's not to like?  They've got beer, hard liquor, and food.   I love this place, especially on the weekends.  I often have to be in the office on the weekends, and it's nice to take a lunch break and get their full breakfast before heading back for another few hours.  It's tough not to feel comfortable in this bar.

_HDMfG3j-dIYohJLCuEd6w.review_text: Visit Date 6/21/2014  5th stop of the pub crawl Slow night for this place but will return cool alley spot. The place I am sure has its night I thought I would see a live band. I will be back and give a second chance Divey Irish Pub but I am sure popular.   see you next time.

vjwLL41-EOQQkLSonUMdGw.review_text: As far as a bar or pub goes, The Irish Bank ain't bad. The venue itself is divided in half, with the bar occupying the initial half of the venue, and the restaurant, the latter half. Coming here for a birthday party this past Saturday, the bar was bustling, but not crowded, which I suspect was mostly due to the holidays.  They have a decent selection of liquor and beer on tap, but don't expect "klassier" liquor like 151 to be on hand. And while they have a number of specialty cocktails, including nightly specials, that are made fairly stiff, don't expect the quality and craftsmanship you'd get at a place like Rickhouse or Zero Zero.  Prices aren't bad either, with most cocktails running around the $8 price point, and service, while more "all-business", is not unfriendly either.  ***Accessibility Info***  Venue - So, contrary to the business details as of this writing, The Irish Bank is NOT wheelchair accessible, as there are a good 3-5 steps to traverse at the entrance, without any alternative way to get inside the venue. That said, the bouncer was kind enough to help lift me up, with the help of another friend at the party. Once inside, expect the usual accessibility challenges of a bar, with high bar counters, crowds, and small spaces. That said, their tables are all at normal height, so be quick to snag one if you need it.  Bathroom - Didn't check them out, so I can't comment.

wkwQ6iaqK8_tMNA_CXgowg.review_text: Found cozily in an allyway in the financial district, this Irish restaurant provides indoor and outdoor seating. The problem I had with this place was the waiter kept forgetting some of our orders and messed up on a few. The prices are overcharged for a 'pub' and they add a 15% you for service charges for 5 people even if the waiter was really bad.  If you like spending a lot of money for medicore food, go here!

7kPR3NAhl72EGbUU1h9FOw.review_text: One of my favorite alley resturants in San Fran. Awesome to hang-out outside and have a pint of five!

ovuWSzYnqlKcL13yVGrC9A.review_text: Was here on Saturday - the day of the st. Patrick's parade - they handled the crowds really well, beers in trays and proper order keeping an eye on people. Band were good too - even if the lead singer did punch someone!

pm5BZL0-H9K9L4q4UXLXfQ.review_text: Cool place.  Fodd not so good but come for the beer and the outdoor seating in the alley next door.  Looking forward to coming back.  Be a good place to drink some breakfast  beers and watch World Cup.

ptRVxGofH6KXc1gcFKOnxQ.review_text: So, I've been here 3 times. I give it three stars but I'd totally go back on the right occasion. I mean you can't give 5 stars to an Irish bar where you get spilled on while wasting away in an alley on plastic chairs . . . but there's totally a time for that kind of thing and when that time comes around . . . I will think of cruising over to Irish Bank.

rf6razuvxQYqJTY-ziZWZg.review_text: I have been here a few times with my coworkers and I have enjoyed myself every time.    Pros: They know how to pour a Guinness  Fun outdoor seating Decent prices  Cons: Outside is really windy Food kind of sucks

rjTa7RlDuyMY49zf7olXYg.review_text: On a nice day, they set up the tables outside in the alleyway.  It's a great place to have lunch and grab an Irish beer or an Irish whiskey or both.   It's a fun place to be on St. Patty's since they close down the whole alleyway and fill it with music, people and dancing.   Overall, best Irish bar I've been to in the bay and a favorite of mine.

5vd9a7Xx_LlFfVogN1UsJg.review_text: Little known fact- It wasn't the potato famine that killed all those people in Ireland. They actually starved to death while waiting for their dinner at The Irish Bank.  If you've had a few drinks, you might believe that history. If you've managed to have a few drinks at the Irish Bank, please tell me your secret! Our waitress was as elusive as a leprechaun. Everything took painfully long to arrive. And it wasn't one of those deals where they were intentionally slowing the food service so you'd order more drinks. Or if they were, they were failing to cash in on the set-up. We'd have gone for it. The flesh was willing but the spirits were unavailable.  I came for the BLT I read about on Yelp. The quality of the ingredients was good. But, while I thought that I'd like having the mayo automatically on the side, the end result was a dry sandwich. Applying mayonnaise at the table wasn't the same because it didn't give the ingredients a chance to mesh.  Boyfriend had the turkey melt. He also felt that while the individual components were good, the end result was only so-so. He suffered serious diner's remorse when he saw the great looking fish and chips ordered by the next table. I initially promised him we'd return to have it, but by the end of the meal we both knew that was unlikely to happen.  The nail in the coffin was the dessert- the caramel apple torte. The cake-like shell that held the apples and caramel sauce had fridge funk. You know how you can smell it in your mouth just as you take a bite of something? It's disgusting. But while I pretend to be discriminating, I'm actually indiscriminate and I ate almost the whole thing.  Shout out to the busboys! Busboys always show me love, God bless them. The busboys at Irish Bank were attentive, efficient, and NUMEROUS. Maybe if some of them were switched to waiting tables or cooking... just a thought.

DEkuh3sq0qTWBg5c4IWaBw.review_text: Don't do it!! There  are way too many good places in the city, don't waste a cent here!  I had some friends in from out of town and thought this would be a cool place to spend our last last night together. WRONG! Started with a super rude bouncer (the dude with a neck beard.) Then there was the indifferent staff - it took 20 minutes to get the bartenders attention to order a drink, and then a another 20 minutes to get her attention to order food. It wasn't even that busy, they are just the slowest staff I've ever experienced. I ordered the chicken wings, which were a disappointment. They were more something I would have expected at chain diner, at 4am. They were fried and dry and hard - they probably had them under a heat lamp back there!   Rude bouncer, indifferent staff, crappy food and high prices.

_rCTsmoYmWmM-F33PBGN2w.review_text: Hidden out of the way place near Union Square.  We were staying at the Hotel Triton right next door, so it was an easy place to stop in.

hWZY-38qzz15_8U-it8zjw.review_text: Looking for a snack and a beer in the SF heat, then I recommend you get over your fear of dirty alleyways and grab a stella and nachos at the Irish Bank. A pleasant surprise. Especially when you consider that an Irish pub has some decent nachos. what compelled us to order nachos is beyond me, not my decision. but it worked out well. We ended up coming back later that night with some more people and we all had nachos.  Price: all very reasonable. Service: very nice wait staff both times i've been there. No eye rolling, just beer and nacho serving.

UqprcndB0uq6AueXyate2w.review_text: I'm rating this place 5 stars despite really not remembering much of my time here...  On a random Tuesday night, with an out-of-town friend visiting, we happened upon The Irish Bank in search of somewhere to continue our post-Thirsty-Bear drinking and reminiscing of times gone by (when we were probably out drinking).  Considering the tucked away location, it was a miracle that we found the place.  I clearly remember the drinks being reasonably priced, the music being just the right shade of loud and the liquor selection being quite extensive.  Fast forward 3.5 hours and I vaguely remember spending half an hour trying to find my way back to MUNI, giving up, and eventually cabbing it home.  Definitely on my list of places to hit up the next time I'm drinking in the area and need a proper bar that stays open until the very tip of 2AM to service those very specialest of drunk bastards of which I am clearly a member.

8w_NcRZkEDhJ9f7juGIJ9w.review_text: I checked out this bar recently because I've heard so many great thing about it from friends. My friend and I got there around 4 before happy hour and we had this awesome waitress who really knew her beer and was so attentive.   When happy hour started we got a different waitress who took hella long to give us our drinks and didn't know anything about beer.  This didn't bother me too much, because she might have been new. It was not until she asked if we could hurry up because other people were waiting to sit down, that I got bothered. Even a new waitress would have common sense not ask that.   I would give this place 5 stars, but due to that crappy waitress I have to give this place only 3.

EGjVl8DO9AtSkBCttdr__Q.review_text: Seriously this place is so yummy and with over 600 reviews and they have a 4 star rating.. Do I need to say more? Fish and chips! Other dishes where good, but I'm a fish n chips fan and I'm all about them here!

FbiLiZIf9-rF_8W_UWjNEg.review_text: Ah, the Irish Bank.  Solid pub food. Solid libations. Solid Irish bar overall.  A note to my fellow misanthropes: This place is a complete and total clusterfuck during peak hours.  This includes happy hour, weekend nights, and St. Patrick's Day.  You've been warned.

VifRw-kSbPYtsDFQtXEHyQ.review_text: The atmosphere is great, very European with the tables to sit at outside. The beer selection is large and the food menu shows your classical Irish and other European dishes. The cured salmon and trout platter is a wonderful starter, the Bratwurst with Sauerkraut are fantastic. Service is very good, even though some confusion may occur. You can leave with a wonderful experience from there.

WUOURRbJhrPAKUA5pOAZEw.review_text: Wow this place was sure a find.    Get the bratwurst and sauerkraut. You will NOT be disappointed. The mustard they served with it was to die for and everything was cooked to perfection.   I love coming here although I always order the same thing. Just try different beers everytime.  They have this outdoor patio that you can eat at and smoke! But even though my dream is to live in a world where we can smoke and eat in the same place, I still feel super weird about smoking around people who are dining so I just excuse myself and walk away from the table.   This place is a gem! Look for signs pointing you down an alley way. You'll love it here.

1DlL-BYuhPoKTvZ2hBcSUg.review_text: OK, first off.... I have been to Ireland so I have MAD street cred here.... haha!!  This place looks and feels like it is an old school pub from Ireland!!! Not sure if they had the heat cranked to mimic the surface of mars but wow it was a warm one in there... we ordered on the patio but unfortunately we got there when the patio closes.... (earlier than the bar due to the people living upstairs, [side note, you don't want to hear a loud bar below you then don't move above a bar])  I digress.... So started our drinks and moved into the bar but couldn't stand the heat so we got out the kitchen.   Would have stuck to a solid 4 stars but the waitress was kinda bitchy and maybe it was just because it was the end of her shift but we didn't appreciate it and then the million degree interior was a bit much.  I will go back though cause I love me a good Irish bar!!! :)

AGraTma9eEgsiJFDIy6tbg.review_text: I finally went to Irish Bank after all these years!  Good selection of beer.  Food is a-ok (you know, lots of yummy fried food that goes oh so well with cold beer).  Service is good.  Pretty easy to come and go.  Good for groups.  A-ok all around.

51f-gzLdOCAeSNyhdXJX6Q.review_text: I came here this week for happy hour with my co-workers. To start the table ordered a basket of fries. The fries were really good, big, thick cut, and well salted.  I ordered a Smithwicks and an order of the macaroni and cheese. The Smithwicks was a little flat, but wasn't undrinkable. The macaroni and cheese was pretty decent. It was creamy and was topped with bread crumbs. I only wish that it had been baked in the oven for a little while before it was served.   I want to come back here and try their curry fries, I hear they are good...

JhV-D6a2tL6xpzGdBruepg.review_text: Man! I Can't Wait To Go Back! My wife and I were recently in town for the Giants/A's preseason games. On our walk back to our timeshare from AT&T Park we came across this lively alley known as Mark Ln. Hungry from our long walk back we decided to stop in and grab a bite to eat. Unfortunately, upon arrival, Tom, the former Army soldier now Asian bouncer (well he's always been Asian from what I can tell but now a bouncer. This normally wouldn't matter but tonight it did) told us that the kitchen was closed. Bummer! However, he told us that if he were off he'd go to this place down the street called Sauce. So we took his suggestion and headed that way. We were so pleased with our experience at Sauce that we made a point to stop back by and thank Tom for his awesome suggestion. He was happy to hear we liked it and invited us in for a nightcap.  While I am originally from the Bay Area, my wife is a native of Las Vegas and was totally amazed at how everyone in the bar interacted with one-another and acted as if everyone had known each other for years. She said, "you'd never see this kind of interaction in Vegas". I simply replied, "welcome to San Francisco!" Immediately, the bartender  served our drinks, who seemed to be rather a happy chap who spoke with a charming Irish accent. You knew it wasn't faked either for ambiance. While at the bar we met a young Swede in town for an electronic gaming programmers convention. The conversation with this guy was extremely fascinating. I was shocked to hear how clean he and his coworkers found the streets to be in America. I figured Europeans would laugh at the state of our streets. I guess everything you hear about Europe being better isn't always true. Our conversation with the swede rolled into a conversation with two Irish brothers who were reunited this day after eight years. One brother has lived in SF for the last ten years, and this was the brother from Ireland's first trip to the States. The Irish brother attended his first baseball game. He didn't understand a thing about the sport but declared it was now his favorite. He was mesmerized by the game and atmosphere. We had to explain to him AT&T Park and Giants fans were a rare bread. He was even more shocked that getting to first base, second base, third base, and home originated in baseball. He'd always thought it was solely in reference to how far you got with a girl. Utterly hilarious! Witnessing these two reminiscing along with the bartender about their homeland provided our entertainment for the next two hours (we learned that the one brother living in SF was known at the bar as DJ Pat who spins at the Irish Bank for special occasions). What was even more comical was the fact that they were drinking Corona after Corona because they had spent the entire day drinking Guinness and needed to "flush their system".  So it's places like the Irish Bank where you can meet an Asian bouncer named Tom who is a U.S. Army veteran, A Swede who found it remarkable how clean our streets were, and Irish men drunk off their butts praising their love for baseball. "Just another night at The Bank", we were told. In the words of a famous Austrian weightlifter/ actor turned governor, "I'll be back!"

npz4MQW5PjIkqGJmUmEJ9A.review_text: Went to Irish Bank for a friend's going away party and it was great! The atmosphere was amazing. If you sit outside, it's basically in a little side alley that's been converted into an outdoor room. The heat lamps are good so I'd recommend sitting outside. The decor is all vintagey Irish stuff, and at night it's like a special oasis, completely apart from the ultra commercial shopping area that it's in. The beer selection was good, the server was attentive, and the atmosphere was great!  Food was good, not amazing, but good and reasonably priced. I tried Leffe for the first time (a beer) and it's the bomb. Try it.

6roF2jxbZbg0oXra1SxEcg.review_text: This 1 star review is based on just the burger & fries.   Awful. Probably one of the worst burgers I've ever had. Completely bland, dry, overcooked and altogether flavorless.  It's the kind of burger you would find at the concession stand of a zoo. Or if movie theaters served burgers, this is how it would taste. The fries also tasted pretty blah.   To put it into perspective, I haven't eaten a McDonald's burger in 8 years. But if I had a choice between the Irish Bank Burger and a Big Mac, I would choose the Big Mac.   On the plus side, I love the outdoor seating area here, and the fish and chips that other people were ordering looked delicious. I'm just saying, if you love burgers, avoid the ones here. You will be disappointed. And out $9 to boot.

tXhscxwFTd-ayLTdPx_2yA.review_text: Good guiness at this establishment, it seems better than most around Union Sq, and it's a bit hidden so people cannot find it, which means less tourists. The service is normally pretty decent at the bar, and the outdoor seating is cool overall. I haven't eaten here, but I'd assume isn't not that great :)

iGCtbTLMy2kEObhoBU7yoQ.review_text: Quality fish tacos at an Irish place? Odd but true. Also points to the Irish server who wouldn't let me order an Irish coffee incorrectly. Large amount of outdoor seating off the beaten path and a dark indoors that makes you feel like its a time of the day that should involve drinking.

_q_MC7ebjDOCpX5Ec7TXEQ.review_text: Huge alley way with awning, plenty of seating & outdoor heaters (though they can be testy)   Loud, boisterous crowd inside & out.    Came here with a big group of friends & we snagged the 2 big tables outside as we had a huge group of about 20.  Stellas on tap $5.50, Heif $5.50, Bud light $4.50.  Quickly ordered rounds of drinks for everyone and grabbed our menus.    I had the fish & chips $11.50 - came with 3 large pieces of perfectly deep fried cod & wonderfully cooked french fries.  The cod was nice & tender.  The meal definitely hit the spot.    My girlfriend had the hamburger with cheddar -$9  and it was huge.  The bun was very good & you build your own burger, with the tomatoe, lettuce, onions coming on the side.    The Mac & cheese $9, was very thick, but tasteless.  We had to add lots of salt to it.    Cheddar Fries - $8 huge plate of thick steak fries with melted cheddar cheese on top.  No happy hour.  =( boo, we asked if they had happy hour and our answer was "we don't have happy hour, but on Thursdays between this time & this time, it's $1 off Spinach"  WTF?!   And service was slow on the food but fast on the drinks.  Our waiter was not very friendly either. so got docked a star.  but would come back here again for the fish & chip/burger & hanging out in the alley with friends.

pdilmEaeXuntV4eTnc9KcQ.review_text: Oh, the Irish Bank.  That's how many of these reviews go for this place. I've had really good times here.   And saw some really truly dangerously drunk people here.  Well, dangerous to themselves. A girl who fell off her chair.  Her friends just laughed. Hmmm.  Nice friends.

UNX3EEloeyW39kQzrejqDQ.review_text: good bar with a great atmosphere. people are friendly. a great place to grab a drink after work.

dvIhGW4Y7O_oeTWRRVBwpw.review_text: Just Classic!!! We always have a blast here!!

d_Bg88z72HQXt89MnSQ33g.review_text: What is up with the crappy Irish bars in the downtown area?  The Irish Bank is boring and bright.  Please turn the lights down; I want to drink not perform surgery.

wZEonA5crInwry2xqWC__w.review_text: This place is a TRUE Irish pub. Often imitated, never duplicated... I would travel back to SF for St. Patrick's day just to be here! The fare includes your typical Irish fare- corned beef, bangers with mash and Irish stew. I had the stew and it was DELICIOUS. My husband had the bangers which he also enjoyed.   Of course, they have a ton of beer on tap. Me? I just got a bloody mary and bud light on tap. I know.. you can take the girl out of Long Beach but, well, you know the rest.  Most of all I love the ambiance. They have seating in the alley and the walls are covered with memorabilia de Ireland.   Had a great time, will definitely come back when I'm in the city again!

43LbYHo7O9yhaPD4hRWkrw.review_text: This place is fantastic! It's like stepping into another world. I went here the other day looking for some good fish and chips, and wasn't disappointed. The fish and chips are amazing! I also had a bite of a burger and it was great too. The only downside was that the service was a little slow, but that really doesn't bother me. Who goes to a bar for food if they're in a hurry anyways? The servers were fantastic though, they seemed to work more like a team than having their own specific sections.  The bottom line: * great food (especially the fish and chips) * lots of outdoor seating * good for groups

BrETNZLefIOtiqcNX2pdrw.review_text: Full of Irish Americans drinking late into the weekday night. Great Guinness pour

z-oO1tVXUwLt8G1NDZwWDQ.review_text: This place is great for lunch if you work in the financial district. It's conveniently located (and I love that it's located in an alley). The outdoor seating is awesome if it's a nice day. In fact, the majority of the seating is outdoors.   They have awesome cider and have traditional Irish food a well as general American Pub food.   Great place to gather with friends.

AkIFY078ojbZqiN4P_0JMg.review_text: Great Irish Pub just where it should be - down an alley, middle of town, not pretentious. Had about 16 beers on tap and the Fish and Chips were light and tasty. For a $20 meal, with a Guinness, in SF you can't beat it.  I keep coming back.

WkfBcxrs4rqseusB02CIzg.review_text: I work in SOMA, but I have found that the Irish Bank is a great place for a nice cold Guinness. The outdoor seating is nice and enjoyable on a weekend day. They have tv's and play the baseball games as well as the world cup games (when that is going on).   The staff that works there are all very nice and personable. The service is always great and the atmosphere is fun during the week.  I always have a great time and will definitely be back :)

zfMj61GvNbctbFA73q10gQ.review_text: Nice spot in the Fidi, tucked away in an alley.  Bartenders were friendly, wait staff attentive.

3qMnJT5k3sSA565d7N4r6A.review_text: This is my office's go to spot when we want to go out and sit down for lunch.  They have a good selection of pub-style entrees and, if its warm, you can sit outside in their private alley!  The wait staff are always friendly and accommodating which I really appreciate since we tend to roll in with a group for 7-10 (somewhat disorganized) people.  I usually get the chicken sandwich with fries (which is great) but I can also recommend the Monte Cristo or the regular burger.  They have a great list of beers on tap and they make sure we never leave thirsty :P.    I have stopped by after work a few times as well and find the crowd friendly and somewhat more casual than what you'll see at other FiDi establishments.  You can stop by to watch whatever game is on that night or for special events, like Mardi Gras or Saint Patrick's Day!

ePZ7I1kKl9n3QjfaSmCK1Q.review_text: Decent place to grab a pint and catch some international club action. The walls and floors are covered in wood, the bar is lined with stools, there's Guinness and Boddington's on tap, and the waitress on duty usually has a passable Irish accent backed by a solid Gaelic name like Shauna, Kate, or Albion. That's more or less all you can hope for in a Financial District Irish pub, no?   Better food and fewer FiDi d-bag customers would put the place over the top, but that's asking for a lot. As it is, the food isn't terrible, though I recommend sticking with the bangers and mash or (gasp!) a salad; the shepherd's pie and fish and chips are unfortunately both a bit of a mess, though salvageable with a few tablespoons of HP sauce.

s79vzEzqavL_29pmraXZBA.review_text: This place was a blast during a recent SF getaway.  They close early, but worth checking out for sure.   Probably one of the best Shepard's Pies I've ever had and the Harp was very reasonably priced.   I was surprised that they close so early (expected that this sort of establishment would be serving until 2am or close to it), but hey just show up a little earlier and you're good to go :)

1vlLE37kdzopZR4wNINj8g.review_text: One of the best Irish Pub in town, the Guinness is poured perfectly, for a coinisseur it's really important. The food is also reaaly good, service is quick and friendly. I highly recommend the smoked trout and salmon, it's light and fresh. With a Guinness of course :)

FJgGHBvWftdS6bIohwPIAw.review_text: I like that this bar is tucked away back in an alley and I think it's pretty cool that you can hang outside.  Anytime we have family visiting we prefer to take them here vs. Johnny Foley's Irish House.    The food is good for bar food and they have a pretty good selection of draft beers.    Service from the lady bar tender is pretty hit or miss.  I've been there a few times over the past few years and sometimes she is really nice and sometimes she seems like she's having a pretty bad day.

lLfcbYGTeVxQN5Ig0ompJg.review_text: I just came here for lunch with a couple of friends and this is a cool place.  Looks like a hole in the wall from the outside since it's at the end of an alley, but it's really homey feeling inside.  Staff is really nice and they are quick, so having an hour lunch here is no problem.  You don't feel like you're rushing the staff.  I didn't have a drink since I had to go back to work, but I had the turkey club.  It wasn't the best turkey club I've ever had, but it was pretty good for bar/pub food.  This would be a good place to go for drinks though.  I think I've been here before and sat at the bar, but I don't really remember.  Maybe I got really drunk?  LOL!  I'd definitely go back for drinks.

nT3tujYENMjzm7bFkhkLMg.review_text: The champagne splits are nice--we found it more economical to drink champagne than beer here.  I've only ever sat outside, so I can't comment on the inside atmosphere or service.  Wait staff can be a bit unpredictable, depending on who you're matched with for the night.  I've got a couple of favorites and then one woman who is just sour faced and dreadful.  It can be hard to get another round during the busy times, even with one of the better servers, but near impossible if you strike out and get one of the lesser crew members.  I'd skip the food here.  I didn't feel the quality matched the price, especially when you can duck into Akiko's for fantastic sushi, or slightly down the block to Claude Lane for either French or Catalan fare.    Crowd is pretty mundane here.  Lots of people just off work stop in, and then sometimes there might be the odd party of newly 21 yr olds who are very loud and have trouble controlling themselves.  It's not really the sort of place you'd go to for the people, though.  Really, I think it's just a sort of generic place to hang out and have a few drinks before moving on for the evening.

qp_IjZCCBCM5mWWj96225Q.review_text: Love this place.  Good food, GREAT beer selection, good vibe.  Its great to be able to sit outside in the alleyway under the heaters where you can eat, drink, and smoke (I don't smoke but have many friends that do).  Food is comforting and is the usual pub grub.  The only reason they don't get that 5th star is because their Shepherd's pie doesn't quite match up to some other Irish Pubs I've been to.  Still a great place though!

uEaEniJPvwzgbiD-bbcXqw.review_text: This is my kind of place. Relaxed, casual, non-assuming.  Maybe it's because we're packed so tight in this concrete jungle, but doing ANYTHING outdoors makes an activity feel so special in this city. I personally love eating outside, but thanks to microclimates and living in the Rich, I hardly get to do it. I either spend my whole meal making sure my napkin doesn't fly away, swatting gnats, or catching hypothermia. Not fun.  The Irish Bank is located in an alleyway between two very tall buildings, which means no sunlight, but it also means NO WIND. CanIGetAHallelujah?! (I've just realized I should never move to Chicago) You'll definitely need a sweater, but if you're not packing one of those anyway, you shouldn't have come to San Francisco.  I've only been in the afternoons, when it's fairly quiet but not dead. The bartender has always been super attentive, even though we're sitting outside. Our glasses have never hit bottom, and I never feel bad for hanging out.  The burgers are consistently good, I LOVE the Shepherd's Pie, and my bf orders the Fish N Chips. Irish Bank offers a pretty good selection of beers and ciders, and it would take me days to get through all the posters, signage, and Kennedy photos in the place.   All in all, a nice little (emerald) gem tucked away in the heart of my favorite  city!

Mrqlo4m0Kkj544FPg8VaMw.review_text: OK, although I have given the Irish Bank 5 stars, I must be honest, I have not tried everything the restaurant has to offer. Their hamburger is ok, typical pub fair...HOWEVER, their fish & chips, LOVE IT! LOVE IT! LOVE IT! They set the bar with their fish & chips and now everywhere I go, I judge the fish & chips based upon the Irish Bank's.   Their bartenders rock! The best Bloody Mary I ever had, was at the Irish Bank. They do vary pending upon whom is bartending, but they do not get it wrong. If ever you are craving Liquid Lunch, I recommend trying their bloody mary. The Irish Bank also sets the bar with this one.

UEtIK4iVQA99vqMALyKtEg.review_text: Their food is amazing, and they have a decent whiskey list. I love their vegetarian curry, and their mashed potatoes! Their curry is spicy and there's always left overs. Best bar eats in town. I love going here on a nice day or night and sitting outside. Though their whiskeys are a little on the pricey side. I would generally give this place 3 stars, but their food is the additional star.

4hN_0-9l0gffb5rOu6OAtA.review_text: Good happy hour bar which attracts a young and boisterous crowd.  The location is pretty central to FiDi and there are outdoor tables to sit and enjoy the weather, in addition to a few tables inside.  Can get crowded after work and on St Paddy's day and service can be a bit slow.  Their fries are yummy and they have a good selection of beers on tap.

MhVvtOGpFbJ1w-fIWB7z7w.review_text: The Irish Bank Bar is not for people who like to drink alone in a quiet desolate space (can you hear me dad?) This pub gets the asses and the masses to flow within it's small interior. A big happy hour scene can be found. The food is edible and the pints are gold!

K00vevWekHhhIE5jbr37Nw.review_text: Holy MACARONI... and cheese! Just one of the many reasons this place is amazing. Seriously though, the mac and cheese is super cheesy and baked so It's golden on top mmmm!  The Mac and cheese isn't the only amazing thing on their menu, actually everything I have had there has been great. They have some classic Irish dishes like corned beef and cabbage, Irish beef stew and Sheppard's pie. Of course, they also have a great selection of beer.  The inside of the bar definitely feels like an Irish pub, even the bartenders are Irish (accents and all), but I prefer sitting outside in the alley. It's great for groups.  If you are in SF on St Pats, this is THE PLACE to be! They close off the entire alley and have a huge street party. Live music, DJs, tons of Irish beer and tons of people!

vuR9PsGdcxlIOHO25L-3Lg.review_text: We happened upon the Irish Bank when we made a wrong turn.  Since we are always up for a drink, we sat down.  Unique to San Francisco, where else do they turn an alley way into outdoor seating for a bar.  Drinks are cold and good, and if you are looking for good variety of American and Irish food, this will fit the bill.  We even found food that the kids would eat.  Maybe the service is slow, so don't come here on your lunch break. Plan on staying a while and sampling beers poured correctly from the UK, decent food  and just a nice, unhurried place to hang with your friends. And oh yeah, try to get the confessional booth....

byGrEWjZTJ75ip6yYUazTw.review_text: Stopped here for lunch our last day in The City. Great little relaxed pub down a quiet alleyway.  Seat yourself style bar and front of house. 15 draft selections plus many bottled. Food is various pub fare, very decent and FAST turnaround after ordering.  Basket of fries is generous. Removed a star for bartender being too chatty with one customer and making us wait over 5 minutes for our check after we asked for it.

IxKVvGmFIEz77YYL-5_YxA.review_text: This place does only one thing really bad and it's service. Waitresses are few and far in between, so if you're about half through with your drink, you better snag the closest server you find or you won't get a drink until you've sobered up.  I used to come here with my coworkers all the time because it's so convenient and they have a full bar that accommodates everyone's tastes. It's super casual, so if you come with your coworkers, get prepared to know everyone's dirty little secrets.

W_u8cTDOTAz-9HDi7vyJBw.review_text: We ducked in her randomly for drinks and had a great time. It's a bit of a neighborhood bar that reminded me of the places i frequented in college, except with a better drink list.  There was a great selected of microbrews and I found a new brew that I enjoyed.  Great service, too, even on a bustling Friday night.

zkwvGp9_wjVRUMAp-GusBg.review_text: Wouldn't necessarily call Irish Bank a hidden gem since its well known around SF but for an out of towner like me, its pretty cool discovering a bar in an alley, which I consider pretty hidden.  Just right outside of a Chinatown gate, Irish Bank is a friendly neighborhood pub.  Tons of funny pictures and posters adore the walls, straight up old-school decor, its simple and sweet.  And as a golfer, the shoutouts and pictures of Padraig Harrington were awesome.  Bartenders are talkative and some are Irish themselves and its amazing how much more fun it is when you are in an Irish bar served by an Irish bartender.  Crowd is chill and yeah, just the easy going vibe and simplcity of getting beers and watching the game was fun.  Going to make sure to drop by this bar again.

suuIf6JWTZFjSu55k7zTBA.review_text: You turn a corner into an alley and It's like you've walked into a time machine ~ and stepped into a parallel Ireland (without the jet lag).     Hardwood floors, brick walls, cozy lighting, Guinness adverts, and Gaelic signs.   They even turned an ol' wooden confession booth (so I'm told) into a dining box...back room is the main dining area.  Bonus ~ they have Xlerator dryers that dry your hands in a jiff. You can see the power as it makes the skin on your hands flatten with its turbo blow.   Food-wise, my ol' fav. has been the mixed field greens salad (with pear, walnuts, blue cheese) and a huge basket of thick cut fries.  I've also had their Banger (see menu) and it was good.  I think they must've had an off night when I tried their fish & chips..but I'm willing to try again.
