5tPhhRBCB1UYYHx8TFS90g.review_text: Properly poured Guiness by a friendly bartender is always a winner in my book.    I also liked the atmosphere and crowd, no neon-robed hipsters or barely-21ers.  Everybody there seemed to be really chill.  It's loud, but reasonably so, and outside is better for conversation of course.  If I lived in SF, this would probably become my pub of choice.

O5sWNVzAXcyo_4wxiG2cYQ.review_text: It's a pub. They have beer and cider and liquor and bar food. If that's what you're looking for, you can get it here.  I went to meet up with a gaggle of anthropologists, and the staff was accommodating of our group. There were Jameson promoters there, giving out samples and trying to upsell us on buying some Jameson at the bar (most of us were drinking beer after a long day of conferencing). The bathrooms were adequate. All in all, there's nothing to which I'd object.

ulRGjHgUENvIW82cipInhA.review_text: VEGAN review: paid about $9 for their Vegan Alternative, which was a medium sized plate of jasmine rice, salsa, beans, and avocado. The beans were pretty good but the whole thing was bland for what I paid for.   I'm sure this place is better suited for non vegans so I wouldn't say it's not worth checking out! The fish and chips that everyone else got, for example, smelled divine.

wK-nEMXhl0b4sbrMSEoZhA.review_text: Neat little bar tucked away in an alley. Service was prompt and courteous. Decent beer selection includes a good mix of both domestic and imports. I had the Shepherd's pie and it was just ok...a little too sweet for my tastes but filling.

sNwZ_u22NdTGyAxHhTM_Yg.review_text: Love this place. Fabulous outdoor restaurant/seating area. Over 100 seats. Tables for 10 and 2-4 people. Crowded to mellow depending on time of day. Eclectic crowd.  Big afterwork crowd.   Excellent Pub food. Never disappointed. Love those Blue Cheese fries.  Incredible selection of drafts. Love their CA and OR IPA's.

D01KrKs9izEdoT0Eh4i4rQ.review_text: Pros - Large space indoor and large outdoor patio - Good for St. Patrick's Day  - Though limited, there are some west coast craft beers available - Take credit cards  Cons - They do not split checks - Service is mediocre - Higher prices - Food is mediocre

Ge1JTxN0ytKncaoUsiUoSw.review_text: Here on vacation looking for some good Irish whiskey and Guinness figured I'd check them out.. Absolutely amazing experience! Banger and mash are to die for and they run Irish whiskey specials, what more in life can you ask for. Highly recommended! This place is fantastic.

DJ_pDxBy1L-La_qg8EADnA.review_text: I can't swear to why anyone would rate this higher or lower than precisely four stars.  It sure beats the heck out of the cube rat / office mole existence, what with ample selection of cold brews and very fine fish & chips to be had... bump this place far to the five star side.  On the other hand it's not the greatest for people watching and all that jazz, so knock off a star and there we are, your basic, great food great pub not super-people-meeter place, the Irish Bank and Bar.  See you there.

Hawxd0ziKAqzRkmBNS5ZlA.review_text: I love this location to sit outside and enjoy a beer.   Today it was very cold,  so I headed inside and got the beef stew.   It had 1 scoop of mashed potatoes,  but it needed 2.  It didn't come with soda bread,  and the stew was a little lacking in flavor.    I knew I should have gotten the fish and chips.   That was the only dish I saw at lunch that looked filling.   The shepherds pie looked like an appetizer,  not priced that way tho.

4MJ7go3WJwIcak_17vWw9w.review_text: Came here yesterday night around 10pm to celebrate my friend's birthday. It is in some alley-way. I have never noticed it before and I walked around that area a billion times. There was outdoor seating and when we got there, there was a slight line to get in. The bar itself is kind of tiny but it was pretty lively. The birthday boy was already there and had gotten a corner. The people were really nice and friendly. Right before my friend and I arrived this group of people sang happy birthday to my friend.   I went to get three drinks, one for myself, my friend, and the birthday boy. It was kind of hard to get one of the three? bartender's attention because they were rushing around pouring drinks. The people in the immediate area helped me. =] I ordered a Wagner's, a shot of vodka, and a white Russian. The total came out to be 19 dollars. I was surprised. I gave a twenty.   I would have given them 4 stars but the bartender messed up my order. Instead of giving me a shot of vodka, I got a shot of tequila. And I did not get a straw to mix my white Russian.   Around 11, more people started to leave so we were about to obtain a table and seats. Later I got a sex on the beach. I didn't like it.   The atmosphere was really lively. I liked it. Also the bathroom was really clean. Theres two stalls in the women's bathroom. The bathroom itself is kind of cramped.

4Bl7xszryc_-IbxkJtzogw.review_text: This is a great little spot to have a beer and relax. The food is good and of course the beer is too. The night we came in there was a rowdy bachelorette group and they accommodated us. I will be back for sure. I would like to sit outside next time since it was raining when we were there last.

52oH4DrRvzzl8wh5UXyU0A.review_text: I went here for Saint Patrick's day a couple of years back and I was not prepared! It was packed full of crazy, fun, festive people!   When you get there, you go though the cute little alley. It's great there's an outdoor patio to chill at. When I went inside, the entire bar was backed up with people all the way back to the wall. I was on a mission to get my beer so I had my girlfriend hold onto my purse and coat and I ducked underneath everyone and made my way through the crowd and ended up right at the bar! Ordered 2 beers for myself and 2 beer for my friend, ducked back down, and got out of there before anyone realized I cut in front of the entire bar. Mission accomplished!   Spent the rest of the day chillen in the alley and starting random convos with hot young professional guys. That's what I like about the bars around the financial district area, there's never a shortage of cute white guy eye candy. Don't get me wrong, I don't discriminate against certain kinds of guys but I like finding a whole pack of them in one spot *wink*

LnZUtFx6qTWs8NV6lAARxQ.review_text: I LOVE this place!!!!  They serve up an awesome fish & chips, but one must try their fries with a side of curry sauce --- Yum! Super FiDi spot with a great crowd and tasty beers.

tSVp-95FpFsXdtHI2U0ipw.review_text: We were looking for the perfect cozy bar in the city with some good grub. Wasn't it!! The food was mediocre at best, I'm assuming they stay in busniness because they are able to lure tourists in. Don't bother!

dim5Svrt-B1jvvQsOIX22A.review_text: 6+ years later  and I"m quite the regular here, at least 2x per month, usually with work colleagues.  I could write a book based on some of the fun times that I've had.  The food and service is excellent for bar service.  I think I'm on a first name basis with some of them now.    Very fun San Francisco institution, but I would steer clear on sacred Irish days, like St. Patty's or Bastille Day (yeah I know it's French.)  The chicken tenders are the best of all time.

dfYNTBw--CYlZbFz581kYQ.review_text: I enjoy the Irish Bank but have never found anything too special about it. The bar is pretty chill and laid-back and it's nice if you get to grab an outdoor table when there is good weather.  They boast several beers on tap including, of course, Guinness. I've had a couple of beers here and a really good vodka gimlet. Its not my first pick of bars but I will go if someone else picks it...

4MMiTsh7PNtsClBeyZ5FUg.review_text: EDIT:   Email from Stephanie: "Perfect! I appreciate your putting my response on yelp! My manager and staff said they had ever come across such a rude and ignorant group of people - and you can put that on yelp too. Your business is not welcome here! So we are in ageement!"  Very mature response received by the OWNER of the restaurant. This is undoctored email that is a testament to The Irish Bank's inability to accept responsibility for their actions and also their lack of maturity. Instead of trying to make amends and apologize, they resort to ad hominem attacks - because they know they're wrong.   Yelpers, please keep this in mind when you decide which establishment to give your money to!  ~~~~  We organized a large reddit meetup here, and our experience was not pleasant.   Management nagged us continually through the night, complaining about our under-21 guests, even though we had cleared it with them beforehand.  They also complained that we were taking up too many tables - all of us were buying drinks and food; this is the first time I've heard management complain about CUSTOMERS.  Speaking of buying drinks and food, waitresses did not come around nearly as much for a large group. There would be half-hour intervals when no one would come by to service us. When they did service us, they were not very friendly.  There was also a portly waiter who kept on giving my 2 friends and I the stink eye. We were standing up, but not in his way at all. Instead of saying anything, he just remained passive-aggressive the whole night.   Perhaps the worst part about our group experience at The Irish Bank was their Enron-style accounting. We had no idea what was happening with the tab - and neither did they. In the end, after many of us folks left (and paid!), the final tab arrived, and it  appeared that we owed around $130 more than we thought we owed! To be honest, we have no idea what happened, a $130 excess is crazy. I'm not saying anything about The Irish Bank's honesty, but I will say that they offered us poor explanation for it and did not cooperate as well as we thought they would.  On the flipside, the Bank Martini was tasty, and the Reuben sandwich was all right, but nothing "Famous" like the menu suggests.  This place does have a 4 star average review, so it might be a totally different experience if you're coming here with one or two friends, but I can only speak about my experience. I would not come here again or recommend this place for any large groups.   tl;dr - Overpriced drinks, poor service, rude management - no thanks!

-twSpty9KDGNmrhvUjQLYQ.review_text: Another one of those places that I frequent and somehow forgot to write a review for. That should be a bit telling that I actually might like this place. (I do, by the way).  The wine is hit or miss at times, but the appetizers are always spot on. Whenever someone suggests this place, the first thing I think is: "YES! Calamari!" Don't forget the chicken tenders either, because those are damn tasty too.   When ordering your drink, it's best to throw in your order for an appetizer. This place gets packed quickly.

v0F3TDguaTuVizsZgmEqsg.review_text: I loved mostly the very laid back chilled atmosphere and lay-out of this place, I've made it a 'the spot' sort of place and look forward to hanging out there, I've build memories there on dates and just mostly enjoyed the cozy feel that it overs!     I liked the beers I had, although I found the mixed drinks a bit on the weaker side at times and way too strong at others.

kbE0ZbFEplJWmAtS6kyUKA.review_text: One of the girls in our group got kicked out for being too loud.  I guess this Irish pub wants a library like atmosphere since she honestly wasn't being that much louder than the other patrons.   We had intended to end a birthday pub crawl there but instead were forced to find someplace else.  The fact that she was Irish was ironic.

isQxsxlCjj6P8GQ_uuFwew.review_text: The Mac and Cheese is so good.  It's not heavy or what you would expect but delicious.  I love this place for lunch.  You can't go wrong with the Turkey Club.  On a cold day, the room with the "fireplace" is perfect

F3UKpADJ-MLMEQvxAbI-jQ.review_text: This is my favorite bar in Union Square. Its got amazing food and good drinks. I love the outdoor seating area and the servers are super cool. I believe Jesse is one of the servers; he is so cute and sweet. I always send my guests here from the hotel.   Keep up the good work.......

vu82v_ThOo725xS8ZJZPbA.review_text: Great place for a pint when after a business meeting in the Financial District.  I have never had anything to eat more the the french fries.  Why because I am at an Irish pub and I am there to drink.  The staff is attentive and the people are friendly.  I will be back when in San Fran.

xRa_xl9cLRDqZeKGrkiILw.review_text: Love the fish & chips! Great beer selection, and full bar too. Always have a great time here.

u9qJAAggWASYHvZNrYWEDg.review_text: Many folks have said this a place to check out... maybe they  didn't know there was an insect and roach problem, in addition to Bartenders needing some major customer service retraining!  Also, some major issues which ABC would have a field day with.    Arrived here one Saturday night and saw a fairly slow bar. Two bartenders stood around chatting and goofing around as the lady and I waited 3 minutes to get their attention.  After placing our drinks, it literally took another 3 minutes to get the drinks served as the bartenders spent more time goofing off.    GROSS: They had a whole tray of lemons uncovered and it was infested w/ fruit flies.  The lady pointed this out and the bartender got snarky, even saying the bacteria would be killed by alcohol, but they wouldn't give them out again (he made several drinks later using those lemons).  We later saw a roach crawling across the bar, which non chalantly the bartender smashed with a cleaning rag and went back to personal conversation w/ another bartender.  There was a patron who was BLASTED drunk and kept stumbling on stools, people and slurred out his drink order.  I was afraid he'd knock someone off a bar stool.  They ACTUALLY SERVED him more alcohol!  TWO drinks later, he fell off his bar stool and they SERVED him ANOTHER drink.  At 1:30 last call was yelled and by 1:50a, folks still wanted drinks and were served.    If you want a dirty place that has staff more concerned w/ making extra tip $ than keeping a safe bar, Irish Bank is your place!

szhitaiKPsjC15bveyXRzA.review_text: Beer in an alley. What more needs to be said.  5 Reasons to like this place:  1.  Great spot for meeting friends 2.  No Fuss Wait Staff 3.  You can smoke 4.  Cool mix crowed 5.  Best place to start your St. Paddy's Day drinking

3z-rNbD8J2CkzIGR2ecEwQ.review_text: Went there for some beers and pub food, but left after getting the menu. The food is really pricey for pub food, and it's a restaurant atmosphere, so the service seemed a but slow. Typical Irish tourist spot in the city.

aVaa64zb_-d6VTY3XcXyIQ.review_text: MIX REVIEWS.  The first time I came here was the start of our 5:30pm - 2:30am Happy Hour session. That was one long and crazy night. This was the first bar we hit up only to walk in and be the only people of color. The people were nice but it was overly crowded and we just didn't feel too comfortable.   The second and third and forth time I've been here were lunch meet ups. Grab a beer or a shot and have some lunch-eats. CHICKEN WINGS and FRENCHFRIES are the hit. Definately worth the taste.   I'll be back for another visit.

CAFzv8odTxeQsvEM7hARng.review_text: Cool scene.  I like the outdoor seating.  It reminded me a lot of my time in the UK.  But drinks are EXPENSIVE.  I bought a pint of cider and a double whiskey = $24.00 at happy hour on a Wednesday!   Also, there seemed to be a large contingent of the Marina crowd hanging out here.  Approach at your own peril.

Yh9HNK21vI_bJhrPImW_pg.review_text: Great service. Choice of indoor our outdoor patio. Great selection of food. Would highly recommend the shepherds pie! Yum. And the pomegranate margarita was delicious! Great for late night food too!

4paWpLov6LjpsNNgE1fhSg.review_text: Before finishing up an accomplished evening of boozing.  Our group got sick of a cocktail bar we were at when it became insanely crowded.  We decided on another drink and stopped at the Irish Bank.  It was a Wednesday night and we practically had the place to ourselves.  One would think that would in turn equal excellent service.  Unfortunately, that was not the case.  The bar keep seemed annoyed that we decided to even patronize his place to the point of actually being rude.  Not that he even had to do anything.  We ordered drinks and sat down at a table.  We never saw anybody after that as the staff was too busy cleaning and trying to get out of there.  We finished our drinks and moved on.  Unimpressed.

-HD5I6F3BF1lAF9Lnv3IbA.review_text: Great place to grab a brew or get something to eat.  Shepard pie and irish stew was pretty good.  Bleu Cheese Fries are off the ROCKER!  Kinda pricey for food but they have a great selection of drinks.  Place is hard to get a seat at so go early.  Wait staff isn't that great but pretty on par with any bar.  Great place

5ACQMTXlJoJId9_xlDkQww.review_text: Good place to laugh and drink.  I can't recall eating here but I might have!  I like the woods floors and the brick walls.  It feels as a pub should be.  It can be a little tight inside but hey, you might make a friend while sloshing your pint around.  Drink up!

6149FL_RwWxKH0m63xbGSg.review_text: Neat location, although the food was just ok.

6xm0egHwySZCr2VAAtFKyg.review_text: Great place when the weather is warm. You might have to stand for a few minutes before finding a seat. If you have more than 5-6 people then it may be hard to find a seat. Love the outdoor seating area and there are places to sit inside as well.   Definitely get the fish and chips. Very delicious. Nachos not so much, but this is a Irish bar so why wouldn't you order the fish and chips.

Qy6bmAm26_hqLXYpcDMXNg.review_text: This place looks amazing to hangout at! It has really cool decor and lighting, plus eating in an alley way for some reason makes me feel adventurous.. Anyways the food is alright, more importantly the selection is limited. I'd suggest ordering the typical bar food appetizers, and sharing. A little to expensive for me in terms of the dishes they are offering. The drinks weren't the tastiest for me either. If you're into having a different alley way experience, as well as a beer, I'd say check it out..

DgoZVmrGjEOxD4wn-s3Yog.review_text: Boyfriend and I went here the Friday after St Patrick's Day with a friend to celebrate without the crowd.  I've been here before a few years ago, and I had fond memories, but mostly of the baked beans ... which are just from a can (Heinz).   This time I was excited to go, but all of us were disappointed by the end.  The menu online said they have a Ploughman's sandwich which I came to LOVE when I used to live in London.  Then I found out once there -- it was taken off the menu!  But they kept NACHOS?   Really?  Blah.  Also not many other vegetarian choices.  The three of us split the mac and cheese appetizer, hearing wonderful things about it ... but, uh, those people obviously haven't had good mac and cheese.  It tasted like it'd be microwaved and then they threw some bread cumbs on the top to give it a homemade look.  The only good thing they did was pour a pint of Guinness just right, but you'd hope it wouldn't be too difficult for an Irish pub to do that.

A3T1K3IQvwPlL_dYmjDzAA.review_text: I like the irish bank, but some of the servers need to be reminded that they are in the service industry and should show less attitude. In the back, I always see the bussers hustle from table to table, cleaning, helping out with orders, delivering food, etc, while the server is no where to be found. Finally, that person will saunter out and over at some point to check in/drop check.   I was a server and cocktail waitress for years and obviously indifferent service drives me crazy.

CAQv3QQHUasQNtN-HEldAw.review_text: So I came here the other day for Saint Patrick's Day. Yeah, it was a little nuts.  The DJ was decent. There was a huge mob of people. And it was helpful that there were waiters carrying around trays of beer for sale. Cause it was absolutely impossible to get to the bar.  Fire hazard? Definitely.  I think if you come here with the right crowd of people it could be fun. Rowdy, very drunk people. That don't mind hanging out in a grimy back alley getting sloshed.

UE-rXhA8njNnADFkDA3EuA.review_text: Back room good place to chill with friends.

L7VEJP1RrpXRRRWsYIu3tA.review_text: Irish Bank SF: Union Square Saturday January 1, 2011 2 Stars  This place is pretty authentic i.e. smelling of piss and serving crap food.  I am glad this was a stop over until the Rick House opened.  I drank a mediocre Vodka Soda and ordered the Vegetarian Shepard's Pie which was small and way too watery.  Plus I ordered cheese on top of the pie and they just put a Slice of American Kraft Single on top.  Not Good.

OzPv_63sQ0hVJdJlJ4QVXw.review_text: Love this place! First visited it in August with a very large group for dinner and then went back this past weekend for lunch on Saturday with a small group.   The service is not amazing but it's not bad but the food is GREAT! I love the mac and cheese.  The salad with walnuts and blue cheese is really good - although it could use more of both. The Irish Stew is very tasty and even tastier if you throw in chunks of blue cheese from the blue cheese fries - recommend them also!  They come with tons of blue cheese so I guess you could throw some of that on your salad too if you order it all. My wife had the vegetarian shepherds pie and was very happy with it.   The coffee is good. I think this place is only good for large groups in the summer when it is warm as most of their large tables are outside in the alley and it can be quite cold even in the summer.

uiQt9PoIU0kQxet01QyMfQ.review_text: So we are walking down Bush Street looking for somewhere to eat dinner and across the street we see an alley full of tables and people eating and laughing and it just looked like fun. We crossed the street and looked at the menu to find Irish comfort foods that we could not walk away from. We sat outside on one of the warmest nights I've seen in San Francisco and it was just a lovely warm atmosphere. We ordered the Shepherds Pie and Irish Stew. They were both delicious! The service was pleasant and the food came out quickly.  If you find yourself walking by, give this place a try!

ClHkj0uM0S0pxbCmUSKmBA.review_text: This is one of my favorite bars in the city.  The people are nice, the environment is very laid back, and the location is great.  It really feels like you're in Ireland (well ive never been, but i can pretend).    I always have a good experience here...

qPFZ8WL6mYTiUc6DojvpeA.review_text: Service was decent. Food was decent. Prices not outlandish for the area.   Wouldn't recommend but wouldn't tell you not to go.  Oh and bartender and waitress were cursing up a blue streak which doesn't bother me but if I was older like the people sitting at the bar I would have been bothered.

jjD5NVknhcxETxprTEamRA.review_text: I like the Irish Bank a lot.  The Guinness and the food are good! and the atmosphere is real San Francisco.  It isn't trying to be something that it is not - a fact which I think contributes to many of the negative reviews from our friends in Southern California.

pvi_baolWn7mrtcb9rWAEw.review_text: One of my long time favorite for work lunches, and happy hour.  Being a child of two British colonies, I am a huge fan of British and Irish pub grub and especially anyone who can do a good shepherd's pie, or fish and chips. They also have curry chips (fries)... all very well done at the Irish Bank!  Even if it's an overcast day, I still recommend sitting outside as they'll have the heat lamps on.  Great place to grab a pint and some grub in FiDi SF, away from the frenzy outside.

Httk6gs4_1Hn_bxvfjux6w.review_text: On a scale of 1 to Dublin, Ireland, my experience felt like that of maybe the Chinatown in Scotland. I don't understand. Why did my Irish Beef Stew taste like canned sardines?? My beef stew, which the waitress highly recommended, not only came out barely lukewarm, it also  tasted like it came out of a can. Pub food is, by definition, delicious, so it was entirely disappointing that this occurred. And of course the stew would be as hot as the surface of the sun after it was reheated...   If you're here and have to get something, go for the Shepherd's Pie, Fish and Chips, or Calamari. Avoid the Irish Beef Stew!

L-x6d4sOF7YlChfgNJGAkA.review_text: Mexican food at an Irish pub?? Si, senor!  Don't get me wrong, all the pub grub at the Irish Bank is absolutely stellar (I personally have a weakness for the bangers and mash), but the nachos were a decided surprise. I think I could safely recommend anything off the menu.   But while this place is great for grabbing a meal with a friend, it's even better for groups. Tucked neatly in an alley off Bush Street, the large tables and ample seating make it perfect for late night philosophical brawls over Smithwick's or Guinness.

1l_XL1p0RW3MeUZ8b-T4bQ.review_text: I stopped in this pub whilst walking around Union Sq. on a Sunday. It's amazing how many businesses are closed on Sundays when you consider all the hungry peoples milling around...  Anyway, my eating partner and myself ducked into this place hoping to be fed. It's always a nice surprise to find a hidden jewel within the city, and they didn't disappoint!  Great Beef Stew!! Next time I'll try the outdoor seating. Situated in an alley, so you can get your Guinness on and be as loud as you want.

ObQL6bgcSeAAt4qNCJSLMw.review_text: Such a good bar! Dined early on a Friday evening and it wasn't too busy, lots of free tables inside. Staff were quick and attentive without being annoying. Highly recommend the vegetarian shepherd's pie - they are hard to find!

Fn3TmmKQVtOClB8VGVPxZg.review_text: "A man takes a drink; the drink takes a drink; the drink takes the man."  Well that pretty much describes everytime I have been to the wonderful land that is the Irish Bank.    I love this place for after work/work functions.  Good beers, good people, good scotch, good god this place is pleasant.  Everytime I go there I have a great time.  The bartenders are quick, the staff are friendly and even the bouncer seem to be not that menacing.  I have never been more comfortable sitting outside in a dingy alley way throwing back Single Malt scotch intermixed with the occasional Jager bomb.  And hey if you have a few to many and need some pub food to soak it all up with, well have no fear ya heat on, they serve up a varity of tasty vitles.  If your in the area I would definatly recommed checking this place out.

9GCCoFw_UHiAHjZ4kygHgw.review_text: I had not been here in ages, but we took my friend Ann here for her birthday after dining at Gitane. What a hoot we had , three funny girls, awesomely entertaining bartender Jeremiah aka Joaquin Phoenix serving up our tequila shots and doleing out manly wisdom , and crazy stories . Fun crowd not too yuppie, not too hipstery. Good music, and had on basketball which is always a YESSSSSS for me when I'm out . Shout Out to the bouncer who is related to every Tongan I know from San Mateo you are very great .

PTmxRprtkgMtDTuHqb-7-A.review_text: The 5* is for the service, ambiance and location.  4* for the food.  We stumbled over this place after a long day walking in San Fransisco sightseeing (okay, I've been sight-seeing in SF for over 20 years, but still....) on an unusually warm October day.  The restaurant opens up into an alley with outside seating.  Soft white lights are hung across the alley, and fun old signs are attached to the walls, so it is a great visual feast.  The lighting gives a soft reddish glow and the murmer of friends chatting provides great background music.  Our waitress told us she'd like to get our order in sooner rather than later because she was just about to put in an order for a large (20) group and didn't want us to wait. Sweet and thoughtful.  We drank beer and chatted while we waited for our food to arrive.  I ordered the burger, my friends ordered fish & chips, bratswurst & saurkraut.  Burger was good.  The brats that I sampled were fantastic!    Definitely one of the nicest meals and locations I've had.  Loved, loved, loved the ambiance.  It's like in Sleepless in Seattle...,You don't want to be in love, you want to be in love in a movie.  That kind of ambiance.

P73_DQhYI6Oe5X3PZ1PBOg.review_text: I LOVE Irish pubs.  I've been drinking at them for many many years. Probably since before the tall, blonde snotty ("snooty") barmaid has been breathing air. Yet she refused to make my Jameson as I ordered it, and insisted I try the more expensive brand. I obliged.  Why? Why try to steer me away from my beloved Jameson? Why give me attitude?  Why ignore me 15 minutes later when my drink was bone dry?

zosAwt-mNQhcrLhYpOA1-g.review_text: As someone who is perpetually on the lookout for a good Irish pub, I was happy to learn there is one just a few blocks from my work!  I say come here for the beer and cider selection, the greasy delicious pub food, and the cozy atmosphere inside and around the outdoor patio.  There's a lot to like, but if I had a complaint it would be the service. Slow, minimal, not very friendly. Service aside, this place is a hit!

DpiMuxg2g4urzClzjykUHg.review_text: For when you want to really party....

jX52sZoojxyYV2viWNyO7A.review_text: I've been to the Irish Bank a few times, either for lunch or just to grab a couple of pints and watch a World Cup match.   I actually came in yesterday for lunch and order a chicken curry, spicy, and a couple of Black & Tans.   The chicken curry was surprisingly good, though not nearly spicy enough for my taste.   The black & tans were refreshing and hit the spot just so.   I love the Irish Bank and it's definitely the place to be when World Cup fever kicks in.   This place will get insanely packed and they set up screens in the alley.

ayHlDMDiPWgoyBifSBD2Ew.review_text: Back when I was in college, I dated an Irish boy who lived in an Irish neighborhood in the Bronx.    Woodlawn was one of those insular immigrant neighborhoods where the only way to get an apartment was by word of mouth (and only if you had an Irish last name).  My last name, despite what most would assume since it starts with a "Mc," is Scottish.  EVERYONE in Woodlawn asked me why I had an Irish first name and a Scottish last name.  "You LOOK Scottish," they'd say suspiciously.  "I'm half Irish & half Scottish - on BOTH sides," I'd tell them.  "I'm from the West Coast."  For some reason, being from the West Coast explained EVERYTHING.  In Woodlawn, you could shop the main street and never know that you were in the U.S.: - The grocery store was fully stocked with Irish and some English products - The shopkeepers' Irish accents were often almost too thick for my ears to splice through to recognize the English - The sidewalks were filled with people who looked like doppelgangers of my uncles in Maine, my great aunts in Boston, and the distant relations who sent my family a Christmas card from Galway every year - The most popular place to eat was The Snug which served dishes like shepherd's pie and beef stew, and for breakfast, fried eggs with Irish bacon. And beer. Lots and lots of beer.  You could spend all day there, if you were so inclined.  The Irish Bank is quite possibly The Snug's twin sister who took a train out West and is now living the high life in San Francisco's Financial District.  While she's hobnobbing with lawyers and bankers and management consultants, deep down, she's still just an Irish gal from the Bronx.  The dark wood and worn wooden furniture is the same (albeit a bit cleaner).  The creaky wood floors make the same sound.  The moderately friendly (but not disingenuously or effusively so) bartenders pour a good pint.  The waitstaff is attentive and occasionally chatty, but more often than not, straight business.  It can sometimes take what seems like FOREVER to get your food.  The condiment bottles are a teeny bit greasy/grimy but not gross - just used FREQUENTLY. The prices are reasonable and the portions are hearty.  The shepherd's pie is perhaps IDENTICAL in look, flavor and smell.  I think they even use the EXACT same dish to serve it in.  I'm sure Woodlawn has changed since the days when I'd study at a little table in The Snug, sipping a pint and eating shepherd's pie while the waitress asked me about how my classes were going.  Not only, as the saying goes, can you not go home again, but you also can't go back to your favorite haunts and not expect them to have evolved.  At the Irish Bank, I can at least descend back in time - for a little while.

wcwH3HDVkIi9J90XzCZJkQ.review_text: Great place for dinner and drinks. Good prices, cool atmosphere, and good for groups.  Outdoor seating great for nice nights.

eYSWTXiLmZoeOq27rIXWJg.review_text: I do not spend much time in this neighborhood and I am really not sure what I was expecting but this place was neither blowing me away or completely disappointing me. It was just okay.   The menu was pub fare and with a good selection of beer and booze it made up for the lack of creativity on the menu. They did have a nice little alley way to sit outside in and there were plenty of people there to give it a busy feel.   The services was great and ultimately made it a place that I would go back to... Okay only if I was in the neighborhood.

73afVe2aDhU-n7p6c2a9kA.review_text: Scene:  Washington, DC.  Spring 2007  *phone rings*  Me:  Hello? Her:  What are you doing? Me:  Sitting on my ass.  What's up? Her:  Get your ass up and come drink with me at *insert Irish bar name here* Me:  OK.  6 hours later, we are usually getting into trouble with the other regulars.  Mostly her.  I am pure and innocent.  REALLY.  Cut to summer...we both move to the West coast; she moved to Seattle, I moved here.  I was missing my shenanigans at the bar.  A friend told me about the Bank.  I was in love.  It had the same vibe as our old local.  So here is the scene when I go:  *texting*  Me:  What are you doing? Her:  *the answer varies* Me:  I'm at the Irish Bank having a Guinness. Her:  Whore.  I miss her.  This place makes me remember the good times with her and it is an awesome place.  The Irish stew and the Shepherds pie are tits.

iwaBpxdabHX9Bh4MHDQcnA.review_text: My boss took me out to lunch one random afternoon. We had no idea where we were going, but ended up eating at the Irish Bank Bar & Restaurant.  We both ordered Hamburgers and coleslaw with an iced tea.  Our food came out in a timely manner and the food was GREAT!!!!  The burger was flavorful and tasty! They had the condiments out for you to customize what you wanted inside of it. The long quartered pickle was on the size rather than having coin sized slivers inside =)  I wanna def. go back!

rtFI0_GrbF6boXFgxXCxPw.review_text: I really would like to give the Irish Bank more than three stars, but they automatically lost a star for service and then another for an abysmal draught beer selection. My boyfriend and I came here for a late night drink and decided to get a scotch. They had quite an impressive scotch selection (as well as whiskey and bourbon) and we had trouble narrowing down which one we wanted to have. I settled for a Balvenie 12 Year and my better half went for the Glenfiddich. We both were happy with our selections and slowly sipped on them while we took in the bar around us. It seemed to be mostly tourists, which made sense given it was a Sunday night and there are more than a handful of hotels within walking distance.  If you're looking for an Irish beer, they had a few on draught, but their American craft selections were pretty terrible, ranging from Shock Top to Lagunitas IPA (I love this beer, don't get me wrong, but it was the ONLY beer I'd drink there). By California being such a brewery laden state, I would have expected a bit more than their 8-10 beer offerings.  Lastly, the bartender was pretty indifferent towards us, barely acknowledging us and seemed to be put out by us asking for the scotch list. He didn't ask us if we wanted another drink after we finished, and took forever to get our bill. This was ridiculous considering we were one of three parties at the bar and the restaurant was pretty dead overall.  Regardless, if you're close and looking for a drink or two, The Irish Bank will do the job.

tPY1853E2cpsp61WnBorOQ.review_text: When you're finally stumbling into bed at 6 am you've either done something HORRIBLY wrong or Crazily right.  Not sure yet which of the two I was, but it was due to the foocking Iiirish Baank, I can tell you that. We started with an impressive act of being so veeery civilized and proper at Gitane, and still hungry, the act was dropped and the debauchery was full on just a couple doors down on our barstools at The Bank.  When one is after no less than 6 Irish Coffees, and really closer to 8, this is a great place for them. Not sweet, heavy on the whiskey and just enough cream. Sit at the bar and get calamari, the chicken wings are breaded AND fried, the potato skins are crispy, the veggie quesadilla is cheesy and surely your speech will be so slurred by the time you are eating all of these things - will you REALLY care?   Sit outside in the heated patio, yell, laugh and all is right with the world. Until the next morning anyway...

R-3G5dJFTZfzWfwhQ4O-6Q.review_text: Nice ambiance.  Good beer selection.  Service was good. Food was lousy!  I had the Ruben.  The bread was not toasted, the sauce was on the side, not much cheese.  I'll go there for a beer but I will eat elsewhere.

7z-Crwkwo3wyngtjFhdJ9A.review_text: Guinness on tap....good ass chicken wings....thick, garlic steak fries....OH...it's party time.    Good, hardy food to cushion your stomach for a night out drankin...OR just to satisfy your guilty cravings for classic fried/unhealthy food...OH but they have huge salads if you want a lighter something... (it's your choice...)  Chill, plenty of seating, friendly waiters/bartenders, reasonably priced (better than some upscale restaurant that gives you half the food/half-ass food for double the price) ...   CRAVING the fries and chicken wings with a nice, cold beer.  CHEERS

lGJrVpu8smV8KIEB8sEIvg.review_text: Let me preface this review by a few things. I have been going to the Irish Bank since 2000 (that's ten years). While I was working in San Francisco (from 2000-2006) I went there to eat no less than once a week. So I very familiar with the place as well as the people who work there. I am also aware that since I have been going there, there has been an ownership change. I can say before my last visit I would give this place 4-5 stars easy.  So I am back in the States for a while and went to watch the England/USA World Cup match at AT&T Park on Saturday (12/6/10). After the match we decided to head over to the Irish Bank for a quick lunch. (We were a few home sick Brits looking for a place that we know in the past has always helped squash some of the homesickness.)   (I had not been there since 2009 but its always been a known entity so I was expecting a great experience.). The first thing I noticed was that the wait staff just flat out ignored us, so we sat ourselves down. (Before the wait staff had always been super friendly and VERY welcoming).  We got ourselves a menu and a waitress came up and asked us for our drinks order.   The next thing I noticed was that the menu had been greatly expanded which seemed great to me at the time. There were more vegetarian options and more hip selections than there had been in the past. The Irish Bank for many years has been known for its fish and chips, It even won a award once as "best in SF" and I had ordered then many times in the past, so I ordered them this time.    At this point I was still a little disappointed in the way the staff treated us but after half a pint of so I was feeling better. My friend and I were sitting there deep in conversation and I think sometime during that someone from the kitchen brought out my fish and chips. We were so busy talking we didn't notice him. He must have been annoyed because he basically shoved the plate in my face and said "here!" and marched off. (He was rather unkempt and had a really unprofessional bushy beard as well.)  I was really annoyed at his behaviour but I again let it go. But then I looked at my plate. The fish and chips were totally different than what I had had before. The fish used to be in a very nice, flaked batter, very similar to what you get in Great Britain. The fish in front of me was in some type of hard, dark brown cocoon that looked more like something you would get from the store. The actual fish was tough and rubbery and had a batter to fish ration of like four to one. It was really horrible. I was so disappointed. And the chips? They were so dark from being cooked in dirty grease they were as brown as leather! And so gross!   Also, I should add almost the whole time we were there our waitress disappeared for most of our experience.     I just am still gob-smacked. What the hell happened to this place? It used to be my favourite place to eat at in all of the Bay Area. I can tell you this woman will NOT being going back.   It's not just how bad everything was, it's has far it's fallen. So sad...  .

4m66tpqKs8JmoA26vB5xpQ.review_text: When we vacation in SF, we always end a good day of running around the hilly city with a drink at the irish bank.  Its easy to miss, it is tucked away in an alley off of Bush.  We have met some great people here (Armand if you are reading this, we still look for you every time we come).  I will be back many times in the future, until San Francisco falls into the ocean.

1cHMe44Z8RG_Skrr6jQb3g.review_text: This is the only confession booth I'd visit in town should it be available at The Irish Bank. Even though you're served the same grub as the rest of the crowd, the food somehow tastes better devoured in this little private space next to the bar; the burger slightly more bloody juicy and the corned beef and cabbage slightly more sinful ;-) Make sure and top off your blasphemy with a draft cider.  Otherwise, if you're looking for comfort food, look no further. The Irish Bank offers a well-rounded menu of comfort ranging from fried Fish & Chips to Banger Sausages with buttery mashers, Shepard's Pie, and old school Reuben sandwiches on Rye.   The servers are friendly, and should you want to find them outside the bar, some of them play in the band Cannons & Clouds - great stuff.  All in all, thank you Irish Bank for making me a fan. Cheers!

gG_mGXctTjz0_q0MCSOjgw.review_text: Seriously? Is there a requirement in San Francisco for there to be one half ass/rude/lazy bartender/waiter at every bar?   After the wedding we went here to have some food (as most of the people had hit their weekly quota in the drink fest the night before) and everything was going well. The food was pretty good, with special props to the chicken nachos and the blue cheese fries, and everything was going OK. about a half hour later they informed us the outside was closing. It was almost 11 and we understood. The inside was packed to the gills and we were all pooped, having just done all the wedding stuff, so we decided it was time to go to our respective sleeping rooms.   So we asked for our check, and she tells us there are too many people to split the check. WHAT!? We've been here how long and you're deciding to tell us this now? Where was this information when we started ordering? Then you had the testicles to charge automatic gratuity. Personally I wouldn't have tipped. I'd had enough of piss poor service. Luckily some people were willing to pick up the slack due to the single check and horrible breakdown.   It wasn't too bad of an offense, but I probably still wouldn't go back.

KkROZ55YW6DYXqeS8O5tuw.review_text: I've been twice now and been mischarged, despite their website, sfirishtimes.com, and the signage in the bar clearly stating 50 cent oysters. When I've pointed it out, both times, it has been explained away as incorrect signage or "not being available expect during happy hour". Precisely this type of consistent poor customer experience is why I will not be enjoying this bar again. Bar food was decent, their Turkey Club is good, and the drinks are reasonably priced. Any establishment that cannot provide honest pricing, I will not be a patron of.

-UQ-y50reLgTch4q7FPn4A.review_text: I've been to this place a few times and I really like it. It's away from the main roads and convenient for after work drinks for those, like myself, who work in the financial district area.   Somehow I come out of this placed only fairly buzzed and a $200 + tab for drinks alone. Bet hey, at least it's a good time.

bM1vovFIegj7naEzhIRIDg.review_text: I've been here a handful of times. Each time I thought the beer was overpriced, the servers were slow, and the last time I went the waitress tried to steal about $100 from us.  Our bill was like $190, and we gave her about $225 in cash [not a bad tip for just drinks, right?]. Then she came back with a bill for $110 or something. It was incredibly confusing, and was eventually rectified, but I swear on my mother's tits she was trying to pocket that money.  Actually, the only reason I went there was because I was dating a girl that liked to go for a drink there with her boring workmates. But she dumped me, so fuck her and fuck this place too.

BEaq7RCP18anqfIaBCY6ZQ.review_text: Ended a fun night of bar hopping at the Irish Bank. The bartenders were Irish, the crowd was fun, & drinks were replaced right away after the last one was finished. Great pub!

h0js35x4a8MMFtEQ6BqKkw.review_text: Good place to chill after work or after dinner, tucked into a private alley in downtown sf.   Nice outdoor seating, esp on a warm day.  Extensive menu of drinks bottled and draft.  Bar fare--  hamburgers, fries, fish and chips with reasonable prices.  Wait staff is very friendly.  Would return with my friends if in the area.  ;)

BLmRIoETvx6ZiegiIWh0tw.review_text: .This is my absolute favorite bar to stop at after work with a group of people. It has outdoor seating during nice weather and it has a decent sized indoor seating area as well, especially if you're ordering food.  We go in around 6 and start our evening with a round of Irish car bombs,. The bartenders are friendly, the mixed drinks are strong, and they have a nice selection of beers on tap. We order some cheesy chips and chicken wings (not hot wings sadly, just normal chicken wings) but the savory food more than takes us through the evenings. A pint of Magners, a pint of Smithwicks, a pint of Leffe.... we alternate what we drink throughout the evening and occasionally will order another around of car bombs.  Their food is a bit pricey, but it's solid and goes well with my Smithwicks or Boddingtons. We can drink at a relaxed pace and get away from the madness of work by walking only 2 blocks.  Their bathrooms are quite small, but I won't begrudge them that. Overall, it's a fantastic place to spend the evening and a favorite place of mine for Friday nights. See you there.

h5qf9owtv9q8HjaNcrz3OQ.review_text: One more star for the Irish Breakfast.  Don't get the mac n cheese or the shepherd's pie.  The Irish Breakfast is where it's at, especially if you're hungover.

Ll_jDY55b3U8QdGu4As-2A.review_text: I came here with a drunken horde of revelers celebrating the birthday of a friend of a friend. I'm just glad they only told us to keep it down and didn't kick us out. Part of the restaurant is inside, I think; it was just a snapshot that I saw on my trips to the bathroom. We were in the outside area, which was one of those SF alley deals. Yeah, funky, but cool enough.  I'll be back.

K30_uarmtuuKNuDtFGRRqQ.review_text: I love this place, we sat in the confessional.   We were hungry and the portions were on the small side so we ordered another entree to split between us. So I can review 3 things, the beef stew is good and hearty but just not enough if you are hungry in need of a hearty meal. The shepard's pie was good too but too small and not worth the price but the fish and chips were delicious, better then some that I have had in the beach town where I live!

kTyUWj655RmKuBw6DV7z6Q.review_text: A great place to go for a drink or two. We went late at night so the outside seating had closed. We ended up seating in the booth, there is a booth seating 4 comfortably. The alcohol list was impressive but the front bar had a beer stench. We didn't eat but fish and chips looked good!

i_DR3vdE73nVm2GlMbGpGA.review_text: Did you ever want to sip a beer in a dirty alley at noon on a Monday?... I do, frankly quite often.   Stopped here for a quick beer while I was in SF for a recent work trip. I saw this place from my Uber ride window and thought to myself, "I need to go there". Irish Bank and Bar has that old school fisherman bar feel on the outside, a little dirty, with pigeons and random seagulls hanging around waiting for that coveted morsel of food to drop.   The inside is what I imagine an old bar in Ireland to look like. Dimly lit with lots of wooden trinkets and old school photos from the Irish countryside on the walls. The bartenders here are a bit salty, but charming at the same time. Great beer selection with multiple craft beers on tap and from what I saw, a decent looking menu, but I didn't snack during this trip.   I tried coming back with a few friends later that night and it was packed!, "Note to self avoid Irish Bank on Monday Night Football". Great bar and good vibes, if you're in San Francisco definitely worth the trip for a quick pint.

ZyAZbm0Di8l0ynNhxSlc7A.review_text: My friend and I ate here on October 9th, 2011. It was a late lunch and both of us were quite ravenous. We were sorely disappointed with quality of the food. Allow me to be more blunt: the food sucked. The most simple of food was bland and unattractive.  The fish and chips was bland, the fries soggy, the so-called sauce was little more than mayonnaise in a plastic container. My friend ordered the prawns. They too were bland; the accompanying salad was drenched in a bland dressing that pooled at the bottom of the platter. The vegetables were undercooked - the "chef" didn't even bother to blanch the carrots and broccoli, nor even salt them.  Ok. Now the positive notes, of which there are few. The location is superb, just off the beaten path of Union Square. The outside tables in the ally way are comfortable and welcoming. But that's it.  We learned something that day: Don't go to the Irish Bank for the food. EVER. Go there for the drinks. Go there for the location. AVOID the food.  Food at the Irish Bank? Bad Idea. I just want to make it very clear about the food.

umHl4t4Dr61K8tP5UsGL-A.review_text: A great place to go to for a quick beer and sandwiches. The sitting area outside is perfect to hangout after a hectic day at work and smoke a cigarette along with your beer.

bQmaM2CTQOncLukDndJC0A.review_text: Cute little hole in the wall bar! I absolutely LOVE its location- it feels like you found some exclusive, underground bar that only the cool kids know about. This is actually my brothers go-to spot after work or if he's meeting people up around town because at least if he gets here early he can get started on a drink.  They have a great beer and cocktail selection. I felt like being girly and going light so I got the Magners pear beer and it was good! Service is great and there's a lot of different things you can snack on so I would highly recommend venturing out to find this place. Since it is in an alley, it might be a little hard to find so just bring some friends and call it an urban adventure.

ZJlNrE2Z_i_-6IKeciRO7g.review_text: I get that it's a popular locals dive bar, so it's hard to fault that.  From my view point, it's an ok place, definitely been to much worse.  It's nice to hang out outside, and I've had better (and worse) bar food.  Still, for me there's somethong about this place which doesn't quite gel with me.  The menu does have a "vegan alternative", which at least is explicit (beans, rice, guacamole), but is hardly filling.  The vege burger *might* be vegan, but I wouldn't bet on it, and there's fries too.    They have a nice selection of beers, but they've been out of some of them every time I've gone, so a little disappointed.  I've not tried the cocktails here, but I'm guessing the old school bartenders really know their stuff with mixed drinks.

DYyD1OUCZj3Lo4zW-coeZg.review_text: Short story: Rude, disorganized and unprofessional.  As to quote the owner "You cannot just turn up at a restaurant and expect everything to be fine".  Long story: Keep in mind this was a group of polite internet nerds (reddit)....  I contacted the Stephanie Perry, the owner I think, about renting out the function room. After a few emails back and fourth we agreed not to rent out the function room because it was a casual meetup and I couldn't guarantee we would hit the $1000 minimum. She said we could still use the room  but it would  not be private. However it was very clear that we expected closer to 40-50 people. We agreed to come in and grab tables as needed. I have organized a lot of meetups and have had nothing but good experiences in the past. The Thirsty Bear and  Rouge are two awesome places for groups.  The day of the event we got there and no one knew we were coming. Instead of welcoming us and apologizing the bar manager was obviously irritated.  Throughout the night the bar manager  complained we were taking up too much and when we had about 30 people, also known as paying customers, he told me not to take up any more tables. Those tables sat empty the rest of the night. There were quite a few other issues which have already been highlighted in other reviews so I will jump right to the emails Stephanie sent me.  Two days later I get an email from Stephanie asking me how it went. I ignored it.  Two people from our group posted their opinions on Yelp. This morning I got this email from Stephanie: My points are starred*  I am deeply offended by the allegations made on Yelp by name removed  and name removed - giving us one star each.  You did NOT have a reservation. You cannot just turn up at a restaurant and expect everything to be fine - you expected anywhere from 15 to 50 people - how can we, as a functioning restaurant, plan with a spread like that - that was the reason you didn't make the reservation - you couldn't guarantee your numbers.  You said "we will just grab seats as they come up." You prevented us from putting our best foot forward.  *She knew we were coming, she knew the group would be large and yes, you should be able to walk into a restaurant and expect good service.  If you had made a reservation the dining room would have been cleared.  If you had made a reservation, there would have been ample staff on to accomodate you.  If you had made a reservation, my staff would have been ready for you and therefore the "Enron style" accounting would have been clear.  *Once again, she is confusing what reservation and paying for the private room. We informed her of a large group. We declined her offer of a private room.  It took 1.5 hours for you guys to figure out the bill, costing me staff overtime. Obviously it was not clear to everyone that there was no tab and that they actually had to pony up. *This doesn't even make sense. We were out around midnight. We never planned to skip out on a bill.  If you order 9 carbombs - that's $90 - I personally went through every drink check and food docket - not one person was overcharged. *She wasn't there and already admitted to Enron style accounting.  We are a hard working threesome.  We strive to make everyone's experience a good one - I feel we were victimized when you showed up without a reservation, and again when two of your people yelped us.  We take this very personally. *Victimized by paying customers?!?  I would really appreciate your talking to name removed  and name removed and letting them know the status quo.  This just isn't fair.  I replied back with: No one said we had a reservation, ever. The emails I sent you to inform you of a large group are below.  I organized a meetup for a website, I have forwarded your email but I can not control the opinions of others. Your wait staff was awful, rude and disorganized. This is one of many meetups we have had and we were very unhappy for the first time ever.  I don't even use yelp and didn't know what it was until you messaged me. However I did sign up and I will post your email to me as a review of the irish bank; I think it speaks for itself.  She asked me to include her reply: Perfect! I appreciate your putting my response on yelp! My manager and staff said they had ever come across such a rude and ignorant group of people - and you can put that on yelp too. Your business is not welcome here! So we are in ageement!

gTBXZLSlx9xvfbV5h-uNuw.review_text: It has been a long time since I have darkened these doorsteps... or shall I say Alleyway. We went on a long walk last night and found ourselves here for a few cocktails and tried out also the Mashed Potatoes with Gravy as well as the Smoked Salmon and Trout with Wasabi Creme Fraiche appetizer.  We added more butter to the potatoes because it taste like it was missing something and the Salmon and Trout plate was ok. My Lemon Drop was meh but you shouldn't come here for a Martini you should come here for Beer or an Irish Car Bomb, I mean after all this is a Irish Pub right? :)  Respectfully Reviewed

noeaParoQDHPljaUv59lGQ.review_text: After a long hard days work, my boyfriend and I strolled up and down the streets downtown. Looking for what? Who knows...All I know is, he kept suggesting dingy bistro after dingy bistro, when I thought to myself, "I could go for some Irish fare" when suddenly, The Irish Bank appeared in front of us! Its not so often your cravings are answered. I had to answer fates knock, so we made our way into the restaurant.  It looks like your typical restaurant/pub except there is cute outdoor seating, probably nicer at night, but cute nonetheless. We wandered to the back, sat ourselves and waited for the fabulously flustered waitress to take our drink order. We could tell they were busy, and we were in no rush, so we didn't mind the 10 minute wait. After the waitress took our drink orders the service was very prompt. The only reason I gave this place 4 stars instead of 5 was because the drinks (Pint of Guiness and Pint of Pear cider) tasted a little watered down. for 3 bucks a pint, I probably wouldn't mind, but for 5-6 bucks, I expect it to taste like it just came outta the bottle, not watered down.   I ordered the Shepherd's Pie and he ordered the hamburger(typical guy food). He wolfed that thing down faster than I could finish though, that's for certain. When they brought my food I was surprised because I'm used to shepherds pie being in a long shallow plate, not the souffle looking bowl they brought. After I sunk my first spoon into the meaty potatoey delicious souffle or brule or whatever heavenly thing this pie was, I was hooked! So yummy and comforting, the dish I've needed since I moved here 6 years ago! The Mash was cooked on top just so much that it created a slight fry/cheesy crust around the edges, and I feel like the depth of the bowl locked in all the juices. I would go here again for sure! And I plan on it soon, maybe after some drunken brawl when I could use a pint...

dIQnYbjf-rTxn5dQoRr0bg.review_text: Casual, low-key, carefree drinking and dining close to Union Square.  In the dim lighting, seated outdoor in the alley, you could almost imagine yourself transported to Italy or Spain... maybe even Ireland?  Stick to the traditional dishes though.  Translation: steer clear of the chicken curry.  Way too sweet.  You probably wouldn't order Bangers at a Chinese restaurant.  So why risk chicken curry at an Irish one?  :)

v4bqDR4Mi70VtYRRGaoSyg.review_text: If you're into the Irish pub experience, The Irish Bank is for you. It has got lots of photos of Ireland, Nuns and Priests on the walls, wooden floors, barrels and kegs, etc. They also have outdoor seating, which would be pretty nice when the weather's warm. I took a friend here, and it was really crowded and loud inside, so we went to go sit outside, but after just a few minutes, they started tearing down all the tables and chairs and putting them away, and told us we needed to go back inside. Bummer. Even though the pub is open until 2:00am, they close down the outdoor seating around 11pm.  It eventually calmed down inside, so we were able to hang out for a few hours at a little table, having a nice conversation and drinking Cranberry Tonics. As you approach this place, fight the urge to turn around and run for your life. You have to walk down a side alley to get here, and all your instincts will tell you that you're in a dangerous place, but don't worry. It's a lot of fun.

k0PWpsB2GoMBFPPECyyv4Q.review_text: A bit pricy even for San Fran and the food wasn't the best. It was later in the night and fairly busy but I was expecting a little more.

FRSoGLPQI16pus03avyaSA.review_text: Oh Danny Boy! Irish eyes are definitely smiling, especially on St. Patrick's Day, and all roads lead to the Irish Bank! IB is one of my favorite Irish bars in SF. It's an annual tradition (3 of the past 4 years) for me to celebrate St. Patrick's Day at the IB! They always decorate so festively with the massive green, orange, and white balloon arch at the alley entrance, and streamers and shamrocks galore. Also, all day entertainment is provided with live music and traditional dancers. Of course, the crowd is jovial and energy is awesome, especially if you've had a few cocktails. (For me, it'd be an Irish coffee to start and then the rounds of Guinness, the bombs, etc.,) Last year, my friend, Amy G and I woke up at the crack of dawn to head over to the Irish Bank to catch part of the Alice 97.3 live morning broadcast of the then 'Sarah and No Name' show. It was a wild and crazy morning of complete drunken chaos, but so much fun. Here is how crowded the alley gets static.px.yelp.com/photo… and here's a pic of No Name with his samurai and ginormous stein of beer static.px.yelp.com/photo… Aside from hitting up the IB for St. Patrick's Day, I've also attended many Happy Hours and birthday celebrations (including my own). Of course, the best place to be seated is outside, especially if the weather is lovely. Even if it's a bit nippy outside, well, all you need is one drink (Irish coffee, Guinness) to warm you up! If you choose to sit inbe indoors, I recommend sitting in the confessional with a few of your closest friends. This is the only bar I know of with a confessional. Once you confess your sins, they'll be absolved with a shot of Fernet or Jameson :) BTW, the IB food is actually quite good and reasonably priced. There's a wide selection of sammies, hamburgers, salads, and other entrees like steak and  corned beef and cabbage. A few of my favorites are the cheddar cheese fries and the mac and cheese (Yes, I'm a cheesy type of gal)! I swear this mac and cheese is one of the best I've ever had! No joke! As for the fries, halfway through this year's Chinese New Year Treasure Hunt yelp.com/biz/chinese-new… my team and I decided to make a pit stop at the IB for those tasty fries and beer. They were thick and crisp with the perfect amount of cheesy melty goodness on top (as we ordered the cheddar fries and the blue cheese fries). The plates were practically licked clean. Service is decent here, and never had any bad experiences. Can get slow when it's super crowded. Ladies, the bathroom only has two small stalls, and allows for maybe 2 people tops to wait inside if stalls are occupied. Otherwise, you'll be waiting outside the bathroom doors, just across from the Men's room. Of course, I'll be back at the IB! The Irish Coffee and Guinness are calling my name in the morning..."McGilly"... Sláinte!

ILvXe0EWKAH45eyUUxlv0g.review_text: My friends and I found the Irish Bank Bar & Restaurant when we were roaming around San Francisco looking for a place to drink.  You kinda find this place if you walk through an alley. :P  Inside the alley, there are tons of tables and chairs where you can sit at and drink.  We were here for a good 2 or 3 hours just hanging out.  The whole time, there were always people checking up on us seeing if we needed more drinks or water.  There seems to be a lot of different kinds of beer here... I wish I could say more about the food but we didn't really eat anything.  The only negative I could find about The Irish Bank Bar is that since we were sitting in an alley in cold windy ass San Francisco, it got a bit cold because of the wind, and the cars driving by.  But this is still a cool spot!

3xSH1TbBcaAZ8sOZqef4OQ.review_text: Step into this place and immediately be reminded of Ireland.  The road-signs plastered on the outside are still glowing from the bloke who ran off with them on the side of the road.  Pretty fabulous pint of Guinness and Harp here, It can be hard to find a good one here in the city.  The waitstaff is significantly untraditional.  For this place to be a tad more authentic, I would have expected a bartender who was half cocked and shouting expletives at us as we ordered.   Overall a great pub.  I'm looking forward to trying some of their food.

p3heVCnq3M0H2LMxIuuc5g.review_text: The Great: +  A nice selection of beer and whiskey +  Lots of seating in the alley and inside +  Quality bartenders  The Average: o  The food.  Typical Irish Pub Grub - nothing crazy.  The Poor: -  The "frat boy" clientele the evening I visited.  Picture mid/late 20-somethings ordering shots at 5:15pm which led to a lot of singing of sh*tty songs.  -  The trash smell coming from the alley.  Yum.

6iQF02aNgeOk8s8dougtKA.review_text: So my dear friend Tugce is moving back to Turkey so she had her going away informal (Facebook invite only) gathering here. There were about 20 of us art students all sipping bank margaritas and vodka tonics. We didn't eat any food, but the drinks were good and reasonably priced.   It appears that they close the outside after a certain time so one star deduction to the bouncer that told a few friends to go inside with their drinks or he'll "knock them out of your FUCKING hands and onto the ground".   Geeeesh, Angry much?

TJMgOTcm2ShyOpablSYbXA.review_text: Milling the streets of San Francisco, the urge to grab a beer and sit on some sort of patio overcame me. As a passerby, the chatter from the side alley where this place is located was too enticing to pass up (this seemed to be the only outdoor area on the block) and clearly it was a good choice - so said the nearly-75 people drinking on the patio, so in I went.  It was packed with young professionals and 20 and 30 somethings during happy hour on a Friday. Seemed like the cool place to be after a long hard week at the office. My friend and I fit right in - as we too were in town on  official business (although this Friday was our "play" day.)  We didn't eat but the food smelled pretty appetizing. Bar food standards like fish-n-chips, nachos, wings, etc. seemed to be the most popular. And the beer selection was pretty good - but we only perused the drafts.  On a nice day this seemed to be THE spot to be because of the patio but I'd imagine overall, it's the local "Cheers" for lots of nearby office goers. Everyone loves a good patio, yo.

YnJAu0hRWCx3gMDYZ9vX9Q.review_text: The first time we came here, it was fantastic, loved the food, service was good, fairly quick, and we left full and satisfied with our meal and experience.  Second time here, our server REALLY sucked. After our food came we were abandoned, no water refills, no asking if we were ok, and we had to ask for the bill eventually when we realized no one was watching our table any longer. The food was still great so we will probably give it another try but if we have another bad experience we will likely pass in the future.

KhjOWuMOTtLuxqqjMaoagA.review_text: Went here with the paki playa and his friends. Was a fun bar, cool people, Irish atmosphere, loud drunk people, really nostalgic of Notre Dame bars. Only one bathroom for guys and paki playa threw up for an hour in it till they finally kicked him out.   Would have been a good night had someone not backed up into my car and crushed my fender, headlight and bumper. ;(  if I go here again would park at a garage a few blocks down rather than right out front.

D3NRLiPg4DVid2c9rtBJ5A.review_text: When I walked into The Irish Bank with four friends, I felt like I was walking into another English/Irish/Scottish ex-pat pub (yea, they all resemble each other, deal with it).  When I sat down with said friends, I started to feel like I was in a nut house.  First, a stumble-drunk, middle-aged Mexican dude saunters over to our table and immediately starts on a nearly incomprehensible tirade about types of beer commonly consumed on the premises by different nationalities.  No one of my party speaks a lick of... anything but English as far as I know, certainly no Spanish to speak of, so I'm left to translate his Spunglish into coherent words and phrases as best I can and respond accordingly.  He brings over menus and continues, only because my friends are finding him more entertaining than awkward.  When the balance shifts in the favor of "ok drunkie, take a hike," I politely shoo him away.  He returns to his post, the edge of the bar by a cash register, where I'd seen him out of the corner of my eye on the way in.  He squats a little, tips a standing beer on the chest-high counter beside him toward his mouth, and suckles away without the bottom of the bottle leaving the counter's surface.  At this point, about 5 minutes since we entered the building, this is the only attention our table has received.  It would have probably been a more enjoyable drinking/dining experience had it remained that way.  Unfortunately for us, an unabashedly impatient, ponytailed shrew bellies up to the booth next, soon showing **discernible aggravation** at our having decided to order beverages and food together, rather than running off a list of one first, then the other.  Each subsequent visit from her to our table is like an angry nun in a reading room, rearing a whipping stick as she passes the "misbehavers" whose voices are raised too high for her liking.  Everyone clams up and hopes she doesn't bite one of us, then shoulders decompress as she walks away.  Looks of disbelief, confusion and hilarity are exchanged among us following each character's departure from the table.  The $6 pints are tasting more and more expensive.  It suddenly occurs to me that there is a distinct possibly that the first of the two extreme threats to this business' return customer factor **works** for the establishment, but is apparently only gracing our table with his presence, and only when the spirit moves him to wobble our way for another soliloquy in his own private language.  I personally leave my table to inform one of the uniformed, undrunk waitstaff that his double-dipso coworker by the bar should probably call a cab.  Moments later, after assuring me he'd "take care of it," he's engaged in jovial, half-spanish/half drunk-ass Spanish conversation with him, which lasts for the duration of our meal.  The Irish Bank broke nearly every rule in my hospitality industry book, on top of serving utter shit for food (fresh from the freezer Ore-Ida fries and Dinty Moore Stew covered in just-add-water mashed potatoes in a re-purposed crème brûlée dish masquerading as a "Shepherd's Pie") and charged us $50 to do it.  Laid back and slacking off are not synonymous.  If you were going for that sardonic, "I don't give a fuck" kind of aesthetic we see in Guy Ritchie movies, you missed.  Those places have character.  You're an overpriced frat trap.

w-UUD__OCINqlqED7iysCA.review_text: Great place to relax in between neighborhoods. This place sits just outside  of Chinatown and about 3 blocks from union square. The bar has outside seating which is in between two buildings. Beer is good. I've tried their yellow curry and it was good. Also it has nice clean bathrooms. Always a plus in the City!

8Aq_UdlsrjhBwGWb_U-xRA.review_text: Had a drink here with some friends visiting from out of state on a slow Sunday night.  The beer selection is very good, and the decor is pretty cool with the vintage photos on the brick walls.  We walked in and just grabbed a table in the dining area; the table top and one of the chairs was a bit sticky.    The waiter brought us menus, but we told him we were just there to drink.  He brought our drinks to the table pretty quickly, but damn he spilled some of my Lagunitas IPA on the table top.  Not once during our visit did this guy show any facial expression - straight faced throughout.  There were a few other tables with diners and drinkers, but overall the place was pretty quiet and a great place to have a conversation.    That was up until the kitchen guys decided to turn on the music in their area.  All of a sudden loud Hispanic radio filled the rooms, and this place didn't seem so Irish anymore.  That was our sign to pay the check and get out of there.  I was told that the Bloody Mary was to be avoided - just lots of Worcesterchire and Tabasco and very little alcohol.  Honestly, by appearance it looked like chilled brown gravy in a glass.

adKonsQWY64vJYglPotH5Q.review_text: Tucked inside a Financial District alley, The Irish Bank has such a cool pub feel that makes you feel at home in Ireland. Then again... I've never been to Ireland, so how would I know? There are two sections to this place, the bar and the restaurant. When you sit in the bar half (even if it's at the seated tables) you need to order food from the bar. If you sit in the restaurant half, then a waiter will be at your service. Kinda weird but okay.   I ordered the Corned Beef & Cabbage ($12.95) which comes with a side of mashed potatoes. You know they're not doing a great job when the mashed potatoes taste better than the main part of the plate. There was something off about the corned beef. Perhaps it wasn't fresh, or maybe it was the fact that the meat itself was not very flavorful. I was craving corned beef (weird craving, I know) but I was let down. The mashed potatoes were amazing though!  I also tried a little bit of the Shepherds Pie ($9.00) which tasted super beefy, but perhaps that's the way they intended it to be. Wasn't my favorite Shepherds pie in the world.   The Bloody Mary was very good, and they have a plethora of other cocktail ideas if you need help deciding what you want to drink. The bartender was cool and friendly. This seems like the kind of place where someone can easily feel comfortable as a regular customer.

UySLQuZU6SOuuMO4J74x7w.review_text: Moderate Prices. Extensive Beer list. Extensive Whiskey list.  (only 4 japanese ones tho.)  Their food is par for the course for a pub. Nothing great, but good enough to eat with drinks.  Get; Fish and Chips: Just some decent fish and chips. Chicken Strips: These taste like the frozen kind, but they give you a lot and we all know we still eat the frozen kind.  Other notes: Their Fries are steak fries.

WuRID4UDZKVE7K-F0OkC1w.review_text: This is a proper Irish bar. It's a bit hidden away and underground. And it seems quite authentic.

QjNjVF-ZdWr-P4zUzXwpVA.review_text: I've never really been impressed with this place besides the fact that you can sit out in the alley and look up at the night sky while tossing back a black and tan.   The drinks-$$  The service- 2 stars because it's only one bartender and he's always too busy to take a drink order.  The seating at the bar-non existent  Old men breathing down your neck-Quite plentiful  Entourages of greaseballs-Also plentiful.  Hey a$$holes, if I want to get picked up at a bar, I'll go to Ruby Skye, hike my skirt up to barely legal and giggle at your lame jokes then. But when a girl goes to an Irish pub, it's usually to drink. Take notes.

e5Xfh-vAbMa2Rs9AoYMYsA.review_text: Came here after sushi for pre-running drinks on SF Marathon weekend.   5 people in the party and we were seated in a nice area. Started first with drinks and then food, then of course, more drinks... The waitress was excellent. She had a great disposition even though we were acting like total tourists to the bar and could not figure out what we wanted.  We ordered the Ruben and some Blue Cheese fries.  Not extraordinary food but hot, fresh, and totally perfect for the atmosphere of the place.    Had a great night there and totally love the ambiance of the place. Being of a strong Irish-Welsh background it totally made me stop and look around a while to revel in the past.

RUAb4yMazoRbbCNAxlbsFQ.review_text: It's a SF tradition.  For St. Patty's day, you start at Irish Bank.  No brainer.  The lines are ridiculous, I think we waited about 40 minutes, but that's just part of the Irish charm.   Inside gets pretty packed, as you can imagine, hordes of people dressed in green, sloppy, high-fiving, loud, laughing, standing around conversing with random strangers, picture taking, drinking heavily.  I think we stayed for at least 4 hours, or until our words became really slurred, our voices really loud from not being able to hear our own thoughts and our faces bright red from all that jameson.   Good times indeed.  The entire time we kicked it near the porter potties, but it really didn't matter because it started to rain, and per usual St. Patty's day was a sh*t show!  Woot!

Zw8bR22pwu04BgXK5L05Ag.review_text: Not sure if this was a racist moment or not, but I was the only black person in a large crowd watching the World Cup semi finals this morning. And I was also the only one that was asked to purchase something while I was waiting for my group (we were planning to order bfast and watch). Whether it was or not, it's still lame and counter to general celebratory World Cup feeling in the city. Heading back to my local bar where they'll probably have free pastries. Won't be back.

IIxUa3aVY7fT2wpM0rsJnQ.review_text: This is your standard neighborhood irish bar.  The vibe was decidedly divey, which I like, but if you're looking for a fresh (smelling), hip bar, this probably isn't your place.   OK beer selection, plenty of whiskey's and a pretty neat outdoor seating area that could be good for larger groups (up to 10-15 i'd think.  All the tables were full on Tuesday around 7, so might want to call ahead if possible.   I didn't have any of the food so I can't comment.

UnwlB_CahheIvLuANmcWBA.review_text: I used to come here and get my drink on when I worked close-by.  Mad fun....crazy fun.  But this time I ate food.  Specifically Fish & Chips.  As you know I have a list here on Yelp JUST for it.  And I am happy to report The Irish Bank's Fish & Chips makes it.   Here's how to grade Fish & Chips  - Nice crunchy, battered outside, fluffy, tender inside.  Its that simple. Oh, whats in the batter I'd like to know?! And they don't skimp on the portions either like alot of places. It was slow for a Thursday lunch which was "a good thing" (as Miss Stewart likes to say) because 1. dealing with downtown San Fran on lunch hour is a real bitch.  You can sit in the alley, smoke, eat, get  your drink on and watch all the craziness go by.  2. The service is great. You don't want for anything ;-) Thanks Brittney!  See you all soon!
