XXmmHLQqY1gMAcQlgteBjQ.review_text: I feel like I am the last one to know about this place, but went there for the first time last night. It's a solid pub with a great mix of after-work & generally local people. The beer on tap is good: Guiness & ciders included. I really liked the low key, welcoming feel and the bartenders were really good at being attentive without overdoing it.   It has a great selection of hearty bar food too. Arriving starved, I got a big bowl of beef stew. Everything includes mashed potatoes on the dinner menu. Score.

1sGYXSkJHPhJ6wQtc-RbZw.review_text: Last weekend in SF.. My pub loving boo and I yelped.. say it isnt so! AND found this pub near our hotel in a little alley.. FOR a Monday night this place was packed.. lively and fun.. TONS of beer on the list.. Im an Irish cider girl.. My boy is a english cider type.. ying and yang.. but it works.. and even grabbed the 5 from me.. AND since that was the night my 9ers whooped the Cards in my town.. I am feeling generous:-)

QMvKdCyjwCzqQey1Y32nKQ.review_text: Classic SF spot, you must visit at least once.  Great Irish Pub hidden in the alleys of downtown and dripping with old time awesome.  Pub grub is good, both authentic and well executed.  Beer selection is a major selling point as is the atmosphere.

ba-WbH2sxdAZqjt64gHirw.review_text: So ventured here with the co after work the other day because we decided eh lets go into the city and grab some grub. Granted our mid set at the time was demanding we get munchies asap so this seemed like a brilliant idea.  Ended up at the Irish Bank... now It may have been my slightly altered state but we learned a few things.  1. there is a sign on the street (one of those sandwhich boards) in the alley where you walk in. The door next to the sign is for a sushi bar 2. wheny ou walk in you walkinto a bar area. The resturant area is acccctually towards the back. 3. you order food from the bar when you sit in that first area. Outside and in the returant area serving is normal style.  Food Co got the mac and cheese, I got the sheppards pie. We were in heaven. The food came out hot and was super quick given how busy this palce was. I literally wanter to bury my face in the food. It had nothing resembling low calorie about it but my gawd were both dishes delicous.  Oh note for the ladies, delicous eye candy strewn all over the place. Def def coming back here again for drinks!

75ZLaeDULpJmC84KP1nccg.review_text: Really nice place. Attentive staff, good vibe, good food and most importantly, good beer

AWuTSbGKI2RKWa7oYdPIbA.review_text: Great drinks great food great time

9e1izoQvo7YDDA8QnU2KCg.review_text: 3.5 stars  The shepherds pie hit the spot, but I'm not sure if it was because: (i) I was hungry, and/or (ii) I had already slammed back an irish car bomb and snakebite on an empty stomach. Now that I think about it the next day (with a slight headache), the sauce may have been reminiscent of sloppy joes. I liked it at the time though! Decent drinks menu that included the major pub standards (e.g., Guinness, Magners). I took a sip of my friend's pomegranate martini, which was tasty. I was a tad surprised by how much shots were, but I guess we were in the financial district (if your goal is merely to enjoy a beer and hang out with friends, however, I can think of a few other bars that charge less, albeit not as nice and maybe not as many concoction options).  The patio area is really cute (I'm a sucker for strung-up lights). And even though we were outside in SF, the heat lamps kept us warm enough to cast aside our jackets.  All of the servers were nice and friendly.

S5lUSdYWEK7U6c2F5lQTwg.review_text: I came here about 2-3 years ago when I use to work nearby. So today I called my friend and said I had a craving for Shepherd's Pie and he suggested this place. He's like the best I've had so far and I agreed. :D this was at like 2:30 and I was drooling up until he picked me up at 5.  So we get there, waited in the cold for about 10 minutes before we had a waitress come show us the menus. We ordered ginger ale first and let me tell you, the one I got was totally watered down. It looked like carbonated water LOL.  Homemade Macaroni and Cheese  - it was very good. Cheesy goodness, although I think it's slightly watery compared to the standard mac n cheese that's typically thick and creamy. But it was still good.   The Bangers - it comes with Heinz baked beans and your choice of a scoop of mashed potatoes or fries. I picked mashed potatoes. YUMMY! I asked the waitress to put it under the broiler to crisp the mashed potatoes a bit. It was delish. The bangers? The best part of the dish. I love bangers, they're kind of like bratwursts but the exterior is crispy. It's so juicy.  Shepherd's Pie - ground beef mixed with vegetables and topped with mashed potatoes and put under the broiler to crisp it up. It was so good, unfortunately I don't eat beef anymore but I do recall it being extremely delicious. A MUST to try on the menu.   Chocolate Lava Cake - I've had better at Roy's Restaurant on Mission St. This lava cake looked like they just put some chocolate ganache on the plate and slapped a warm chocolate cupcake on it (which by the way, for some reason the cake was split already on the side) and served with two scoops of Vanilla ice cream in a side dish. The warm ganache wasn't even coming out from the middle it was on the bottom haha. Not even suppose to be like that.  Overall I enjoyed my dinner with my friend. I'd go back again *thumps up*

zz_N38dhBx6GaIlMXL3UTA.review_text: A solid Irish pub. Great selection of pub style beers, including of course guinness, harpers, boddingtons, murphys, etc. The place knows how to pour a legit pint of guinness, which according to the masters requires the "double pour technique", clocked in at 119.53 seconds. It makes a difference - I've had a straight pour and its a glass of foam. The bar snacks I've tried are good and I like how you can order from the bar at night - helps keep an even keel whilst imbibing your third pint.  The ambiance is typical Irish pub, but done well. There is a church confessional tucked in between the two rooms - I NEED to get that spot someday! Needless to say you must be quick because people jump on it faster than an open spot at the bar.   I love the Irish bank on weekdays, or weekends during the day. Weekends at night this place can get super crowded and the bar can't handle crowds very well. Due to the prime real estate on which the Irish bank sits (off Union square) prices per pint are around $6, so not the cheapest.   The breakdown: 4.5 stars for atmosphere                            4 stars for drink and food                            2 stars for price and crowd

gf11skk4AT52oJXKxUAIpA.review_text: Fun, casual atmosphere--great place to go and grab drinks and catch up with friends. Friendly staff, cool interior. They have this really cool booth you can sit at that's actually inside of a confessional. Pretty neat. Not a very wide range of beer on tap, but they do have chimay.

bvfRCpgnJGyeakYhLHKGxw.review_text: four starts for the bar and an extra one for the beer.  the staff was friendly and helpful explaining the beers on tap, providing a sample and inviting us to return for bastille day. BASTILLE DAY? WTF. since when does an irish pub celebrate a french NATIONAL holiday.  there is an explanation ... since the bank is surrounded by french restaurants who celebrate bastille day ... they joined in.  i'm not sure i'm satisfied ... but at least its something.   i won't be back for bastille day but i will certainly be back for the Boddingtons (Manchester) - it was quite possibly THE BEST beer i've ever had.  I'm ready to jump on a plane and fly to manchester to see if the beer tastes better there (that's how good it was).

_Sb0OPaUxTAtvABdcikluA.review_text: My husband is Irish, so we checked out the Irish Bank. We loved the fish and chips! Great beer and great atmosphere! We will be here again when we return to San Fran!!

iAk617lLNH2M2FRxMHAxNQ.review_text: I arrived at this place on the arm of a Londoner and he had already been here and seemed to really like it. Any place that will pour me a solid tequila shot (or a shot that resembles half a glass of tequila rather) is OK in my book.   The bar has a lot of space, and a jukebox which unfortunately was being hogged by a fellow drinker. You can't hear the music from the other room which was a bit bothersome as I love my tunes, but overall the place was pretty legit.   I'm not sure I would come back however as nothing really jumped out as amazing or spectacular. There are enough other bars in the area that I'd probably give those a shot first.

zaXK04RqnjTEiNQh26DECg.review_text: Navigating through a dark alleyway in the midst of dumpsters from both sides, Miss Princess Stab Stab (Juv) and her Irish accomplice accompany me through this walk. Juv pointed out that it would be a great place to dispose of a skinny little white-boy..  As we approach the bar, the exterior immediately radiated this rustic backwater charm. White brick walls littered with Guinness tin pub signs give this place a Wally's Filling Station feel. I sit down, take a deep breath and really enjoy the relaxed atmosphere. Here is a bar to have a few drinks and relax. Every time I find myself in this area I have trouble finding a relaxed bar with a chair to rest my lazy bones and this is it. I mean who wants to go to a bar and stand anyway?

ZbOK_2m4kifew3lzTep1yQ.review_text: *meh*  I went here for DYL last friday, and even though walking there from the Bart station was easy, everything else was a bit...weird.   We couldn't stand on the sidewalk. They don't have Patron Silver (wteff!?!?) Good selection of beers, however Lost an arm wrestling contest with Chris Table situation was awkward Took a tad long to get my cc back...or to get noticed at the bar.  But seriously--WHO DOESN'T HAVE PATRON SILVER?! Oy.   Other than that, I don't think I would come back again unless DYL suggeted it.   *meh*

8KaLOrvfPtOnh51PSIUjag.review_text: Good selection of drinks and food. But my veggie shepard's pie was cold in the middle :( and was gross other wise. I really wanted this to be my mclarens (how I met your mother lol) I'll try the nachos next time and drink maybe I can enjoy this place since its across the street.

YeEUeu7W3TM9PjBsGlyktg.review_text: Met a friend here to hang for a bit. Love that it's in the alley and there are cutesy tables outside- makes the dining experience fun (until someone smokes cigarettes while noming). The inside is kinda crusty.  Not sure how the food is, didn't look super mesmerizing.   Would probably be back sometime to try whatever else they have.

GeUApCq_Z53u0fSDpdV9_g.review_text: Quick rundown of the place:  The Good: - The outdoor seating in the partially-covered alley is fantastic. The indoor seating is also cozy and comfy.   The OK: - The food and beer is what you'd expect at any pub with a more extensive food listing.   The Ugly: - Service was robotic. - I left my credit card there and called the next afternoon to ask if they had it. The bartender who answered the phone said he was the only one there and asked me to call back in 3 hours. Yes, it was my bad for leaving my card there in the first place but having worked in a bar, you know to expect people to forget things at a place where alcohol is served. If you're debating which is more important (a) confirming whether or not a customer left their credit card (which all usually get stored in one place and takes about 2 minutes), or (b) making sure that someone else gets their beer 2 minutes faster...I'd choose "a."

TS2j_gt5qugbmQ1R_fq6TA.review_text: Been back and yes, my original assessment, along obviously with that of others, is dead on. Fuck this place and their horseshit prices. It seems like the owners do not care about their customers. Too many better places in North Beach or elsewere to spend time..

4VS2xa8FJqi8KAp6aO43xQ.review_text: We have been in San Fransisco 3 days and have been here 3 times, AMAZING!! My husbands favorite place  - the bangers and mash and fish tacos are to die for. Bartenders are great , bar is exactly what you want in an Irish Pub. A plus, great shopping is close on Grant for the ladies who want to leave their hubbies drinking while they shop. This is what my husband said to me after the first 10 minutes there - "this place is the greatest place on god's green earth.  I love you so much that maybe you should enjoy a little time to yourself."  Case closed.

WD0pchQWVY5tBbPqRq4zjQ.review_text: What's cool about The Irish Bank is when you are in the restaurant, you feel like you could be in Ireland.  The decor is great!  I went there today with 2 friends for lunch for the first time and we were impressed.  Though we were at work and couldn't have a pint, we had a great lunch!  My one friend had the fish & chips and loved it, my other friend had the reuben with blue cheese fries (yum!) and I had the non-Irish grilled chicken salad.  It was all fantastic and we had excellent service. They also had a great jukebox with the best tunes (Journey, Guns & Roses, INXS, etc).  Great place, great decor, great food.....what more do you need?

64ni_KeQRBXixeg9V90t_g.review_text: I've only been here one time before but it was for their St Patty's party after the parade. And it was awesome! Great, fun crowd, block party atmosphere, DJ and dancing outside, and the party went on for HOURS. I will most definitely be coming back!

UyjOsdvAPTqwUvy581k8Tw.review_text: Who's that cat on Kitchen Nightmares? He'd be unhinged. But me? I was just fine. Pour a good Guinness and I'll forgive most all else.

lBaoq2G8xXrSX_esMQXM-A.review_text: Found a new hangout in Union Square, The Irish Bank. As we turned the corner, into the alley we were pleasantly surprised to find the alley filled with tables and chairs. The outside of the building walls decorated with pictures and plaques with a single vine climbing the drain pipe. On a sunny day in SF we couldn't have asked for more. I give the atmosphere outside a 5 out of 5 on a sunny day. The outdoor ally seating, reminded me of Boston, very quaint. We had a drink, some good hearty potato skins (each skin was a half of a medium potato filled with bacon and cheese), and lightly battered, mostly rings, calamari. Friendly server, clean bathroom, can't wait to return. The bar was small so on a nice day outside is best but as it started to cool down the inside looked better.

Rd_k48XNACxaSBN0D8uk3Q.review_text: Great place to come with coworkers or large group of people especially for Happy Hour. On a beautiful day you can sit outside, albeit in an alley but its still fun and casual.

E8KE7YpKi1d1WiBn3snJ7g.review_text: Ended up going here twice.  Once, on my own, just for drinks.  Sat at the bar.  A fine bar selection with fun and friendly bartenders, and all the appropriately Irish decor.  Rather hazy recollection on the bar tab, but I think everything was reasonably priced.  A second night, came with friends for dinner.  Sat in the inside dining room (outdoor seating was jam-packed).  Tasty pub grub, no complaints whatsoever with the food quality.  Our waiter, however, clearly wasn't interested in doing his job that night - after waiting a solid 20 minutes for the second round of drinks to come out, I decided to pack it in.  Which was really a shame; this really does seem like the kind of place you could hang out all night and have fun, but this waiter sort of blew it.  Everyone has a bad day though, so I'm rating based on the food, drinks, and ambience alone.  And I'll add - for some reason, I really like how the outdoor patio is basically a dingy-looking back alley.  It looks a little scary, but it really makes the place feel even more cozy and authentic.

__Ksf1CCgaKdS3Gi5f6PcQ.review_text: 2 of us walked there after having lunch@Kuletos. Loved the outdoor seating and even the inside though wished they hadn't re-done/polished the wood floor which gave it a "new" look which didn't sync with the rest of the decor.   Had an IrishHoney whiskey and a Pisco - both at $6 each.   Extra star is for the fact that you walk down an alley to get to it and it was a nice reveal!

8nz8la1jPkNAzbQnUkDLlg.review_text: nice irish bar, get there when it is not crowded.  not super great food, but hey! it's and Irish bar!

anNnpsq6qO34hYHqFS6Onw.review_text: Authentic! As in, full of Irish people! From Ireland!  The location down the alley is very charming as is the interior. This is not too much of a scene-y type place and has an "everyone is welcome" atmosphere (although, I imagine due to the downtown location, probably attracts a lot of finance types). If I lived in SF, I would become a regular. Food looks like legit pub grub, can't wait to come back and try it.

Valva2MGzBW8ux3641YINA.review_text: I love Irish Bank, what is there not to love! Magners, Outdoor seating, nice staff, hot bartenders, and good food. I'm happy :)

nWh05uXTfV-L7s3iZon4Fg.review_text: One of my favorite Irish bars in SF if not in the us!,  I've probably been here over 10 separate times.   I've been to Irish bars all over and several great ones in Boston and back east, but I always find myself thinking about Irish Bank. Is it that it's a small intimate place? Where you can go to easily engage in conversation? Or that the bar staff are mainly from Ireland and make no nonsense drinks. I always get Guiness but my wife loves the Bloody Mary's!  Overalls we go to SF several times per year and make it a point to stop by Irish Bank each visit. The feel of it is just homey and friendly. A true gem in the city.

sQNYG8IYEqdWhyIB5EZXyw.review_text: The Irish Bank is nestled in a small alley along bush st. The crowd there seemed really fun and the staff was upbeat and friendly. Earlier i the night they have tables and chairs set up in the alley . It's actually a romantic feel if your in a pub.The beer there on tap is a great selection. They have Chimay, which I love. If I am in the area I would  go back and try their food that all the yelpers are talkin about.

DU0aChhQp8QIkhjbVcNreg.review_text: Overpriced. Bad service. And bland food. Stopped here with some friends while we were walking around the city. And were defiantly disappointed. Irish pub with bad pub food. The waitress was not attentive at all. And the drinks were all watered down. Look elsewhere.

Do7YdH7oWi9Ya8x1Tyrd-A.review_text: This venue is not accessible.   Yes, there's outdoor seating - after a fashion, meaning that they may or may not have placed a long table across the entire street in such a way as to prevent ramp users from getting to a seat. (It's also dark and hard to see in the alley, bad for vision-impaired folks.)   But the loo is inside and up several steps. Inaccessible loo means I can't drink here, and won't be doing so. (Yes, at some locations I will stagger to a potty on my cane - but the indoor part of this place is usually so crowded that it wouldn't be safe to do so.  And most wheeled people don't have that option.) I'll get my Irish fix at the Chieftain or Foley's.   Food's not bad, booze selection is good, so I'll be generous and give 2 stars. Disabled folks who end up here by accident should know that there are several major hotels within a few blocks; sneak in and use their loo instead.

KB6gQqzPVtHBcD40wf09pg.review_text: Seems silly to Yelp about a place that's such an obvious choice and happy hour staple for a ton of people, namely me, but I must say, it's da bomb.  Way back when I was fresh out of a long-term relationship and had somehow forgotten (or maybe never knew how to begin with) how to mingle, my lady co-workers half forced me to go drink with them at Irish Bank and showed me the ropes. It's relaxed, cozy, pub atmosphere helped me feel comfortable and, shortly after, get my drank on.  Outside in the alley also offers plenty of seating, though sometimes there can be a wait to sit down. I've often found myself perched atop a bench drinking while waiting to swoop on a table. The food is pretty legit for what it is: pub food. Filling, oily, satisfying. Cheese Fries and Fish 'N Chips are exactly what their description is, but still good.  Mind you, I've been back more times than I'd like to admit since I first popped my IB cherry. I'm still awkward, in part due to being home-schooled and generally sheltered in my youth, but maybe not as awkward as I was some-three years ago.

ybzMdj9nlpxGOtNYiMRQww.review_text: Divey bar down a little alley.  Plenty of tables although it got really busy fairly early.  I don't get proper bangers and mash everywhere, so when I'm in an Irish bar it's usually a given.  The mash was delectable - light and fluffy (I could practically feel the butter clogging my arteries!) but the bangers were slightly overdone, which was a shame.

BKZ3RBsw0WFtu21c1HCXkA.review_text: Cool location but I have to be honest the bartenders are unfriendly....the guy that looks like a washed up Lance Bass is particularly rude.... Long story short, not a good local watering hole.

xp9UEkFyz7h7Ii1XVzU4tA.review_text: What better place to go for lunch on an uncharacteristically warm summer weekday in San Francisco than Irish Bank?  I "grew up" at this place, eating the perfectly-crisped fish/chips or the wonderful shepherd's pie, washing it all down with good Guinness.  Happy to see that it is still kicking, hidden back in an alley away from all the hustle and bustle of downtown SF.

6Xq3MjkgWhyma7-DgWio1A.review_text: We were in San Francisco over a long weekend with friends visiting from overseas and decided to pop in here for a quick lunch. After taking a table outside, we were promptly brought menus and our orders taken quickly. This was the last time we saw our waitress throughout the rest of the meal.  The outside dining is nice and the location is great! Unfortunately, the same cannot be said for the food. Two friends opted for burgers that ended up being cooked well done instead of the medium they'd requested. I ordered fish and chips that were very bland, a bit soggy, and had batter that fell off the fish. Our other friend ordered a BLT. She was satisfied.... after all, how do you screw up bacon, lettuce, and tomato?   We sat for about 30 minutes after finishing our meal. I saw our waitress duck behind the building at the end of the alley to have a cigarette and when she returned, we STILL waited another 10 minutes to be checked on.  All in all, mediocre food and horrible service. I could honestly never recommend this restaurant to anyone.

i5Pzwgajl7DwJ-Iu5IhuHg.review_text: L-O-V-E The Irish Bank.    If you aren't smitten once you stroll down the quaint alleyway on the way in, then just leave now.  You don't deserve The Irish Bank.  I love walking in here and heading straight to the back.  May the Gods smile upon you if you get the nook booth.  You are one lucky bastard.  But even if you get a normal table in the back your stoked.  Depending on the weather also try outside.  They do have heating lights out there so it doesn't get too bad.  And if it does, DRINK UP and get warm.  Inside is better for 2-5 people but if you come with a larger group odds are you will only find space out on the patio.  They have Magners on tap here, which I love.  Can't get enough hard cider personally.  But the thing that sets The Irish Bank apart from many other pubs is their food.  Fish-n-Chips to die for.  Just ask Tiffany Y.  She knows I know my ish when it comes to a good Fish-n-Chips :)  Big steak fries, none of those puny over cooked Mickey-Dees fries here folks.  If you like Bleu Cheese (and by like I mean absolutely effing love) then do yourself a favor and order the Bleu Cheese fries.  Superbly bleu.  They also have astounding Mac-n-Cheese.  Just like mom used to make (especially if your mom was a drunk irsh woman generous with the heavy cream and cheese and didn't care that you might die from a heart attack at 30).  Do yourself a favor and go here.

MbFiVsqtIt75yrUNd8LT3Q.review_text: I ALWAYS GET THE BLOODY MARY HERE. mmmmmmmmmmmmm...  SO GOOD. you know how some places make their bloody marys a bit THINK and chunky? this place makes 'em FRESH and spicy! you can control the level of heat... the first time i got SPICY so it hurt my ears, but the second time i went i ordered medium so it was much better.    the food is mediocre, though... once i got something with mashed potatoes and it tasted like the boxed type... i dont think it got cooked all the way because the texture was thick, dry, clumpy, and bland... like the kind they served in my elementary school. eeeeeeeeeeeew.   but either way, the place is cute, always seating, and i had good times with good friends!

jAiGoRmj3eAkeH_3KfudXg.review_text: Conveniently close to our hotel, my group headed here to knock a few back after our dinner up the street. You walk down a little side alley to enter the bar, which has an adorable outdoor patio area.   The bar is quaint and cute, this is not one of those corny, tacky "Irish" bars with cheesy names like Paddy O'Leprechaun's or Shamrock McGee's, this is an Irish bar done right. There's an eating area in the back, cordoned off by some curtains, but since we were there to drink we sat in the main bar area. There's also one little booth that reminds me of a little wooden stagecoach.   The have a decent beer list, more weighted to the European imports, and decent prices too. We were tired and only stuck around for a few drinks, but it seemed like the later it got, the younger and douchier the crowd got.   Bottom line: Cute little spot that I would return to if I were in the area again.

DDMfZyHCj3h3sMNzPORPFA.review_text: Absolutely amazing!!! Best Irish spot in town if you have ever been it'll let you reminisce if not it'll transport you to ireland for sure!!

Rkhm3bht88rhk5pR3kF3FA.review_text: This place really impressed me. Located conveniently in an alley right off Bush Street, their outdoor seating area is like a little a little slice of Europe right outside of San Francisco's Union Square. A few blocks away is the crowded, touristy, Union Square chaos (can be fun for shopping if that's what you are into, but not a favorite destination for many locals), but the Irish Bank stands as a little oasis from the mayhem.   Here you can sit outside on a pleasant evening, have a beverage of your choosing (we didn't try the food), and get the ambiance of a European outdoor cafe like the ones in so many plazas.

veLWPGA-1MMtcRNDYWm-BA.review_text: This is always a favorite.  First off the food - Love the Ceaser, and the Mac & cheese.  The fish and chips are Always good and the Ruben is yummy too!  Second - love the drinks!  Reasonable, great selection  Third - love the tables inside made from old sewing machine tables.  Service at times is so-so, and although the bathroom is clean (a plus) the tables are usually kinda icky.   But that of course isn't enough to keep me away!

CrU5x7DwcKh7IPJykps0Kg.review_text: I live in Chicago and the whole city thinks they are Irish, which means there are more "Irish Pubs" than folks that are actually from Ireland.  Don't get me wrong, those bars are always a good time, but for the most part, they are just a place where fraternity meets burger and is washed down with a pint.    I'm happy to say that my preconceived notion did not apply to the Irish Bank Bar.  The place was dark, smelled of rich mahogeny and there were thick accents coming from all directions.  My friend suggested with order chips with bleu cheese, which turned into one of the best decisions of the day!  A mound of fries covered in bleu cheese (see photo) and then sprinkled with vinegar over the top.  As soon as they arrived on the table, I told the waitress that I didn't need anything more than a beer to wash it all down with.  DELICIOUS.

58v49MNYAJXxzxNsJvsoKA.review_text: I love that this place has its own little alley. And I like the fact that its patron are actually irish. I'm not a huge drinker but I like the atmosphere. It's got a decent selection of brews for decent enough prices considering its very close to union square. But it's so tucked away mostly locals will find it!  I'd go here again!

7wE9-V_U8SFeigW5y86iIQ.review_text: I always love coming here for a Guiness. Food is decent too.

ayKuaErf6MtGmCDpA3_hwA.review_text: (1PM today, ally tables)  Before i get to the food....  My friend and I ordered a Stella. When it came out, mine had lipstick on it. No biggie, these things happen. I call the server and he takes it away.... straight to the table behind me and serves the same drink to a woman...  That's that gets a 2-star.  The food... fries were good. I ordered the Rueben and the meat was dry. Not too tasty...

djWl0HKJwEwWlY-0vo7oRA.review_text: "Where are you taking us?" After you get past the smelly alley without throwing up from the stentch of urine, garbage, and who knows what else, you are rewarded with tables on the street and a fun, lively bar. Service was pretty good considering it was a packed Friday night. Lots of beer on tap to choose from and a full menu if you're hungry. Great for large groups. No happy hour specials, but their prices are decent.  - Mac &amp; Cheese: okay - Chicken Fingers: yummy, crispy, a bit salty - Chicken Wings: crispy, seasoned and peppery - Fries: nothing special

Y3u-FdtcM86GtsWA6mrnuw.review_text: Ive deposited a lot of money at this bank, with outrageous returns. They have a great St. Patty's Day block party.

CNaaizAUc2c4WIb1M3BBPw.review_text: On our way back from Chinatown one late afternoon, a coworker and I discovered this place while walking up the hill on Bush St.  This place is a PLEASANT SURPRISE!!  First off, you don't even know it exists.  There's a sign on the road, but when you turn the corner into the alley, you are hit with a ton of tables, filled with people drinking!  Soooo cool.  The bouncers wait in the front of the alley, check your ID's and direct you in the joint.    The inside is dark and mysterious.  Lots of wood planks everywhere.  Wooden bar, wooden stools, exposed wooden walls.  Definitely looks like my perfect impression of an authentic Irish pub.  LOVE THAT!  Bartenders are cool, drinks are affordable and everyone is there to just have a grand 'ole time!  If you're in the area, you need to check this place out.  Look for the small sign above your head.  You'll miss it if you blink!

d1sLYlfSzHo6WCpfe-j7zg.review_text: I'm giving this place just 3 stars.  Maybe it was because my bf and I were really tired at the moment when we arrived here and took us awhile to find it since it's kind of hidden in a small alley street.  The atmosphere itself was casual and fun and I can see myself around several friends just talking and having a few drinks here.  They had good beers on tap fortunately (I had a Mirror Pond while my bf had a Boddington) which makes it a "bonus" in my book.  It was a warm night when we had one of those heatwaves the other week and inside was burning hot so we took a seat outside.  It gets pretty crowded and packed so noise levels are high depending who you have surrounding you.  Overall it was a good place but not being a native San Franciscan I can find myself lost trying to find this place again which may put a damper in my night...that said I may just walk past this place and opt for a more "clear" location

d_jFqEuSL5PIH7QPsJrdyA.review_text: Yesterday, I was with a large group of people following a professional club meeting. There were, maybe, 20 of us in an inside room at the Irish Bank. Other than our group, there was only 1 couple in the large room. It may be that the inside bar was also busy and the outdoor patio busy as well. A waiter came by to take orders but I was indecisive as to whether I was hungry or not so I just asked for water. Later on as the evening progressed, I started getting hungry and flagged a waiter to ask for an order of fries. I waited and waited and waited. I felt as if my group would leave soon and I wouldn't get my food, so I got up and walked towards the doorway of the kitchen. Before I got there, there was a waiter also approaching the entrance of the kitchen planning on going in. I asked, "Is it possible to check on my order of fries?" The waiter peeked into the kitchen and said, "Yes, it looks like your fries are on the counter. We'll bring it to you." Okay, I just went back to my seat and continued my conversation. A few moments later, a man in a vest (who I presume was the manager) came over and said," Lady, don't go to the kitchen and ask for your food. We're really busy here," he waves to the large group of tables we've put together for my group,"and we'll bring the food to you when we're ready." This in a very angry tone. I've never had someone (a restaurant manager) try to chew me out in front of friends in any situation. I value politeness and courtesy. These are values that I grew up with and so, for someone to do this in a setting that is "supposed" to be geared toward customer service it is T-O-T-A-L-L-Y unacceptable behavior. I understand the wait staff was stressed. I understand I was in a large party of 20 people - for which we were bringing business to this establishment. Unfortunately, because of this experience, I will N-O-T ever return to the Irish Bank Bar. And I will not recommend it to any of my friends or acquaintances. Ever.

qstOF_b3pvyVPyq4Qsyw-A.review_text: Came here the day BEFORE St. Patty's and it was already packed. My friends and I enjoyed some good drinks and decent food.  I myself had the Irish beef stew and it was fairly tasty. Service is pretty good even with it packed like crazy. Our waitress was attentive and was prompt with everything. We were being pretty long with ordering and didn't even order that much for staying that long so she was being extremely patient with us.  I like how there was outdoor seating since the inside is super small and its all under an awning so no worries if it rains. Just wear a jacket and order some whiskey.

G2FVUXuLEGc2fDTWFaQplw.review_text: "Bless your little Irish heart and every other Irish part"...as they say   Especially the Irish part such as that stomach of yours once you head on over to the Irish Bank  Love this charming little bar & restaurant tucked away in an alley at the Financial District  Growing up, corned beef was in a can and we ate it with fried rice...loaded with preservatives but it was damn good, I admit, but it was an awesome surprise that I finally got to taste the real thing   Corned beef & cabbage was served in a warm plate with buttery mashed potatoes, tangy golden mustard and fresh sauerkraut. The corned beef was prepared as if you can pull the beef apart...so juicy and seasoned to perfection. The cabbage was steamed, easy to eat & salted just right  Plus you can savor the meal in such as quaint restaurant setting...great for dates or a night out with your friends. I came by after 5PM on a Thursday and the place was filled with the happy hour crowd...you can make it lively or relaxing  Their famous Reuben sandwich is a try on my next visit

ZP7TXAhrL76h6xU3a1BYtQ.review_text: After a morning and early afternoon of sight seeing we happened on this place. At first we almost missed it because the sign announcing we had arrived led us into a sushi bar instead of an Irish pub. We quickly realized we needed to venture down the alley. Our bartender was awesome and the regulars were great. The food was above average for bar food. I had the macaroni and cheese and the philly cheese steak. The bread was soft, the steak was well-seasoned and the peppers and cheese completed this yummy goodness. I will definitely be visiting this bar again!!

IucvvxdQXXhjQ4z6Or6Nrw.review_text: ******AVOID AVOID AVOID.*****  Pains me to write a 1 star review after 2 consecutive 5 star reviews but truth has to be told.  I had a reservation for Irish Bank for a party of 14. The bouncer(I think) up front greeted us and seemed nice. We were then ushered in by the hostess who left us in this room without any communication. After standing around awkwardly for 10 mts, we decided to seat ourselves and we moved a couple of tables together. Out comes the waiter who very rudely says "NO NO NO". He then moves some other tables around. I guess you have a system which I can appreciate but don't leave guests unattended without any communication and don't be so f*^&ing rude.  We should have left at that point but I decided to stay since I was not sure if I could find another place for a party of this size and did not want to make a scene. The waiter said his name was Jeffy or Jezzy or something like that. Super rude guy and was very rude and curt the rest of the evening to the point where multiple folks commented on it. It ruined the evening for me. Perhaps this dude needs to switch roles with the bouncer. Actually on second thought, this dude should not be in front of customers, put him in the back.   The food sucked and they don't serve beer in pitchers. I admit my view of the drinks and food are probably biased because of the service. There are way too many options in this area to put up with this S^&$. NEXT!

Rm1dH8jqMUZ9io4JduZrnA.review_text: I've had hit or miss experiences at the Irish Bank over the years.  I've been coming here since the days when the restaurant was called the Bank of Ireland.  (They had to change the name because they got in trouble with the real BOI.)   HITS: 1. Scoring a table outside on a balmy evening. 2. Scoring the table for two inside the confessional. 3. The delicious and spicy bloody mary the bartender made for me this past Sunday afternoon. (She even asked me whether it was for a hangover!!! No, it wasn't.)  MISSES: 1. How crowded this place gets. 2. Dinner two weeks ago. I had the Irish Stew. Never again. 3. The time, many moons ago, when they had two different prices posted for the bangers and mash. Of course, they charged me the higher price even though I ordered because I saw the lower price on the sign on Bush St. Stupid waitress needed to learn a thing or two about customer service.

bOOCp9GYVg6BTyLsfNer0w.review_text: Fish and chips (sometimes I substitute the fries for a caesar salad)...and a Leffe. Perfection. :)

Ii2yQ3qHWu9mbF1pzCpGoQ.review_text: I love the idea of this place. The out door patio is huge. It's dive-y without being dirty and the bathroom is decently clean . The food is awful but really its what you should expect from a pub. The beer selection is okay. Sit outside order an import and don't over think it. You'll probably fall in love with this place.

gxdM4KPbf3Ckb5z8qgKk0A.review_text: Basically, the Irish Bank is the place to go if you want to hit up a popular happy hour spot with outside tables.    Sit outside, chill out, and order two beers at a time (and don't worry about how often the waitress comes).    The food's pretty good; I like the curry fries.  If you go expecting a high-touch, reasonably priced place, you will be disappointed.  If you go looking for a crowded, non-dressy but trendy place to have a beer. You'll have a good time.    Things to remember- the bartenders are Irish- don't ask about the red wine (or drink it).  Order a Smitticks or a shot of Powers.  Good: Outside Seating; Great Scotch Selection; Actual Irish Bartenders The Neutral: Food is standard Pub Food The bad: Expensive, so-so service

Wlb-k9jXifJHotEhiAcRRg.review_text: Came for lunch...wasn't bad, wasn't great

fojptcVycoRhrLUU7XSSNg.review_text: If you're looking for a legitimate hole in the wall, I can assure you this is a place you'd want to stop by and visit.  It's literally hard to find, you'll be driving back and forth trying to figure out where Mark Ln is.  My suggestion, find a parking spot and walk.  Came here the other night after the University of Pennsylvania Wharton seminar.  I was a bit over dressed but none the less, I wasn't treated any different.  It was around nine at night and the chilly winter air was a bit rough but I was determined to find a pub, get sloshed, eat some fish and chips, and head on home for the next day's 12 hours shift.    The alley way was filled with chairs and tables.  Lighting was at a dark red and the heaters were up to warm the bodies outside.  The decor is exactly what you'd expect from a whole in the wall.  Metal placards hung all over the wall, relaxing atmosphere, something I needed after a night of ass kissing.    My boyfriend ordered the Ruben Sandwich, which was fantastic.  The meat melted in your mouth.  I almost felt like stealing his plate, but I decided against it.  I ordered the fish and chips.  Lemme give you the best word of advice that'll help you out tremendously, fork over the tarter sauce onto the fish and then shovel little nemo into your mouth.  Picking and prodding at it with your fork is senseless.  Fish is cooked so well that it'll melt right off of your fork.

nOVsttdAgSSpDIV1rrqPrw.review_text: My friend and I decided to get dinner today after she got off work.  She had heard of this place from coworkers and wanted to try it.  Being 20 we had to eat outside and split the potato skins and fish and chips.  The potato skins were good but the fish and chips were...weird.  No flavor and the fish was hard. gross.  We sent it back and the waiter apologized and brought us some chicken nachos which were pretty good.  All the food came out really fast which was nice.  After seeing other reviews saying the fish and chips are good I might have to try them again another day.  I liked the whole alleyway atmosphere.  As it got darker they lowered some sun shades and turned on the lights which made it a little warmer.  I will definitely come back!

3wXdRCsmTConfr5bNw1ZIQ.review_text: Great Shephards Pie and Mac and Cheese! Awesome atmosphere and great service. A really good find at the end of an alley.

bSXsFCM3ehm42DioaqtqPw.review_text: The service is terrible as is the overpriced/bland food. Went for a bloody mary and it was flavorless and not spicy at all even though I stressed to the waitress that I wanted my drink very spicy, making a bloody mary isn't that hard to make and my directions aren't hard to follow. The owner is rude and completely incompetent and after a friend recent encounter (See Chris D's 1 star review which I can voucher for) I'm over this over-hyped bar.   If you have a simple palate and simple mind then this place is perfect for you...but the outdoor seating is nice...so there's that I guess.

b0fp-eS8_MKTg4tcZsCNqQ.review_text: Let me just say this: I'm a HUGE fan of Irish pubs. And while this isn't necessarily a tiny little pub, it's decor, sports games, old fashioned posters and selection of beers on tap make it a wonderful, not-so-little Irish pub.  The food is pretty solid, too. Try a burger or the cheese steak with peppers. Make sure to visit on a warmer day so you can enjoy the "patio" in the alley...

JvQRbZYdMGuuDqTArles2g.review_text: My girlfriend and I dropped in for the heck of it and thought the Irish Bank was a great place to put back a few Guinness and Smithwicks!  Super friendly people and staff... it helped that the weather was phenomenal and we had a whole day to ourselves.  Split our time between the alley and inside seating... kept locking eyes with black and white picture of the old lady on the wall... hmmmmmm.... luckily I didn't drink to the point where she was talking to me, but an interesting set of decor.

jC2M3AwTo0uQxss6kCTfbg.review_text: we love coming here for company happy hours. this place has outdoor seating as well as a private section that is big enough to accommodate for a large group. great staff, great service, and delicious chicken wings. it's a great place to have drinks after work!

Dw6yia0s2PgLOzaFTBNGwA.review_text: Like Mark Lane, Like that there's Heat Lamps, Like the Long Tables, Like the Small Pub Room, Like the Drinks, Like the prices: $5 to $16, Like the Fries with Vinegar, Like the Waitress, Uber Dislike the bland Fish and Chips I ate on a a Friday night happy-hour at the soulful Irish pub tucked away in a Financial District alley. I think the Leprechaun hiding inside might have prepared it. I had to overdose on Tums, thanks.

9pPaERETfcOkh1GtjEg-fQ.review_text: Service is slow. Shepherd's pie still frozen in the center. Strange dank, musty smell... totally authentically Irish!!!

2dubkVlMgh3-QZbVXqEplQ.review_text: Food: sausage tastes like frozen fatty nitrate sausage. Shepard's pie was crap, had a strong underlying ketchup taste. Sweet.  Only come here for beer.

JSPE5bMOg6rAKvKVEdfIXw.review_text: After my fifth time here, I figure it's time to finally write my review for Irish Bank? Besides I think the waitress knows our work group and our drink orders by heart now.  My usual Maker's and Ginger is quite refreshing to absorb into my bloodstream, while watching people wander in and out of the cool and breezy alley way on a hot summer's day. And heavenly for those days when I'm craving a Smithwicks - even better being on tap! Plus their bathroom has a good feel to it (yes, I know it's odd to say that, but it's very true!)   Their fries come with a delicious curry dipping sauce and their mac 'n cheese is a creamy delicious puddle topped with bread crumbs in just the right proportion that surprisingly was pulled off very well.  Seeing as how I have an obsession with finding places with good mac n' cheese and nice bathrooms, Irish Bank is a definite work night excuse to relax and have knock a few back.

O96xqRJ8NghRgWOjDoPNXw.review_text: I seem to be handing out 4 stars like a mad woman as of late.....Irish Bank deserved it yesterday - after reading many a review I think we were lucky by coming here on a lazy Sunday afternoon, thus not having the nightmare of the after work crowd....  First off, I loved the outdoor area in the alley - I told my husband this place was darling and he looked at me with the strange look. He pretty much asked if I had bumped my head because I had been here before. I had to remind him that it must have been one of his other wives he has scattered around the Bay, because I had never been here. He quickly realized he used to come here and meet his mom when she worked in the city - um thanks.....  I love that this place feels like a real Irish dive - dark and dingy and full of great beer and spirits. Of course my pregnant ass was stuck drinking non-alcoholic crap while my husband enjoyed his Guiness, bastard.   Anyhow, we ordered up the fish and chips - I was honestly expecting a plate of crap. What I got was a plate of decent food. The fish was fresh and had a light batter that was not greasy. The chips were tasty and not greasy either.....good tarter to top it off with my vinegar - at least I get to enjoy food!  I can't wait to come back in a few months and devour a Leffe on tap and a good whiskey......Im so sad Im going to cry just thinking about it.

k0U_y-82xmNg6kIbM2rMaw.review_text: Hidden away in the bustle of downtown SF, this bar is a real Irish haunt complete with actual Irish bartenders. Adorable alley dotted with tables reminiscent of something you'd find in Europe welcomes you as you enter the bar. Good beer selection. Great place to watch a football match or get some grub.

VNkEB5PlrESiPP6-3JR-xg.review_text: This place has FUN written all over it! The inside has a great "bar" atmosphere with lots of Irish paraphernalia... The patio- that is where the gold is. The patio is great, lots of room and lots of seats. This place is tucked away and hidden enough not to be "hip" but known well enough to stay busy.  We did not try the food- but that will come at a later time; the beer was great though!

5OTcr4fweDncUExyGXiAcQ.review_text: Awesome atmosphere inside and outside in the alley. Great service.  Perfect Guinness.  A very easy place to hang out for a while.  40 million times better than Johnny foleys and their geriatric beach boy cover band.    Guy at the door was friendly and funny.

088SkMN7Hjn2vK2MEUfc3Q.review_text: Irish Bank has a lot going for it, but doesn't really deliver a great experience.  It's got a decent location, with a ton of outdoor seating.  On the other hand, all the tables are on cobblestone, and wobble every which way.  The tap's great, but the prices are a buck too high.  The dishes are reasonably priced, but are hit-and-miss (my friend ordered a very carelessly-made Caesar Salad, but my bratwurst and kraut was delicious).  Given the food, I'd definitely go back if I was hanging out in the neighborhood and hankering for a filling meal.

82dCHyU-ANOgdhxUgZsUeg.review_text: I dropped by here for a quick drink while waiting for a show to start in Hotel Nikko. I like how this place is tucked away in an alleyway only for those who look to find. I came in and found a seat at the bar. I ordered a Smithwicks beer. When I had this beer in South Korea, the pour was amazing with the creamiest head. Here, it was nothing like that and I was pretty unsatisfied. With that said, If you're going to buy some brew here, get the Guinness since it comes from a "special tap" and they serve it in the Guinness glasses. I probably would've been 100% better than the Smithwicks.  Inside is pretty cozy without that many seats/tables. Service seemed pretty crappy but I expect that from any Irish pub. This is one of the few bars I would prefer going to in downtown SF--everything else is too touristy.

rsFI8nyKH_-Du5Jnd7v58A.review_text: This place has horrible customer service. The bar manager spends most of his time scowling at people and the wait staff disappear for long stretches of time. Don't bother showing up with a group- even if you call days in advance- as they really seem to hate that.

jQA9IcOveMGwCfrdktmkpA.review_text: The service was good and the bar itself was nice, they were willing to put my game on even though it was out of town.

667rHxvouloafUEQUYhBZA.review_text: Certainly a pub to be visited, somewhere nice and warm.  Well, this is a place I will remember fondly when I return home after my holiday.   Lets begin with the location, FANTASTIC! The pub is located on mark lane all by it's self and it helps to create a feel that you are away from the hustle and bustle of the financial district. The decorations of the pub help to make you feel right at home, it has a rather nice cottage feeling & the amount of TV's are not overwhelming.  The selection of beer is great, although it is a great shame that they have no local beers on tap. The price as well is reasonable, and the soda fountain with free refills is a nice touch. The food as well is a great selection of some local area ideas and traditional food. The Potato Skins are a must for anyone wanting a cheap main meal!  The staff are what really make this pub one of the best in San Francisco, they are fun and remember any one who goes in. They offer helpful advice and if you go by your self, like moi, you end up chatting away to them. I would recommend the staff be allowed to have a drink or two behind the bar, but each owner to his own.  A home away from home, and a must no matter what!

M271Ac7UKVaQ9U5AOvc_9A.review_text: A tough week inspired my friend and me to go for a mid-Friday mac 'n cheese and beer.  Genius idea?  I think so.  Congratulations, self, you're officially smart.  Really brilliant, if I may.  So, we headed to Irish Bank for some good food and a heaping of great company.  It was a windy day, so we chose to sit inside.  Since we arrived around 11:45, it was empty, but as we sat and waited, the room slowly filled up.  We each ordered a beer (love that they have a cider on tap, whee), and my friends had the BLT, mac 'n cheese, and vegetarian shepherd's pie, while I opted for the Irish Beef Stew.  Totally a fan of the mac 'n cheese, although I'm glad I only tried a bite, since ordering it would've instantly put me in a food coma, thus rendering me unproductive and unable to function for the rest of the day.  My beef stew was really delicious too, with a large dollop of mashed potatoes on top.  At first I was concerned that there were too many juices for the stew portion, but the potatoes soaked it up nicely and my bowl was cleaned off pretty well.  Again, congratulations, self, for having such a big appetite.  You're officially a fatty.  One of the pricier lunches for the area, although it's definitely not your typical grab-and-go deals in the Financial District.  Perfectly cozy for a cold day, nice breezy alley to sit outside when it's nice and warm.  Definitely a fan of their selection of food and libations.  And for those of you wondering, I still ended up being in a food coma at work.  Luckily, it was an early day for me.

XMm7FsdMuJgJ7gpmM1Npfw.review_text: I LOVE this place!  This place brings SO many memories!!! (Hang outs, random meets with strangers, birthday celebrations, dates, etc.)  Low key, private dive restaurant/bar, fun crowd during big sports finals, outdoor seating on an alley street!    The outdoor seating is great on a nice SF day or night!    Staff is helpful, service is fast!  Bar has tvs!  Variety of beer.  Food is priced fair, good selection of couple of Irish foodies - cabbage with corn beef hash, etc.  This place is good for groups especially outside.  This is one of my FAVE SF bars!

88Es01sQHe5ZOiu3lUXUKQ.review_text: Got together with some friends for some drinks after work. Cute outdoor seating and chill place to relax and chat

aPKqBCsETmI816-BwKurAw.review_text: The food was okay, but the service was terrible. It was on a Wednesday night and not even busy. Took forever to get our drinks and even longer to order our meal. Way over priced!!!  Never again!

nP5HEr4Xttd5doT0XTgBtw.review_text: WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE I've had in years from the waitress and the owner.   I had an open tab at the bar and so did my my coworker. We were one drink in and our blonde waitress asked if we wanted another drink. We let her know we had tabs at the bar and she kindly agreed to take our orders for a second round saying if it was only maybe two beer rounds including the one we ordered with her, we were fine.  We ordered food and were enjoying our drinks, the ambiance of being off work and being able to relax after a 11/12 hour day when a dark haired waitress came to our table to take our order. She let us know our blonde waitress was on break. She asked my coworker for her drink and my coworker let her know we had an open tab. She reluctantly took the order and then asked me if I wanted a drink. I too ordered and then let her know I also had an open tap at the bar. The waitress made a face, said "oh no. You can order at the bar!" And walked away abruptly.  The waitress walked away from my table. She made a face. She also refused us service for no reason.   I went into the bar, calm and collected and reasonably asked for a manager. While I waited for the manager to appear, the dark haired waitress came up to me and said I have your drink (a margarita). I let her know it wasn't my drink (I was drinking an IPA) and she said "your friend ordered it." I let her know I needed to speak to her manager and told her to please go get him. She continues to try and argue with me before I told her to please leave me alone and get her manager. She ran off.   The manager came up to me and asked what was wrong. He was a tall Irish man and I was told HE WAS THE OWNER. I explain the situation and he said he had issues with the dark hair waitress before. He went off to inquire with his waitress.   All the while the waitress had gone back and given my coworker the drink she had previously tried offering me inside the bar.  She apparently profusely apologize to my table and gave my coworker the drink telling her she put it on her tab. Only 5 minutes ago she had refused service.   While I waited, I figured I would buy another beer. Why not, right? I was merely going to explain the situation to the manager. My drink arrived and the "owner" returned. His words were the worst. "So your friends accepted the drink. What's your problem? Why are you complaining. You're the only one that has a problem."   FIRST the dude never went to our table to inquire with my coworkers. He merely spoke to his pathetic excuse for a waitress.   SECOND he basically blamed me for his bull SH!? waitress' HORRIBLE customer service.   I asked for this man's name and he replied with, "you don't have to know that." My response was "you're the owner and you're not going to stand by your bar? What's your name?" He repeated himself. So I handed him my beer and told him I would like my money back. He got angry with me and told his bar tenders to void my open tab. I NEVER ASKED HIM TO DO SO. He them asked me to leave.   This man escalated the situation and blamed me for his horrible employees customer service who was trying to cover her ass. This "owner" asked me to leave and said I threw my beer at him which I did not. I merely went in to convey the HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE. This man was angry. Why? Because I said I didn't want my beer anymore and wanted my card refunded for the beer after he tried giving me cash? WHAT KIND OF OWNER DOESNT GIVE HIS NAME AND DOESNT STAND BY HIS BAR?   Our company will not ever return to this bar and I'll make sure they don't. I'll spread the word to avoid stopping here after work and having other fiends stop here. This place can have their HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE. I'll keep my money.

KCaOZUnCx25FJhFr_lKsEg.review_text: The Irish Bank is a popular meeting spot among my circle of friends, for times when we're waiting on shoppers at Union Square or grabbing a drink before going to nearby venues in the TL or SOMA.  On tap beer selection is OK -- it may not appeal to everyone, but I'm more than happy given that there is Magner's(!!) on tap as well as Leffe, Lagunitas and Mirror Pond.  From what I remember, their wine selection is terrible.  Mixed drinks are strong!   I've eaten here but it didn't leave an impression.. not sure if that's good or bad, given that it's pub food.  Service can be a little slow sometimes, weirdly, I've had the best service when it's been crowded, and the worst service when it's slow.  The outdoor seating is covered and open even in poor weather.  Nice for groups if you've dressed warmly.

WbEcyPmZT7j15CzncVBu7g.review_text: Nice heating area outside, but the food was terrible. Not only was it terrible, it's expensive. Most boring and bland nachos ever for $10. It was literally some salsa on chips. Vegetable quesadilas, 0 flavor. To top it off, our waitress had a piss poor attitude the entire time. Stay away.

2Yg3D3xUNNzmn-SicXZOnA.review_text: The crowd is older and somewhat business-y. It's really, really chilled in there. I like the selection of liquor and beer they offer here, but I wish the service would be better. The bartender that served my friend and I weren't exactly too welcoming, but he did make me a pretty strong and good cocktail, haha.

iGiiFT05Wkx61Cu8Kga9cA.review_text: Great food, great service, AWESOME atmosphere!   The shepherd's pie and fish 'n chips were so good. The seating is legit pub style, there is outdoor seating that is pretty cool too. The fact that this is an ally restaurant should not deter you in the slightest, in fact you should go there because it is. The place is a hole in the wall.  Would I go here again? Heck yeah! Should you go here? Hell to the yeah!

q9yFm0uonn4c5PftlhvzlA.review_text: Here is the deal.  As my buddy says- this bank may need to diversify it's bonds.   Atmosphere: It's an Irish pub straight out of Ireland.  Except for the boys in suits who like to go out play after work and the tenders behind the counter that really don't know how to pour a Guinness.  This place gets very packed very quickly.  Price: It's well over priced with a pint costing you about $6.   Food: Skip it.  However, like any Irish pub, or pub for that matter- it's really about the quality of time you will have there. I go here about every Thursday with my mates, not because we like the food (we don't) or enjoy buying rounds that break the bank (no pun intended). It's because the place -with it's alley and bar that has oak barrels to rest your pint on- is conducive to good conversation and good laughs.

sjXC5pTebfGMZzP-9fpxTw.review_text: The Irish Bank?!?? More like The Irish BLAND!!!!   Wild Field Greens Salad?!?? More like MILD Field Greens Salad!!!!   Irish Beef Stew?!?? More like Irish Beef BORING!!!! (I couldn't think of a witty word substitute for this one...)  The salad consisted of wilted greens on the brown side, blue cheese that tasted like dirty dishwater and soft, almost chewy, walnuts.  The boiled whole potato placed on top of this dish of tasteless brown-colored liquid thingy they tried to pass off as "Beef" "Stew" was the "most" "flavorful" thing about it.  For pub food on the pricey side (around $10-20+ a person), I should experience some sort of flavor explosion in my mouth. Or at the very least a semi-good time.  Instead, I faced the gastronomic equivalent of sitting through Ben Stein's recital of The Compleat and Unabridged History and Genesis of Canadian Barley.  In half-speed.   While drinking watered-down decaffeinated coffee.  And wearing J. Crew chinos.

jjuxiwKoiz8voegbWEJVMg.review_text: I did not have the luck o' the Irish with me when I visited The Irish Bank & Bar during Happy Hour a few months back.  Three Chimays and four Irish Car Bombs deep, I left this quaint little alleyway pub and stumbled home.  I proceeded to throw up for a solid 4 hours after that.  Those are not the fondest of memories I have of this place, nor the $500+ bar tab that we (my 10 or so co-workers and I) managed to rack up in a few hours.  But I can say that I had a good time, all told.  Next time I just have to remember my old friend Moderation.

UvRUygcyvpJuHh1BiZrrbQ.review_text: Good local Irish bar, I've had excellent times here. When its nice out they have outside seating in the alley way which is nice. Not to much to say here, good bar, good location in Union Sqaure.

a-CtXGkmHkaaXSvnOLFxOg.review_text: It's a fun place to go with a rowdy group on a nice day if you want to sit on the patio. The servers are friendly but they're always overwhelmed with giant mobs of customers. As a result you'll sit at a crowded table for hours getting a couple drinks at a time, drinking way too much beer and wishing you ordered more blue cheese fries.

zFQnGH2aXZkP3gK7OIgcig.review_text: CUH-REE FRIES! CUH-REE FRIES!   Curry fries. That alone warrants 5 out of 5 stars. First of all, the fries are obnoxiously big, measuring approximately 1" in width, and a good 4" in length. Size matters, know this. They throw a hearty helping into a decent sized basket - and there in the middle is where you find the magic. The curry. Dip your fries in, take a deep breath, and bite down. You will be content with life.   This place also introduced me to the Shepperd's Pie (beef), of which I cannot fail to mention. It's steaming hot and extremely delish.   The inside of the bar can get quite crowded, but don't fret! There's a large patio seating area with picnic benches that will comfortably fit a decent crowd of good timers.  CUH-REE FRIES!

a5bVNQAqI_oYrHq0oLMGkQ.review_text: ..was here on a game night one night (Giants)..The crowd had good energy and they seemed to be enjoying themselves.  We sat at the isolated booth area (was the only table avail) and i actually liked it - it was cozy and private=) I had the fish and chips and a glass of hef. AND i loved it! I want to go back!  The best part, of course, was to be at an Irish bar w/ an Irish! haha! We had a great time... I would go back to this place- nice irish pub decor , friendly staff, good crowd.. and good fish and chips! heuheuheu.

v4fT6mIxgjho_CLR2wiXvg.review_text: Stopped in for a drink while visiting for a business trip. Small inside, but nice outside seating.

oHTVSfHZDLTDHniUuRjVXQ.review_text: Got off work early and stopped in for a quick Gunness. i asked the bartender if this was real Irish Guinness or San Francisco Guinness. just stares at me. maybe its the accent so I repeated the joke. I do not think he gets it what is with that her?  maybe its all the cold weather but we like to make a lot of jokes and tease where I am from. the food smelled good but I wanted bar banter after my shift.. and one last thing there are lots of big strong looking men in suits up this alley ladies. good and burly like our Southern gentlemen but with suits on!

arY2V-MtKksRAoqd-dVYOQ.review_text: You don't go to an Irish bar and restaurant and skip out on Irish drinks!  Thanks to the suggestion of my Irish friend I had a Magners Cider, very tasty and reminded me of the German Radler.  Don't be shady folks, they will check your id.  Gets nice and crowded on a Thursday night.  Service is pretty quick and easy.  Food is decent, but goes well with your beer.  Yum.

WVFIDOTMScwmnAzlNcrgjw.review_text: I'm sorry, when was it ever okay to treat your customers like they are all rude drunken idiots no matter how busy and hectic the place gets. The moment I sat down, our service was nothing more than terrible. I flagged down a waitress after being ignored for a while and our interaction goes as follow:  Me: Hi, excuse me; can we order some food through you? Waitress: Yes, but I can't do split checks. Me: Ok. But can we split it two ways... Waitress: NO. That was the first thing I said. I can't split the bill. Me: Oh Sorry, I meant on two credit cards. Waitress: Yes. But I can't do it on more than two cards. And there must be a minium of  $10 dollars per card. Me: Ok. That's fine. I'll have the wings and my friends here wants some fries. Waitress: You do realize that's only 15 dollars right? You must order at least $20 dollars. Me: Ok, give me another beer.  So she storms off and disappears. My friends later meets up with us and sits down at a different table and tries to order some more food. Again, they were met with a similar situation from the same waitress with the condescending and bitchy tone. We weren't even sitting at the same table but she forced us to lump our bills together for some reason or another. She then proceeds to to get into an argument with my friend for even having the audacity for asking to split the bill again (even though she was unaware of the situation) and was firm in making sure we were all grouped together under one bill. I understand that whole multiple transaction thing can get annoying but it is never ok to speak to your customers with a short tone and make it seem like they're burdening you with the worse job in the world. It wasn't until we got our bill that I realize the waitress just wanted to tack on the mandatory gratuity to our bill since we were a big group. Good move waitress, I know you depend on tips for your salary but tips should be earned and not something you try to force onto your customers. You work in the service industry, please learn some manners and how to treat your customers with respect.  I know I should have escalated this to a manager that night instead of passive aggressively writing this review on yelp but oh well, what's done is done. I am never returning to this place again.

PbODJ54SCptD7RwXqWZQnA.review_text: One drunk bartender = failed experience. Barely serviced our group yesterday even though bar was barely busy as it was a sunday night. He kept forgetting our drinks we ordered. Mr Drunk tried to make us pay our tab twice as well (sheesh).   But we should have taken it as a sign when my first drink was poured in a chipped glass. Apparently pouring whats in the glass into a new one with an extra splash is supposed to solve the issue. Lucky for this bar i didnt swallow glass that night.   On top of it all due to our bad experience he kicks us out early because he was unhappy of his deserving tip. Poor drunk bartender couldnt even figure out how to lock the door. Good thing he didnt swing any punches as he yelled in our faces while kicking us out or he might have stumbled to the ground in his drunken stupor.   First bar in the city for me and my experience started off with a bang. Good job Irish Bar... What a way to treat your customers

Wz0skpHDQ7skaqfVIkbhew.review_text: Came here to celebrate a co-worker's birthday, there was a group of 8 people. I HATE HATE Irish carbombs so I passed on the first two but indulged on the last round. still HATE them! anyway i had the Calamari, and it was really good! We sat outside, it was a little chilly but they have a few heaters out so it wasn't too bad. I like the ambiance, we're outside with a bunch of random strangers. It's pretty cool. The best thing about this place is probably the Chimay =) Our bill came out to about $400, YIKES!!!!! They added 20 % gratuity!!! UGH.... thumbs down for how expensive it came out to but thumbs up on the experience.  Will definitely come again.. plus it's down the street from my work place =)

MxC6vFBs6NGuN1j236413w.review_text: Points of interest  1. It's hidden in an alleyway off the street in union square. I like that you have to know where it is in order to get there.   2.  Shepard's pie is alright.   3.  There's a smoke cloud billowing outside because you can smoke there. Even cigars.

8oFZEpX00zZS1Dku2aKfcQ.review_text: Thoroughly enjoyed this location for happy hour with some gals after work on a Friday evening.  - Phenomenal listings of beers - what more could you ask for? - a fun setting with a cute alleyway - fun group of yuppie people - good bar foods to munch on  order drinks, grab some apps to munch on and you're good to go!  Great place to start off your evening/weekend!

xceJT1G2Yhel3W2lRxRTDA.review_text: The Irish Bank gets my 600th Yelp review because I never thought I'd find the place again... let me explain.    Waaaay back in the day, we're talking 12 years ago when I was barely 21, I came to SF for vacation.  I was a younger, more naive girl then but I was still very adventurous.  Unfortunately, I was with a group of friends who were quite dull and only wanted to do the top touristy stuff.  Well, I split off from my party to explore SF in my way.  On my way around town I met these 2 local kids who, after a glass of Chianti and long conversation on Italian Hill, drove me around SF on their cool retro motorcycles.  It was fun times.  Later that night when my friends didn't show up at our motel and the pre-arranged meeting time, I called the boys again and they came and took me to a hidden Irish pub that I never knew the name of, where I enjoyed my first Guinness.  I thought I'd never find it again...   Fast forward to last Saturday...  I met a group of friends at a hidden lil Irish pub that Crys B had picked out randomly from Yelp reviews and, you guessed it... it was my mysterious pub from a decade ago!  Yay!!  I can't believe I found it after all these years.  Good times and good memories...   That being said, the drinks were strong, crowd friendly and there's a room in the back that had plenty of seating with a fireplace.    My bacardi/diet was 7$ and my friends Stella was 6$.  Don't know the rest of the pricing but that seemed fair for SF.    The place got packed for a while but was still manageable.   The only problem was the bathroom.  It was durrrrty when we arrived at 9:30 and already had only 1 toilet because the other way way out-of-order.  It'd be nice if they had checks through-out the night or at least before the drinking hours begin.  Ok, we'd also have liked a lil music in the backroom.   I liked the outside patio they had when we first arrived too.  It was closed later in the night though so I'm not sure what time they pull the tables in for that.    We'll probably be back since this is a fun Irish pub with Smithwick's, Murphy's and such... and good seating options.    See ya there!

6s-g2vFu12OemhiK3FJuOQ.review_text: Make a withdrawal at the Irish Bank, and drink! Just eat elsewhere beforehand.  We looked up the Irish Bank ("the safest bank in the world!") on a GPS and were led to a slightly uninviting alleyway lined with dumpsters. Was this the right place?  It was! Nestled around the corner of this L-shaped alley was the Irish Bank's charmingly-lit, outdoor seating area - turns out the other end of the alley is where folks are expected to stumble in from! We seated ourselves inside (next time, I sit outside) in a side room, which we had to ourselves practically the entire evening.  Service was good: server Jessie provided an iPod to keep us entertained, and he kept us plied with beer, a round of Irish car bombs, and several kinds of shots.  Food was standard fare, sadly. We shared odd-breaded wings, fried chicken fingers (with a honey mustard sauce), and an Irish Bank burger (cooked medium rare) that a deep pour of HP sauce helped, but I left a bit unsatisfied. Thank goodness I was too buzzed to care at the time.

v-kh_W7iWpKOIux2Gx2q1g.review_text: It's a classic (not classy) place with an awesome outdoor area (heaters included). The food is typical bar food with an irish twist...did someone say cornbeef and cabbage, and the beer selection is decent. The bar itself has a fireplace (nice), and we were greeted by no shortage of peeps in santa costumes. Apparently, there were a few "parades" today - at the castro, embarcadero and hooters? We were skeptical as to the value of daisy duke santa shorts. The BLTs were mmm mmm good.

qMHVlmwHBw0V0ErS1chRTQ.review_text: Great food and fast service! I ordered the turkey melt and fries and was very impressed. Also, I tried everyone I went with's food and everything was on point. I highly recommend.
